name: Midtown West
space: I'm in a perfect location of Manhattan, being in Midtown West or 'Hell's Kitchen'. The apartment is walkable to Time Square, the theater district, and Rockefeller Center, let alone, the great neighborhood of Hell's Kitchen and great restaurants on Ninth Ave.  I rent to only one or two people and you would have the whole place to yourself, while I move out.  I am only able to rent for six nights or less.     You get all the clean linens and towels you need.  You have access to my high speed modem, or free Wi-Fi, but would need your own laptop for computer/internet access.  Apartment also has 2 tvs, 3 air conditioners, 8 windows, full size bed, and large couch.  It's perfect and rent-able for only one or two people, either being a couple or friends, because one can take the bed, and another the room with couch, where the door closes.  It's nothing fanc

name: Quiet Slice of Manhattan

If you are traveling with a child, the child counts as one of the two maximum.

name: Large Furnished Room Near B'way

I am flexible on the schedule so please ask.  Please note there is a cat in the living room.  The living room is a private place for the host. Also, because the place is close to the street, ther

name: Cozy Clean Guest Room - Family Apt
space: Stay in my family's little  guest room and enjoy privacy, a warm welcome, and security.  Your guest room is comfortable and clean.   It is small but well outfitted, has a single bed and a fabulous mattress which is firm and yet pillowy on top, all at the same time. The bathroom is shared and immediately across the hall. ("Shared" in the sense it isn't "en suite." The family will use our second bath while you are staying with us). The bathroom is fully supplied with shampoo, conditioner, scrub, soap, towels. There is a window air conditioner in summer, ceiling fan, abundant pre-war construction apartment heat.  No smoking. I leave out a simple self serve breakfast: granola, yogurt, fruit.  We may chat with you over coffee, or perhaps you'll hit us on a busy day when we are already out and have left the coffee for you to serve yourself. Coffee or tea are available anytime. name: Cute & Cozy Lower East Side 1 bdrm
space: PLEASE NOTE: do not automatically book with out messaging me first. Thanks! My apartment is a cute, cozy, 1 bdrm apt in the Lower East Side (LES) adjacent to Chinatown in lower Manhattan, steps to F train, East Broadway stop and very close to Canal/Delancey streets where many hip bars, restaurants and shops are in the LES. Apt is clean, has a fully equipped kitchen, cable TV, A/C, heat, and wireless internet. Apt is located on 2nd floor of well maintained walk up building. Walking distance to Soho, East Village, Little Italy, Chinatown and very close to Dumbo and Williamsburg, Brooklyn. You have place to yourself-better than a hotel!  Prices listed are for up to two people only. Possible to accommodate a 3rd (for extra charge), but ideal for two.   Nighty rate: $100 - $140 a night for up to two people depending on time of year. $10 extra per person after 2 people.  As of now, I prefer booking for minimum 7 days and more. Might make an exception to fill in time slots, so inquire anyway.

name: Beautiful 1br on Upper West Side

name: Upper West Side-Unique One Bedroom

name: Central Manhattan/near Broadway
space: The apartment is located on the 5th floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator. The guest room is small but quiet, with air conditioning and wi-fi. The bathroom is next to the guest bedroom.

name: Lovely Room 1, Garden, Best Area, Legal rental
space: Welcome to an historic, stunning 4-story Brooklyn house,  with one of Brooklyn's most beautiful gardens and large patio.  Park Slope is a very safe, quiet and friendly neighborhood.  140 year old house filled with light, color, artwork.  Three excellent SUBWAY LINES (R, F, G)   3 minutes walk.   I have a  LEGAL rental of  2 bedrooms on top floor with a clean, SHARED  bathroom.   Please write to me, and wait until I reply "yes!" Discounts available for longer stays. The main floor is my office; I  work here but you can help yourself to delicious  breakfast foods and enjoy the patio and garden.  Main floor is private later at night.    Upstairs:   2  very quiet, cozy rooms on TOP  floor,  medium size,  with closets. 1 room --  either 2 twins or  King bed, excellent mattress  1 room --  Queen bed excellent mattress SHARED BATHROOM.  Professionally cleaned. Sharing hasn't been an is

name: Airy Room on the fabulous UWS
space: PLEASE FILL OUT YOUR PROFILE & POST A PHOTO BEFORE YOU CONTACT ME, SO I KNOW WHO I'M DEALING WITH.  IF YOUR PROFILE & PHOTO ARE BLANK, OR IF YOU UPLOAD A PET, BABY PIC OR SOME ARTSY IMAGE INSTEAD OF A CLEARLY RECOGNIZABLE PHOTO OF YOU,  I PROBABLY WON'T RESPOND.  This airy room is my back room carpeted office/bedroom.  I can accommodate up to 2 people in this 12' square room but prefer to only host one person because it can get really snug with 2 people and their luggage.  You have a choice of either a pull-out sofabed or a comfy aerobed on the carpeted floor.  All linens, pillows + towels provided. The back room gets lots of light with windows on two sides (blinds on the windows to keep out the light in the am).  It has a 26" HD TV with remote control, clock radio, hair dryer,  desk lamp and overhead light/ceiling fan, A/C and a small desk & chair for your laptop (wi-fi throughout the apt). I also have a fax machine in case you need to receive one  (there is a charge to send a fax).

name: West Village Nest

name: Perfect for Your Parents + Garden
space: Are your parents coming to town? They'll love this space -- high-end Victorian townhouse. Very spacious and clean.  Garden-level space  with two large rooms, a kichenette and bathroom. King-size bed as well as queen-size sofa bed, bathroom with shower but no tub. Private entrance to unit. Huge private garden. Hi-definition 48-inch TV w/ cable. No oven or burner  but you'll get a microwave, refrigerator, sink and cutlery/dishes. You can use main kitchen upstairs if you really want to cook. Unit is not particularly sunny. Also please see Perfect for Parents, Part 2, for top-floor space that is also available for rent, should the whole family be in town. No stairs to negotiate here, though (two steps down into space). No air conditioning but has ceiling fan in living room and desktop fans.

name: Adorable, tons of light, Meatpacking
space: Hi.  Studio, extremely cute, pleasant, cheery, lots of natural light, comfortable, homey, and quiet. No sad generic / Ikea furniture or plastic. Well-equipped kitchen. Large bathroom (large for Manhattan, that is) with real bathtub! Bed is harder than average. High speed internet, etc. no TV (if you're coming to NYC to watch TV, something's wrong).  Discount possible if you stay for more than 14 days. It is an extremely cozy, warm little apartment, very nice for watching storms come hit the city, or for watching the snow fall in the park across the street. I am a heterosexual non-interior designer, so unlike most Airbnb ppl, the photos I show of my apartment are worse, not better than my apartment. In other words, the apartment is actually nicer than the photos.    The apartment is perfectly located, close to Meatpacking and Chelsea galleries and High Line, very close to several subway lines. Laundry and lots of food shopping (Chelsea Market plus a regular grocery store) are very close

name: Sweet and Spacious Brooklyn Loft
space: The apartment is an open-plan 1500 sq. ft. loft (140 sq m) with 5 large windows providing bright sunlight all day, located in an old factory building with many of the original finishes including tin ceilings, wooden beams and columns, and white brick walls. Very few of these original factory loft buildings remain in the neighborhood, and this space is quite special. Located in the very center of Williamsburg: just two blocks from the Bedford L train and two blocks from McCarren park! Stellar restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shopping are all steps away. Manhattan is just a 5-10 minute ride on the L train. The loft has a fully stocked kitchen with fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher, and everything you might need for cooking: great knives, pots and pans, a wide range of spices, kitchen tools, and a beautiful dining table.  There is a large bathroom, a custom cedar sauna for 5 (built by yours truly), a washer/dryer, and air conditioning.  For your entertainment, enjoy the sound-surround

name: Modern 1 BR / NYC / EAST VILLAGE
space: The east village offers a mixture of old school cool NY flavor and new school sophistication. Fun and unique boutiques and cafes line the streets. For some urban nature, Thompkins Square Park is just 1 block east. Although the neighborhood is lively and fun, the apartment is nice and quiet at night. As a designer in the interior/home field, I bring a unique element of style to my home. If you are interested in a classic, cool downtown experience in comfortable spot, this is for you!!!

name: Loft in Williamsburg Area w/ Roof
space: Hi there!  Available for short term stay is ONE of three separate small private rooms, each about 90 SF, with full bed mattresses lofted above the floor with some short steps up. There is a roof with some chairs and a good view of the Manhattan skyline. It's very near delis, fun bars, really great restaurants, awesome pizza, a nice cafe, 15 minute walk or 5 minute b24 bus ride to the Graham L subway stop and 15 minute walk to the Nassau G, and 30 minutes total travel time to Union Square. That is a central subway hub. From there you can get to Times Square, Grand Central, Chinatown, and Wall Street area in 5-10 minutes, or the major museums in 15 minutes. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Williamsburg, a very nice Brooklyn area with many great shops, restaurants, bars and a huge music scene. There are free transfers between the buses and trains. Also it's right off the Morgan exit of the BQE/395, which makes it a 10 minute, $20 dollar cab ride from LaGuardia and 20 minute $40 ride from JFK.

Interesting concave yellow bathroom tiles light up the bathroom. Bushwick is a vibrant community with lots of restaurants, bars, art galleries, cafes and street art. You will have use of a hair dryer. There are small windows in the bedroom and kitchenette area. The bathroom and kitchenette are all newly built. Full size bed sleeps 2 people. name: ENJOY Downtown NYC!
space: Your own comfy and private room with a queen size bed in the fun & vibrant, bohemian enclave of the East Village. An awesome location for exploring the city, NYC's best restaurants & bars, live-music and seeing how NYer's live.    Best for budget travelers looking for a safe, clean, convenient home base to experience NYC. It is in a three bedroom BASEMENT apartment with shared bathroom & kitchen. Two rooms are for traveling guests, sharing the apartment with my roommate & his wife.  Experienced Host - ask me any questions you may have and read some of the reviews. Hundreds of guests have enjoyed NYC from this humble abode, and I have made it quite comfy. For travelers wanting to be in an awesome neighborhood for an affordable price, this is one of the best options out there.  --------------------------------

There are many great restaurants and bars within walking distance.

We also have a Cuisinart 12-Cup Coffee maker.  The kitchen has an oven, microwave, dishwasher, refrigerator, and comes fully stocked with plates and glassware. space: The apartment has a kitchen and two bedrooms, one with a full size bed, and one with full lofted bed.  There are huge windows, which provide great sun light! The kitchen is equipped with a stove, silverware, microwave, coffee maker, blender, two Televisions, two Air Conditioners and a very comfy leather sofa.  There is a fast connection to the internet with WIFI throughout. The kitchen can be used to cook breakfast only, and is available to eat lunch and dinner, but not to cook these meals in.  However, the Microwave is always available! The apartment is in New York City's Best Location, right in the heart of it all, only steps to the famous Times Square and theater district. name: Room in Greenpoint Loft w/ Roof
space: Hi there!  Available for short term stay is ONE of three separate small private rooms, each about 90 SF, with full bed mattresses lofted above the floor with some short steps up. There is a roof with some chairs and a good view of the Manhattan skyline. It's very near delis, fun bars, really great restaurants, awesome pizza, a nice cafe, 15 minute walk or 5 minute b24 bus ride to the Graham L subway stop and 15 minute walk to the Nassau G, and 30 minutes total travel time to Union Square. That is a central subway hub. From there you can get to Times Square, Grand Central, Chinatown, and Wall Street area in 5-10 minutes, or the major museums in 15 minutes. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Williamsburg, a very nice Brooklyn area with many great shops, restaurants, bars and a huge music scene. There are free transfers between the buses and trains. Also it's right off the Morgan exit of the BQE/395, which makes it a 10 minute, $20 dollar cab ride from LaGuardia and 20 minute $40 ride from JFK.

name: Upper East Side  Charming 1 bd
space: Upper East Side / Carnegie Hill, 95th & Lexington, Charming prewar 1 bedroom apt , Great Upper East Side neighborhood "Carnegie Hill", 3 blocks to Central park and "Museum Mile" Easy walk to the Guggenheim, Metropolitan, Cooper Hewitt etc. 2 blocks to luxury shopping on Madison. 3 blocks to well known 92nd St Y, Great restaurants & gourmet markets, 1 block to #6 subway line easy to connect to trains all over the city. Check out time is before 12:00 except by special arrangement.

name: 2 bedroom - Upper East Side-great for kids
space: Enjoy an excellent and much more reasonably priced and comfortable alternative to a New York City hotel. Our newly renovated 2 bedroom is located on the charming, tree lined, park block of 77th Street between York Avenue and John Jay Park -  right in the middle of the very safe, Upper East Side. The apartment is a 5th floor walk-up in a beautiful Historic Old World style building with a central courtyard. This apartment can sleep 6 people and a baby.  The apartment has high ceilings, 4 floor to ceiling windows  (lots of light) and hard wood flooring throughout. The master bedroom has a queen  sized bed, dresser,TV, closet and two windows.   The second bedroom is small and set up for our two kids, but has a floor to ceiling window, crib, closet and  a full sized bunk bed. The living room has a large flat screen TV, a  comfortable sectional sofa that can convert to two twin beds or a Queen sized bed.   It has an eat-in kitchen, which is large for NYC and opens into the living room.  Many

name: Village Green
space: Beautiful bedroom in a duplex house with large outdoor garden.  Located in Red Hook Brooklyn just a short walk to the water, great views of lower Manhattan and the statue of liberty.   NOTE: THIS LISTING IS FOR (1) PRIVATE ROOM YOU CAN RENT THE ENTIRE DUPLEX AS WELL in another listing.

name: Charming, Unique Prospect Heights Atelier & Loft
space: In the past year alone, a French artistic collective has drawn pictures of the loft. An Australian photographer has photographed nearly its every inch.  Ballerinas have twirled, writers have written --( I couldn't accommodate a musician with a keyboard from Taiwan, though) the list of people who've found a home here in this 1902 photographers loft is inspiring. This is a special place - though it's old and sometimes cantankerous, it is also uniquely charming.  One BEDROOM  WITH PRIVATE SINK.  SECOND  Room IS LIBRARY/OFFICE and where you can put twin aero bed.  FULLY EQUIPPED KITCHEN.   CUSTOM-MADE FOLD OUT WITH HAND SEWN DESIGNER COVER SLEEPS ONE  in  THE LIVING ROOM-- YOU CAN WATCH THE STARS. One more in office.   EXCELLENT BATHROOM SHOWER.  WINDOWS OPEN ONTO GARDENS.  VERY PRIVATE.  Prospect Heights is also one of Brooklyn's most welcoming, family-friendly, charming neighborhoods.  Watch clouds and planes beneath a soaring 25-foot window. Even long-time New  Yorkers have told me "the

name: WALK to CENTRAL PARK-Your own 1 Bdrm
space: Your own 1 bedroom apartment with its own washer/dryer, tons of light, and in a historic Landmark building  This is a cute and stylish true one bedroom apartment (not a studio with a bed in the corner).   It is a walk up of 5 and 1/2 flights.  Located on the upper east side, the apartment comes with super fast WiFi. There is exposed brick in the apartment and air conditioning.  Furnished with linens and cookware.   There is also a futon in the living room that sleeps 1-2 persons. No hidden fees:  You do not pay for water, heat, electric, internet, or broker fees.   Please note that since it is a 6th floor walk-up, the apartment is not handicap accessible. name: Comfortable 4-bedroom apt in family house.

name: Double Room w Private Deck Clinton Hill Best Area
space: If you ask around anyone will tell you that the Fort Greene/Clinton Hill area of Brooklyn is one of the coolest neighborhood to be in. Lots of bars/restaurants. Lovely park and trees everywhere. Farmers market on saturday and much to do. Close to ALL the trains and buses.  My block is nice and quiet.   This is a two bedroom apt. You will have a private room  and share the bathroom and kitchen with me.  The apt has high ceilings and wood floors.   The Room opens onto a really cute deck that is also your own private space. There is a loft double bed suitable for a couple,  Also a double bed in the room if climbing up a ladder is not your thing.  Loft area becomes a great storage space for cases etc  Please Note utilities are not included for long term stay. Average price for gas electric and internet is 60/month

name: Live-Work-Apartment: join the flair
space: It's a very friendly, productive live-work environment here. Yes, here together with roommate Paul F. Mancini (since 2016, playwright/theater director) lives a self-employed Swiss female ME. A writer-filmmaker-actress who speaks 6 languages fluent, rides her bicycle everywhere at anytime in heels, and among more other stuff, works from home. I tried to create a cozy, colorful home in Prospect Lefferts Gardens. 2.5 blocks off Prospect Park (huge NYC park with zoo, botanic garden etc.) on the Q subway line, Parkside Ave. stop. Inside of our building, we have a green courtyard/garden and accessible rooftop with trees. You can almost touch the moon from up there.  All rooms have high ceilings and no ACs. The bedrooms are basic furnished. Nonetheless, highly personal and clean. You'd be staying in Bedroom One version 2017 with my new dreamland bed and firefly heart on the wall. Can you see it? It's the one with the blue-red-white pillows. And you would need to not mind my wardrobe storage w

name: Light-filled 2B duplex in the heart of Park Slope!
space: Our place is a relaxed and quiet refuge from the city! With two floors, incredible natural light, and lots of plants, we have plenty of space to accommodate families in comfort. The large master bedroom upstairs opens directly out onto the south-facing deck, where in season you can enjoy views of the Freedom Tower and Statue of Liberty while eating straight out of the garden! The open kitchen / living room area is perfect for hanging out, and opens to a north-facing terrace (think Rear Window) where you can drink your morning coffee. An airy children's bedroom can comfortably sleep two. A daybed under the stairs can accommodate an adult. We have copious closet and storage space for you, and a washer-dryer in-house to keep you fresh on your journey. For long stays, cleaning service can be arranged.

name: Sunny, Modern room in East Village!
space: This listing is for 1 bedroom in a 3 bedroom luxury duplex with a large private terrace on East 9th Street.  The Apartment: Just one block off Tompkins Square Park in an elevator building. The apartment is a large luxury 2-floor, 3-bedroom, 2-bath duplex in Alphabet City/ East Village and a short walk away from Lower East Side, West Village, SoHo, Noho, Chinatown, Little Italy, and the rest of downtown Manhattan! The Room: A large, bright room with a very comfortable queen-sized bed, AC, large closet, and spectacular views of lower Manhattan.  The Host: Friendly, creative female who loves to travel, write, make movies, listen to music, and meet new people! I've lived in the neighborhood for 10 years and have lots recommendations for favorite coffee shops, bars, restaurants, bookstores, museums, and anything else you can think of in the city. Feel free to write if you have any questions!

name: East Village Duplex with Patio
space: I live in an East Village duplex and I am offering the downstairs bedroom for a single traveler or a couple during their visit to NYC.  Your room has a lovely outdoor patio to relax, where you can have your morning coffee or evening wine. Your room also has a private bathroom (I have my own bathroom upstairs) and a private access door of its own. The kitchen is on the top floor. You are more than welcome to keep your stuff in the fridge or use the china or glassware, fix yourself a cup of coffee or cereal but please NO cooking... name: Large Room in Amazing East Village Apt
space: The apartment is among the best available in the lively East Village. In general, the rooms, location, and size of the apartment make it a pretty desirable package.  It is close to both the F train (2nd Avenue), the L Train (1st Avenue) and the 6 Train (Astor Place). The two rooms that are available are the largest and second largest rooms.  Room #1 has a private fire escape off of the room, queen-sized bed and is large and spacious. name: Cute one-bedroom in Nolita!
space: Check in: 2pm  Check out: 11am  INCLUDES:  Comfy, firm Queen-sized bed, hardwood floors, AC, heat, and high speed wireless and lots of daylight. Only one flight up. Best suited for young travelers, architects, designers, artists.. people who tend to enjoy a more minimally furnished atmosphere, with everything you need. *Please note: The apartment faces street (one flight up) so there may be the usual street chatter that accompanies living in the center of New York City in the summer months.*

name: SpaHa Loft: Enormous and Bright
space: ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING! PLEASE NOTE RATE VARIES DEPENDING ON MONTH/SEASON AND IS BASED ON 4 PEOPLE. A SECURITY DEPOSIT IS REQUIRED, AND  THERE IS A $150 CLEANING FEE. AVAILABLE ALL YEAR! ALL UTILITIES & WIFI INCLUDED. CHECKOUT TIME IS 10:00 AM. Soak up the Latin beat of exciting SpaHa (Manhattan's Spanish Harlem) in this 2000+ square foot luxury loft taking up the entire second floor of an old warehouse that has been renovated with care. With 12ft ceilings, the custom windows let in tons of light.   The loft has four bedrooms (2 with queen beds, 2 with 2 twins).  In true loft fashion, the walls don't quite reach the ceilings, but it's great for families or groups of friends on an outing to New York, or maybe even looking for a place to settle for a while. There are two bathrooms, two enormous walk-in closets, and a laundry room with washer-dryer.  The kitchen has everything you need, including a microwave oven, coffee maker and toaster. name: Bay Ridge Brooklyn Safe Haven
space: Upscale Resedential Neighborhood VERY , VERY , VERY SAFE CLOSE TO EVERYTHINg I am in Bay Ridge Brooklyn, with private 1 bedroom apartment, the unit has a main bedroom with a queen-size bed. name: Couch for female in LES apartment
space: The couch is within a one bedroom apartment in the Lower East Side. It's a walk up building on the fourth floor. Great location and walking distance to the East Village, Noho, Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Nolita and more. Within a three block radius you'll find many good cafes, restaurants, bars and galleries. Also it's close to landmarks such as Katz's deli, Essex Market, the Tenement Museum and many others.  The apartment has hardwood floors and is in the back of the building so you don't hear much noise (traffic or sirens). Good shower, kitchen with Cuisinart coffeemaker that serves up a great brew, wi-fi, and laundry is very close.  I can give you some insight on great places to check out locally and help you with directions and NYC info.

name: BLUE TRIM GUEST HOUSE
space: Over tea, coffee or wine (as your schedule goes), we'll get acquainted with one another's laughter and lives around the dining table, enjoying sweeping views of the city. We're respectful of boundaries and hope only to be of help while you're here. The layout of the apartment provides spaciousness, as the guest room pairs with a full private bathroom to form a distinct and unique 'wing' for your quiet relaxation. The guest room itself has windows that face the rising sun, and the blackout shades installed ensure a good night's rest no matter how sensitive to light you may be as a sleeper. There's ample closet and drawer space, with electrical outlets within easy reach. As a launchpad to the larger city, we're perfectly positioned between JFK airport and Manhattan, making arrival a breeze and exploration a joy. But you won't need to go far to find out why Brooklyn has a global reputation. If questions, please inquire - we look forward to introducing you to a city we adore.

name: Charming East Village One Bedroom Flat
space: This block of East 7th Street, in the East Village Historic District, was featured in the NY Times in December 2010, check out the article to see some of the great establishments right outside your door.  Just search on your favorite browser for "Clever Young East Seventh Street NY Times." This clean, recently renovated, charming apartment has a full size living room, large separate bedroom, small but practical, clean modern kitchen and a nice new bathroom. The space is immaculate, very well heated, renovated, modern, and extremely well kept. High ceilings, lots of light (south facing), wood floors, thoughtful lighting with dimmers, exposed brick, plenty of closet space, cleaning service, and free reliable wifi. The apartment is nicely furnished and decorated with a brand new luxurious queen size bed. The nightly rent includes all utilities, wifi, heat, hot water, coffee and tea.    Ideally located on East 7th Street between First and Second Avenues, the apartment is within a 5 minute

name: Fort Greene Retreat on the Park
space: This is a private bedroom with exclusive use of a hallway bathroom in a shared apartment. The apartment is on the 4th floor (walk-up) of a historic Brooklyn Brownstone fronting Fort Greene Park. It has an open kitchen with a large butcher block island ideal for cooking with friends, and a private planted roof deck to enjoy early morning coffee or an evening glass of wine, all located in historic Fort Greene, one of Brooklyn's best neighborhoods! The bedroom is cozy, with plenty of room for singles or couples, with both short-term and medium-term availability, and is only a short train ride to Manhattan - 1 stop on the Q/B, 2 stops on the F, or 4 stops on the C - and walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge. I've lived in the neighborhood for over 13 years, and can provide you with any and all advice, maps, or guides that you should need during your stay. space: Amazing loft in the Meatpacking District. The hottest neighborhood in NYC! Enjoy your own 1,100 square foot space within a 2,600 sq ft, two floor loft. Doorman, building, full sized bed (fits two) with true mattress and box frame (not an uncomfortable, thin, sleeper sofa mattress). Can sleep third guest on large sectional sofa, shared kitchen. Guests enjoy exclusive use of two bathrooms.

name: Spacious luminous apt Upper West NYC
space: If you're looking for the perfect, luminous and calm getaway in the heart of NYC, then this Riverside Drive apartment is the perfect choice for you. Approx. 1000sq feet, one bedroom plus studio/2nd bedroom, dining room, kitchen (dishwasher, large fridge and microwave), marble and tile bathroom. Laundry room in the basement. Facing South West over the Hudson River: the light is really beautiful. It's across the street from Riverside Park and its Olympic swimming pool, gymnasium, running truck and ice skating ring, open to everybody for only $5 entry fee. Close to Fairway market for good healthy food and home shopping. Subway one block away: Red line, train Nå¡1. B&D trains 10 minutes walk away. CHECK PHOTOS. Cleaning after your stay is included. Cleaning during long term reservation by my trusted housekeeper is not included and not obligatory but highly recommended.

name: 2 bedroom Williamsburg Apt - Bedford L stop
space: My entire apartment is available off and on throughout the year. It is so bright and sunny.  Two bedrooms, each with a queen bed in it.  The living room and kitchen are huge. High ceilings.  Wood floors.  Loads of charming details.  Second floor of a three unit building in Williamsburg.  Five minute or so walk to the L train Bedford stop, (which is one stop from Manhattan)  as well as the J, M and G trains. Williamsburg is just overflowing with great shops and restaurants, all within walking distance. It seems like there's another restaurant opening up by the day. It's very safe and you never feel isolated or like you're the only person walking down the street at night.  I have two bikes that you can use. A Citibike kiosk is in down the street. There's a new movie theater next door. There's an air conditioner in the bedroom and fans throughout the rest of the apartment.  Internet included.  Pets okay, as long as you don't have a dog that chews furniture and shoes up. If you do, write t

name: Oh glorious spring!
space: AH, DEAR PROSPESPECTIVE GUEST, I VALUE YOU AND WILL TREAT YOU WITH UPMOST RESPECT, BUT I WILL NOT BOOK YOU IF WE DO NOT EXCHANGE INFORMATION. I AM NOT A HOTEL IT IS MY HOME. A FEW BAD EXPERIENCES PROMPTED THIS.  Spring in New York is glorious, near perfect weather for a long walk. A trip to Chinatown. How about Central Park.  A walk under the bridges. A bit want an adventure, Inwood or Highbridge parks. The Cloisters? I know the city very well and can give you endless tips or even take you one of my epic urban exploration walks.  The East Village is vibrant. Restaurants, clubs, Red tail hawk watching in the park. Interesting people.  Williamsburg is a quick train ride away as well as all the wonders the city offers.  Again, I love the city, and I am more then willing to fill you in on all necessary details, trains to take, buses, off beat places to go, hidden gems in non-touristy streets, adventures in the outer boroughs etc.  I am a non-smoker or drinker. Remember that we are adults,

name: Spacious Prospect Heights Apartment
space: Floor thru apartment in Prospect Heights Brooklyn.  Many amenities are provided for your comfort. Closet space is abundant. The bedroom has a queen sized bed and the living room has a double sofa bed.

name: 2-bed brownstone duplex + garden
space: I believe that I'd found the perfect location and neighborhood when I bought and renovated this 2-family brownstone in 2004. The House ------------- As a visual artist, natural light is very important to me, and I find traditional brownstones to be dark. So I had a gut renovation and added large picture windows to make the space open, bright and airy.  The renovation also included the complete update of all electrical, plumbing and heating systems. Central air conditioning was added, too. The upstairs consists of the living room (with the large, north-facing picture window, overlooking the backyard garden below), the kitchen that's open to the living room with stone counter tops, modern appliances, and gas range, and a dining room/office in the front of the house facing Dean Street.  There's a half-bath just off the kitchen. The bedrooms are on the lower floor (called the "garden level" in Brooklyn real estate speak).  The master bedroom is large (20x16 feet) with a king-size Tempurped

name: Sunny Apartment in Artist Home
space: Beautiful, sunny apartment with separate bedroom. Wood floors in the living room and bedroom. Large, full kitchen. Even the bathroom gets direct sunlight.  The space is uncluttered spacious, only art made by host hangs from the walls. The furniture is also very unique, either collected antiques or hand made by an artist.   There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and a full size futon in the living room. The bed has a custom-made, artistic, steel headboard by Tripoli designs, your host. This is a great place to stay if you're looking for grass-roots art and music and cool places off the beaten track. We are located in Bushwick, home to a thriving arts community. We are within close walking distance of art galleries, cafes, and nice restaurants and bars.  Our house is a 7 min walk to the L train (Jefferson St stop); 15min train ride to Manhattan (East Village and Union Square.) We are also a 5 min walk to the M train (Central Ave stop); 15min train ride to Manhattan (Lower East Side, So

name: Light-filled classic Central Park
space: An adorable, classic, clean, light-filled one-bedroom apartment with windows in each room that overlook the courtyards of historic row-houses.  A great retreat after a day exploring the city...and one block from lovely Central Park! There is a livingroom/diningroom with a comfy click-clack futon couch that folds into a queen-size bed, and a separate, light-filled bedroom with a full-size bed.   The apartment has a complete, yet small kitchen and a clean bathroom with a bathtub.  Hot water is plentiful, the toilet well-functioning! It is a 3rd floor walk-up. (no elevator/lift) Free wireless internet.   The neighborhood is diverse, quiet, near transportation. Within walking distance of the Cathedral of St. John the Divine and Columbia University.    Great for people who like to run or amble around Central Park or Riverside Park, both within walking distance! Subway: B,C to 103 Street; or 1 to 103/Broadway Bus: M7, M116, M10 all stop within one block )  10 minutes to Lincoln Center 15 min

name: Upper Manhattan, New York
space: Nice room in a spacious pre-war apartment in uptown manhattan.  The apartment's living and dinning rooms sit on Broadway and get lots of sun light.  The apartment is 3 train stops (7 minutes) from Columbia University, and there's a great energy in the neighborhood.  The room is in excellent condition with a great orthopedic bed, and there's also a futon sofa available.  The neighborhood is eclectic- safe to be outside anytime of day or night!

name: COZY QUIET room 4 DOOGLERS!
space: Don't forget to read our reviews! The room has a loft bed and a chaise lounge, desk, fresh white bed linens (for nesting) and towels, comforter, extra blankets, TV, DVD player, cable, wireless wifi, fridge, juicer, iron, ironing board.  This room is faces the back of building with a window and is completely private. You can literally walk in the apartment and open the door to your room without any fuss. The bathroom is right next door to your room too. It's truly a Prime Chelsea location a block away from the Highline and Chelsea Market for great shopping too.  This is a lovely small quiet room with a loft bed and a seated work desk area below. Complete with a mini 3 ft tall mini fridge, microwave, clean white bed linens with extra blankets and plenty of clean white towels. name: HEAVENLY BROWNSTONE RETREAT
space: ABSOLUTELY QUIET!, this huge private floor through newly renovated one bedroom features 2 decorative fireplaces, large sun drenched living room, gorgeous designer condo-style kitchen with dishwasher and oversized steel refrigerator, a huge walk-in closet, new bathroom with washer/dryer, re-done wood floors, and an oversized bedroom facing tree lined backyards. Located in the best part of North Park Slope, between 5th and 6th Ave on a quiet brownstone block, restaurants and every store you need just a block away. Plus, very short walk to the B and Q Express to Manhattan, and just minutes from the Atlantic Subway station, with every train; D, R, 2,3, 4,5, and J as well as the LIR. If you need your peace of mind but want to be close to it all, as well as in the city in just 15 minutes, this is the place for you! Well kept brownstone building, recently renovated.

name: NYC - CHELSEA 1 BEDROOM SAFE + COOL
space: Hello -  This is a quiet and extremely well located apartment in the Chelsea section of Manhattan - easy access to Downtown and Midtown areas. Chelsea is a cool and vibrant neighborhood filled with art galleries, restaurants, bars, stores, flea markets and parks, all within walking distance (Madison Square Park, High Line). Several subways stations ( 1, C, E, B, D, F, V, N, R.) and bus lines stop one block away.  The apt. is on a 3rd floor walk-up (NO ELEVATOR), in a safe residential block. It has four living spaces: 1. Large sunny living room, 2. Attached office, 3. Dining room (with table for four people) and 4. Bedroom with a firm Queen size (double) bed. Plus small but complete kitchen with all appliances and bathroom with bathtub/shower and great hot water! Wooden floors and the furniture and art is mostly mid-century modern.  The apt. is sunny during the day and quiet at night, even being in the heart of Chelsea. It is close to Whole Foods (organic food store open daily from 8AM

name: House On Henry (3rd FLR Suite)
space: Come stay in your home away from home! This charming apartment is located on the top level of our townhouse (3rd Floor).  It boasts plenty of sun, brick exposed walls, hard wood floors throughout, a tub/showered bathroom, a bedroom, a den, a fully equipped kitchen and yes, free wifi. Note, the rate quoted is for 1 guest, additional guests incur a $20 per night/per person charge.   Check-in is at 4pm Check-out is at 11am Please note, this is a residential townhouse and as such we ask that guests respect our designated quiet hours between 11 p.m. and 7 a.m.  Thanks and I do hope you will visit us soon at our Carroll Gardens Retreat - House on Henry!

name: Monkey Retreat Manhattan

name: Because Nice Matters-Upper Upper West Side 2bd/2ba
space: Please send a brief bio of yourself and the people staying here with you before booking.  A photo would be nice too.   The space is a beautiful, warm and clean apartment nestled between the Hudson River on the west, historic Harlem, southeast, Sugar Hill, east, Washington Heights, north, and Columbia University, south, in our culturally diverse neighborhood of Hamilton Heights. The apartment is located on one of the most beautiful blocks in NYC.  It is on the street level which makes it easy for people with stair concerns.  It is decorated with comfort and style in mind. The bedrooms are super quiet and have the most comfortable beds.  The apartment is a large 2 bedroom/2 bath duplex completely separate with its own private entrance and with access to the serene backyard garden.   There are 2 queen beds, 1 full bed, and 2 twin beds, free WiFi, towels, sheets, pillows, iron and board, hairdryers, and bathrobes.  One bathroom has a jacuzzi. name: Private 3br 2bath West Village townhouse SALE!
space: Please ask if you have questions. Discounts may be possible depending on owner's travel plans. name: Beautiful 2 bedroom Apartment
space: 2 bedroom apartment in Park Slope, on the third floor of the building. You enter the premises through the living room. It has a big dining table, chairs, TV, two sofas and a coffee table. The kitchen is on the right, fully furnished, with stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher, cookware, refrigerator, freezer, hood. . . The first bedroom has a single size bed, chairs, TV, closet and dresser. The second bedroom has a queen size bed, chair, bedside table, and closet. An air mattress is available. The bathroom has a tub, shower in the tub, and toilets. The building is located between 6th avenue and 5th avenue. A lot of restaurant, coffee shops are nearby. The closest subway station is 4th avenue (M, R), which is 6 blocks from the apartment. There is also 7th avenue (F), which is 6 blocks from the building as well. We have one queen bed and one single bed. If you need an extra bed we have an air mattress that can be used.

name: Beautiful Studio Apartment
space: This studio vacation rental apartment is located on the 3rd floor of a walk-up brownstone in Park Slope, Brooklyn, New York. The apartment is fully furnished, but does not have a stove. The accommodation is equipped with a microwave oven, toaster and coffee maker. It features hardwood floors, air-conditioning & it offers WIFI Internet access. There is a queen-sized bed and a single-sized bed. The windows of this vacation rental apartment are facing the north with a view onto 4th Street and of the surrounding area and buildings. This vacation rental apartment is located in Park Slope, one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Brooklyn, with its beautiful brownstones and trees, lots of parks and playgrounds for children. It has easy access to the city, unique cultural make up and unmatched community spirit. There are many shops, restaurants, cafes, boutiques and supermarkets all around this area of New York City.

name: Sandra's Room
space: (Website hidden by Airbnb) The Guest Hous (Website hidden by Airbnb)  The house was built at the turn of the century; it still retains much of the old world flavor, such as gas fixtures and original moldings in some of the bedrooms. The house has three guest bedrooms. The guest rooms have a shared bath, each room with its own distinctive decor, and offer an eclectic and peaceful retreat. Guests can explore the proximity of local attractions in Manhattan as well as discovering the Bronx and lower Westchester. We cater to the non-smoking, business, cosmopolitan, and urbane traveler and families from out-of-town.

name: Large 2 Bedroom Great for Groups!
space: Welcome to The Stuydio SPEND YOUR HOLIDAYS IN NYC! Our large two bedroom apartment is located inside a restored Brownstone.  Very Large Space, 1000sqft!  From the moment you walk in the Brownstone you are swept away by the rich colors and the old world charm. Your modern apartment has all the features of home.  You can make your meals in the full kitchen, relax in the large airy living room, take in a nice soak in the jetted tub and just be happy on your VACATION!   The Brownstone is set on a historic tree lined block in Stuyvesant Heights, Brooklyn. Come on you know you want to give your vacation the finishing touch, join us! name: Modern Traveler's Suite in Brooklyn
space: Don't think of this modern 1-bedroom apartment as a stranger's residence; it feels more like a suite in a small boutique hotel ÛÓ even though it's actually my home when I'm not traveling on research assignments as a travel writer. (I won't seem like a stranger once we connect.)  This clean and well-maintained "suite" is stylish, yet comfortable (it has actually been a set for TV, film, and commercials), and is fully-equipped with wireless Internet, a state-of-the-art home entertainment system, and plenty of kitchen gadgets at your disposal if you are culinarily inclined. Oh, and the queen-sized bed and jacuzzi-fitted tub are quite lovely too. The accommodation is in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, New York City's popular trendy enclave for artsy and foodie types. But more appealing than that is its accessibility; it is just a two-block walk and five-minute train ride away to Manhattan's East Village - perfectly located for anyone who wants to be easily accessible to Manhattan and Brooklyn. And

name: 1,800 sq foot in luxury building
space: 3 bedrooms/2 baths - I live here with my 2 cats. There is one available bedroom for rent. The room can hold up to 2 guests.  There is a free gym in the building, on the same floor as the apartment. There is also roof space for grilling. You will have full access to the kitchen and living room which has a large flat screen television with cable, wireless internet. 24 hour doorman/security. Bed is a double bed. There is access to a washer and dryer on each floor for a small fee. The washer and dryer in the apartment are off limits to guests. The apartment is just four blocks away from the 2/3 express train which links up to just about every other line and gets you around the city quickly. It is also two blocks from the famous Sylvia's soul food restaurant and the now famous Red Rooster restaurant owned by Marcus Samuelson. Lots of other restaurants in the area as well.

name: Sunny 2-story townhouse w garden
space: Our home is a bright, newly renovated townhouse in a great neighborhood in Brooklyn. There are two large bedrooms, one single room/office, and master bath with tub upstairs. Downstairs is the chef's kitchen, dining area, living room with working fireplace and half bathroom. Our large backyard has a beautiful magnolia tree and swing with an enclosed shed space. A sunny deck off the kitchen is great for outdoor meals. There is a washer/dryer, dishwasher, and wireless internet. We have a 6 year old and a 4 year old so the house is perfect for families. We have a bunk bed and toys, plus 2 double beds in the other upstairs bedrooms.

name: Times Square, Safe, Clean and Cozy!

The shower and sink are inside the apartment and the toilet is conveniently located outside the apt in the hallway, and is exclusively for the use of this apt.  The kitchen is equipped with a stove, silverware, microwave, coffee maker, blender, two Televisions, two Air Conditioners and a very comfy leather sofa.  There is a fast connection to the internet with WIFI throughout. The kitchen can be used to cook breakfast only, and is available to eat lunch and dinner, but not to cook these meals in.  However, the Microwave is always available! The apartment is in New York City's Best Location, right in the heart of it all, only steps to the famous Times Square and theater district. name: Studio Apartment/Work Space in East Village
space: Designer's renovated apartment, 400sf / 10' ceilings. Quiet, clean, safe, first floor apartment with central air-conditioning.  Exposed brick, maple floors, and recessed lights.  Large windows facing back yard.  Built in bookshelves, open kitchen, granite countertops.  Large bathroom with slate floors, jacuzzi tub and steam room. Great neighbors and neighborhood with several restaurants, bars and cafes nearby.  Tree lined street with cute coffee shops.  Taxi, subway and bus stop readily available and close.   I use this space as my office as well as my apartment.  So the furnishings are a queen sized bed and three white desks.  The city and its many parks are my lounge and my family room, so to speak.  It is still decorated and cozy and the bathroom is unlike most apartments in the city!  So nice!

name: Park Slope Green Guest House
space: Dear Guests, We are a Green Guest House. We cater to the chemically sensitive, allergic, and/or environmentally concerned guest. We recycle and use resources responsibly.  Our guest house is a one flight walk up. It is a private apartment in our 2-family home. The unit is not shared with any other guests. We are frequently available to answer questions, give directions/advice and even act as "concierge". The space consists of a full kitchen, bathroom with shower and claw foot bathtub, living room with pull out couch & dining table, and a separate sleeping alcove. It is best for 2 people, but can accommodate up to 4 adults.  We are located in the very popular Brooklyn neighborhood of Park Slope, which was been touted as one of the 10 best neighborhoods the the USA! There are countless restaurants, cafes, clubs, museums, and the famous Prospect Park. Enjoy the amazing Brooklyn Botanic Garden, Brooklyn Museum, Prospect Park Zoo, Brooklyn Academy of Music (aka BAM), and on and on. We are a

space: This is a three bedroom apartment uptown Manhattan; two blocks from Fort Tryon Park, and the A(190) and 1(191) trains; both give easy access to midtown & downtown (30-45 mins). We have a large kitchen. We are on the top floor, so we have no upstairs neighbors; and the building is in a pocket corner, so it is extremely quiet. The building has elevator and laundry, and there is a supermarket, pharmacy, hardware store, wine store, and restaurants close by. We share one bathroom, which is conveniently next to this room. We have wireless internet; but no TV cable. We are two friendly roommates who appreciate a fraternal, warm and laid back environment.

name: Sunny Room in New Condo
space: I am located in beautiful, Clinton Hill, Brooklyn. The "C" train (10 minutes to Lower Manhattan) is a 1/2  block from the building. He is a rescue I adopted after he was removed from his previous owner due to neglect/abuse.**** At a leisurely pace I am a 15 minute walk from the 2,3,4 & 5 trains and the Brooklyn Museum on Eastern Parkway. About another 5 minutes of walking to Prospect Park. About a 10 minute walk from Fort Greene Park. The same for restaurants, bars and shopping in the area. name: NYC artistsÛª loft with roof deck
space: Our guestroom is tiny and bare bones:  a converted walk-in closet (9Ûª by 8Ûª with 11-foot ceilings), it is equipped with a single bed, desk/chair, a dresser and clothing racks/shelves. Its non-opening window overlooks the living room. Some shelves inside the room hold storage items. Since the room only has a single regular bed, it is best suited for one person. However, we can also accommodate a couple on a double mattress on the floor. (If you are two travelers, please let us know what kind of sleeping arrangements you would prefer.) In short, you will only have a minimum amount of private space, but you are, of course, welcome to use the communal areas of the loft, too.

The apartment is near the Brooklyn Bridge, the Promenade, BAM, DUMBO, and Downtown Brooklyn.  You can even walk to Chinatown and Wall Street from my place if you are inspired. name: Sunny Williamsburg Penthouse
space: ABOUT THE APARTMENT: The apartment is atop a 4-story walk-up. The unique A-frame architecture has skylights throughout the kitchen, living room, and bedrooms, making it much brighter and more welcoming than the typical New York den. There is a private back porch, large enough to accommodate an outdoor dinner party, with a large grill/smoker, sectional sofa, potted garden, and an unobstructed view of the nearby Manhattan skyline. While the bedrooms and bathroom are of course private, the common areas all fall within an open architecture, making all of the apartment's most attractive features available from everywhere. Cook dinner in the kitchen while watching a movie on the large projector in the living room. Listen to music from the office stereo while emailing your friends from the porch hammock to tell them about your mind-blowing New York accommodations.  ABOUT THE BEDROOM(S): The apartment has 2 bedrooms, one for me and one for you (though I sometimes rent my own room when I travel

We're open to hosting human beings of all backgrounds, ages, and persuasions/identities/however you want to call it. Hablamos espanol! He's an inside cat please don't let him out (though he really wants to roam free).

name: Spacious, Spotless 1Bd- BK Heights!
space: Convenient, Spacious, Clean Apt. Available for Short Term Rental  1st floor walk up in quiet building on a tree lined street. Located in prestigious Brooklyn Heights. 1 stop outside the city via the Borough Hall station - express lines for east(A,C,2,3) and west(4,5) side Manhattan. Walking distance to Smith and Court St which offer all the hippest restaurants and night life in BK. Steps away from the brand new Brooklyn Bridge park and just a few blocks to the promenade for the citys best view of Manhattans skyline! Queen Tempur-Pedic, linens, towels, coffee maker, iron, hair dryer included. Wifi, cable, Blu-Ray, 42' Plasma included.  Laundry just down the block.

name: Lovely Apt & Garden; Legal; Best Area; Amenities
space: Welcome !  Historic, cozy,  4-story house in  beloved, beautiful, super safe, quiet, dynamic,  "Best NY Neighborhood"  of Park Slope!    This garden apartment has a large, gorgeous garden and patio and washer & dryer.  3 good SUBWAY lines 3 minutes from house. SPRING - FALL -   5 night minimum, but if you see a gap in reservations -   ask!   Please write me  and do not request to reserve until I reply "yes".  This garden apartment has great advantages!   Huge  patio, BBQ.  Large and gorgeous spring summer garden. A well stocked kitchen; Comfortable King size bed,  excellent linens, towels; Nice bathroom with all you need;  Professionally cleaned for EVERY  guest; Private entrance;  only one step  to enter the apartment,   Washer & dryer (also used by me when you are not there) LEGAL RENTAL.  I am home owner. Delicious organic breakfast foods, great juice, tea, coffee.  Many child items;  Artwork & books of famous children's artists!  Great location. I will send you my excellent  TRAVEL

name: Sunny + Spacious Brownstone Haven
space: Top floor of landmark brownstone on a beautiful, residential street in Crown Heights.   The apartment is a serene dream, lightly but elegantly furnished with everything you need for a quiet, relaxed stay. Original fireplaces (non-working), tall ceilings, ample windows with treetop views and an updated kitchen and bathroom make this an inviting home away from home. Overall, it's a beautiful apartment in a beautiful community. Perfect for travelers or visiting friends and family searching for a quiet, cozy place to retreat in the busy city.

name: 1 Bedroom in 2 Bdrm Apt- Upper East
space: 1 bdrm available in converted 2 bedroom apt. The apt is on a high floor in a luxury doorman building and is fully furnished with an amazing view of the East River. The bedroom is approx 11' x 12' and gets a lot of sunlight. There is a full-sized bed and a dresser in the room. Apt has tv with cable and internet, kitchen complete with oven refrigerator, stove, microwave and kitchen table. Building has laundry room. Apt is 7 minute walk from the 6 train, 10 minutes from the 4/5.  Right near the 79th St. crosstown bus. I am a professional female in mid- 30's. Minimum stay is 2 weeks.

name: Lower East Side $60~/night
space: 2 blocks from F line 2nd Avenue subway station. You can walk to Soho, East Village, and China Town. Walk up 2nd floor, 1 bed room of 2 bedrooms will be available for rent. The room has 2 windows, sunny, furnished with a full sized bed. There is NO TV. You will share a kitchen and a bathroom with a female. Utility, cable, and wireless internet included. I provide bed sheets and towels. 1-6 nights, $75/night 7-13 nights, $70/night 14-29 nights, $65/night Over 30 nights, $60/night For 2 people, $10up/night I set my calendar as 2 guests price, so if you are 1 guest, please message me first. Also, I cannot do Friday, Saturday, or Sunday check in. I only take reservations for 3months in advance, so currently I take March through May reservations. I have a cat, so if you have an allergy for cats, my place would be not good for you.  If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.

name: Great East Village Bedroom
space: Hello, My husband and I are renting out the second bedroom in our great east village apartment. This spacious east village bedroom has great light and a contemporary feel. There is an elevator and dishwasher. It's close to the 1st Ave stop on the L subway and often within walking distance of most NYC destinations. Please feel free to use the kitchen and common areas. Wireless internet, towels and sheets are included. The bathroom is shared. There are shopping bags on the back of the door to use to help reduce waste. There is no television as I encourage guest to get out and experience the city and neighborhood. It's close to union square and all kinds of amenities, shopping, food, restaurants, so there is plenty to see.  This is truly New York living at its best in one of the most diverse and dynamic neighborhoods in the world. After years of hosting on Airbnb,  Say hello if you're interested and find out if the dates of your travel are available. Cheers! CHECKIN AND CHECKOUT: Checkin

name: Spacious Williamsburg BK 1br Apt
space: 1 bedroom spacious apartment in great area of Willliamsburg, Brooklyn. Close to L/G and JMZ trains.  New Bathroom, bathtub, towels provided New full kitchen, kitchenware & dinnerware provided Washer/dryer  Wireless internet Queen size bed, linens provided Lots of space in main area: living room and TV room TV has Netflix Big windows, beautiful wood floors, exposed brick

name: Prime Location in Manhattan
space: My space offers a private bedroom in my 2 bedroom apartment.  The room has tv and the apartment has WIFI.  I have 2 dogs, Bell ( 15 yo) and Desdemona (6 yo).  Most mornings I make coffee and breakfast (some days it's not possible due to time/work constraints).  I work from home and I'm available to assist with travel details and or reservations as needed.  The apartment is located on 30th street between 8th and 9th Ave.  Penn Station is a block away.  The A, C, and E trains are just up the street on 8th Ave and 33rd St. The location is a perfect starting point to experience NYC.  The "Highline Park" entrance is straight down 30th St.  If you're driving here, there are 2 parking garages on the block (you may want to check for coupons online before parking) .  There are way too many things to see and do to list here... it's NYC.  Feel free to contact me with any questions.       -Lee

name: The artist's house
space: A cozy and furnished bedroom in the heart of vibrant Brooklyn, NY. The room is a Queen room available in a beautiful turn-of-the-century duplex. There are 5 bedrooms in this house. Three of which are rented out to amazing guests from all over the globe. And living here permanently are myself, a painter and visual artist and Tyler, a comedian and actor. This room is furnished with a:  Queen-size bed  Desk and workspace  closet   Fresh linens  Wifi The apartment has a full kitchen, living room, dining room and roof garden where you can enjoy eating dinners and taking your coffee al fresco. The house is located in Lefferts Garden, Brooklyn. It is 2 blocks from beautiful Prospect Park, 2 blocks from the Q/B express trains and the 2/5 local trains - 20 minutes to downtown Manhattan. name: ONLY 10 min. AWAY from Midtown
space: I just love my apartment, it is a really charming , big , peaceful, safe  and super clean...the location is perfect, one block away from the subway , 3 stop from the city ...  Broadway and 30 Av are plenty of nice restaurant, supermarket , coffee shops, bakery, banks, Dry clean, gym, vitamin shop, pharmacy everything you need is here ... Others attractions: Noguchi Museum - Sculpture In Long Island City, Richard Meier Model Museum, PSI Art Museum Long Island City,  museum of the moving image, Bohemian Hall Beer Garden, Watbuddsatsai,Geeta Temple, Queens County Farm Museum,Queens Museum of Art. The apartment is one big bedroom ,second floor in a Pre-war building probably around 1930 ,the walls are in Victorian style, you will feel back on time,  you will enjoy the charm and peace that this place can give you. The kitchen is in the middle of the apartment ,that separate the living room and the bedroom ,in the living room ,it is another queen size bed .the space  can accommodate 4 people

name: Park Slope - Big, Bright and Sunny
space: THE ROOM: I have a fully furnished, large, bright bedroom with a queen size bed, a table and chairs and a lovely leafy outlook over a grassy yard.  It is a two bedroom  and the two rooms are at either end of the apartment so you have maximum privacy. The sit-in kitchen is yours to use as you like and itÛªs a relaxed environment with a friendly feel.  THE LOCATION:  Park Slope. A very friendly, vibrant, diverse and safe neighborhood. Everything you would need or want within blocks. Walking distance to Prospect Park, BrooklynÛªs famous 5th Ave restaurant row and great friendly local bars, bakeries and coffee shops. 24hr Laundromat on the corner, supermarkets and late night delis within a block. Three stops or half hour walk to BAM. Street parking is easy to find. ACCESS:  30 mins to Manhattan on the subway. 5 mins walk to the R (to Manhattan, you change to an express train at Atlantic or DeKalb) trains, 10 mins walk to the F (to Manhattan one way, Coney Island the other), G (to Fort Greene

name: Bright &Spacious 3brm Crown Heights
space: A beautiful spacious 3 bedroom apartment in a trendy Brooklyn neighborhood. FOR RENT: The entire apartment.  Apartment consists of a large living room, 3 bedrooms (each w/full size bed), full bath (tub/shower), and newly renovated kitchen and dining area.  Carefully decorated, this apartment will take you on a journey back to many different eras. One thing is for sure, this place is impeccably stylish, super clean, and a wonderful place for as many as 6 people to enjoy while visiting NYC.  Located near to 3 train stations.  The 4 & 5 lines and 2 & 3 lines at Franklin Ave, S line Park Pl, and C train at Franklin Ave, a subway ride into the city is only 15-20 mins away. Conveniently located above the popular franco-senegalese cafe, Cafe Rue Dix, grabbing a coffee, a bite to eat, or just people watching is only a walk down the stairs.  Within blocks from the Brooklyn Museum, Prospect Park, Grand Army Plaza, and the Botanical Gardens, this place is purr-fect for a short or long term stay.

name: Quiet, sunny Midtown Manhattan apt.
space: Sunny, 600-sq. foot one-bedroom apartment in Midtown (West) Manhattan. Downstairs laundry. Large, leafy shared courtyard/backyard. Two blocks from theater district, Hudson River Park and bike trails (with bike rental), and the metro. Easy access to groceries, patisseries, Central Park, Lincoln Center, Alvin Ailey. Small but very functional older kitchen with newer appliances, including microwave, and full amenities. Full bathroom with bathtub and shower. Walk-up apartment on 2nd floor (one flight stairs). Wifi; TV w/DVD playback only. Some mid-century pieces and original art. Access to indoor pool w/day pass.  This is a private family homeÛÓneat, clean but also lived in and book filled (just like the photos). **NOTE:  **Includes two healthy cats that require feeding and a pat or two.**  You should be clean, quiet, and responsible and have excellent recommendations. Deposit required.

name: Big Room/Washer-Dryer/Wifi/AC/JMZ
space: Very nice room in small apartment available for short term stay - maximum seven nights, though I am flexible. This is a bright, spacious (approx 12' X 8') room, with window facing the city. The room has a comfortable bed, dressing table and closet. Also in the apartment is a large kitchen and modern bathroom, with washer/dryer. The apartment is on the 4th of a modern walk-up building (no elevator) and has central air/heat, wifi, a large roof for hanging out and is less than a 5 minute walk from the subway. We are 10-15 minutes on the train from Lower East Side of Manhattan and 20-25 from midtown. The neighborhood has many cool bars and plenty of twenty-four hour shops, including some particularly good grocery stores, with lots of organic produce; fresh pressed juices.

name: cozy studio with parking spot
space: Nice, cozy, furnished, studio apartment in a very nice, extremely safe, family-oriented Queens neighborhood.  Free parking spot included.  Free WIFI signal and cable TV included, as well as AC. Conveniences - groceries, shopping, banks, etc. within a few blocks from the apt and transit to Times Square is approximately 35-45 minutes by public transit or 10-15 minutes by car/taxi. Very close to Juniper Park, a great place for recreation. This is not a shared situation. You have your own apartment with  equipped kitchen, and privacy. Best suited for one or two people sharing a bed, but three may be ok if one is a child.

name: Clean and convenient 2BR apartment
space: 2 bedroom/1bath brownstone apartment. 3 Blocks to the train to Manhattan and 25 minutes to the city. Very nice and safe neighborhood.  Free WIFI signal and satellite TV included. Free use of basement pool table and foosball table. 1 block from shopping and conveniences. Bedroom 1: Queen poster bed Bedroom 2: Full size bed + twin size bed Living room: Sleeper sofa. Accommodates up to 7 guests maximum.

name: Nice Queens townhouse with parking
space: Nice furnished 4BR/2BTH townhouse. 30-40 minutes to Times Square by public transit,  10-15 minutes by car/taxi. Very nice, extremely safe, quiet,residential neighborhood.  Includes WIFI signal, cable TV, use of a washer and dryer  and all utilities. Triplex unit with a small backyard. 2 blocks walk to Juniper Park. Conveniences within a few blocks walk.

name: Near Central Park, Clean, Safe, near subways
space: Entire apartment to yourself. Newly renovated, luxury, fully furnished apartment for rent at West 107th St and Central Park West. For rent by owner.  Aussi, je parle franÌ¤ais. :) DETAILS * 1 block from Central Park * A/C in each bedroom * Amazing cleaning lady who cleans apartment before you arrive so it's spic and span * Parking: Free street parking (difficult to find but possible if you are determined) or nearby garages. * On well lit street lined with privately owned condos * Recent renovations. Gut renovations with all new moldings, hardwood floors, etc. * New appliances including stainless steel dishwasher, fridge, microwave and stove. * Fully furnished including desk, table, couch, beds, TV, DVD, lamps etc. * 2 bedrooms with full beds and another futon in the living room plus 2 single self-inflatable air mattresses. Some people say the apartment looks smaller in real life, others say it looks bigger.  * Fully equipped with dishes, kitchenware, sheets, towels & linens so you don't

name: ARTY BOHEMIAN PRVT ROOM
space: The  Manhattan apartment:  - Apartment is set of the road so SUPPER QUITE as far as NYC street noise goes(almost like you are not in the East village). I can leave the windows open in the spring and autumn without being disturbed by street noise which is great. - Laundry facilities in the front of the building, drop off or self serve.  - Free wifi throughout apartment  - Hardwood floors throughout apartment  - True two bedroom apt, we are the ENTIRE TOP FLOOR, one bathroom - bathroom is small - it is NYC after all -  this is also a pre war building - I chose it because it has character but it is also not the newest - I love it - But some past guests have had a problem with the bathroom - old tub and small. If you are looking for all marble luxury spacious tub I am not the place for you - but if you are looking for a truly bohemian creative comfortable space you will love it ....  - Fully equipped kitchen (microwave, toaster, gas oven, coffee machine, fridge freezer, etc)  - No cigarett

name: Sunny Brooklyn studio
space: My Ditmas Park studio is available for short-term rentals. It's on the 4th floor of an elevator building literally two minutes away from the Q train at the Cortelyou Road stop, it's a 7 minute walk to the B express train at Newkirk, or an simple cross-the-platform transfer from the Q two stops away. As long as two people can share the bed, the studio is a good size for 1-2 people, with an occasional visitor, too. The living area is approximately 12' x 30' (approximately 33.5 square meters). There's a nice couch that folds out, a queen-sized bed, table, desk and plenty of room to walk around, a clean bathroom, and a closet to hang your clothes, if needed. The kitchen is separate and has all necessary dishes and appliances. There's wireless internet, a TV + DVD player and a Roku box (sorry, no cable, but lots of access to television and movies streaming online via amazon or netflix if you want to subscribe or have your own login). The building is safe and quiet, the residents are primari

name: Park Slope - Big, Bright and Sunny
space: Entire apartment. THE APARTMENT: I have a fully furnished, 2nd floor, bright and lovely 2 bedroom apartment. One bedroom has a street view, the other looks out over the large and leafy backyard. Each bedroom has a queen bed, and a table and chairs. The sit-in kitchen is fully equipped and the apartment has wi-fi. A great vacation rental or live/work space. THE LOCATION: South Park Slope. A very friendly, vibrant, diverse and safe neighborhood. Everything you would need or want within blocks. Walking distance to Prospect Park, BrooklynÛªs famous 5th Ave restaurant row and great friendly local bars, bakeries and coffee shops. 24hr Laundromat on the corner, supermarkets and late night delis within a block. Great vintage shops close by and 10 mins walk to a movie theatre. Three stops or twenty min walk to BAM. Street parking is easy to find. ACCESS: 30 mins to Manhattan on the subway. 5 mins walk to the R and M (to Manhattan, you change to an express train at Atlantic or DeKalb) trains, 10

name: The InstituteÛÓHeart of Williamsburg
space: Williamsburg, currently one of New York's hippest neighborhoods, is an unlikely amalgam of small houses, warehouses, clubs, coffee shops (LOTS of coffee shops) galleries, new condominiums, dozens of restaurants, a wonderful book shop, bars, performance spaces, a world-class cheese shop, thrift stores, clothing boutiques, and looming remnants of the New York waterfront's industrial past.   Our apartment is on North 7th Street, two and a half blocks from the Bedford Ave stop on the L train, the first stop in Brooklyn and a 5-minute ride from Union Square.  It's a half-block from the East River State Park, which has summer concerts and a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline.  An esplanade runs south along the river. From a landing at North 6th Street thereÛªs ferry service to various stops in Manhattan and Brooklyn. There's a running track in nearby McCarren Park and a bike path along Kent Avenue. At the end of our block, every weekend between April and November, there's Smorgasburg:

name: Private Room & Office in Shared Williamsburg Apt.
space: Enjoy a private room and adjacent office in shared apartment.  The two rooms are on one side of the apartment effectively giving you your own wing.  Apartment is located 3 blocks from the Lorimer L subway, less than a 10-minute ride to Union Square.  Conveniently located to restaurants and bars with the hip Bedford Avenue corridor just 10 minutes away by foot. The apartment has hardwood floors throughout, windows on all 4 sides (lots of light) and a charming bohemian atmosphere.  Shared apartment with a young teacher and 2 college students (one at FIT the other at NYU).   The room includes a double bed and dresser.  The office has a large desk that you should feel free to use, and the apartment has wireless internet service.  Ideal for a writer, freelance journalist or anyone who would like a dedicated workspace in addition to a private room.

name: MIDTOWN WEST - Large alcove studio
space: I am a French lady sharing my lovely large alcove studio apartment located in Midtown West Manhattan. This is an adorable and clean place, very QUIET, yet faces a courtyard and is peaceful. Very comfortable queen futon.    This place is in the heart of Manhattan at two blocks from Columbus Circle and Central Park South and at 5 min from Time Square.   Provided: * Clean Sheets and towels. * Wi-fi High Speed Internet Access.  * Washer & dryer on the building (FOR PAY) If interested, You are more than welcome to stay. From one to two weeks per month.  2min from Subway lines 1,A,C,B.D and 4min from N,W,R,Q. It is a wonderful opportunity to visit New York. Large alcÌ«ve studio situe a deux rue de Columbus Circle et Central Park Sud et a 5 min de Time Square, a partager pour des pÌ©riodes d'une a deux semaines par mois.

name: Sml Rm in pr Brst  Park Sl great for Med/students
space: Firm Queen size Bed, sleeps 2 ,in a large quiet safe airy, Private house in Park Slope, a diverse neighborhood. House is filled with art. 10 minutes to Manhattan by trains 2/3 B.Q and near buses.. It is on 4th floor  no elevator, shared bath. Near Brooklyn Botanical Garden, Brooklyn Academy of Music, and Brooklyn Library, also Prospect Park,  2 gyms, banks, laundry and food stores, and now the Barclays Center, and Atlantic Mall, many hospitals. Half an hour from JFK and La Guardia airports.  There is a microwave toaster, kettle. There are many restaurants and bars, and  amenities. I am available to assist with information on NY. Minimum stay 3 nights. Longer stays are possible. Weekly sheets and towels. Introductory E-mail required. telling me about your profession and preferences. I am a retired Rehab. Sports medicine physician, who still lectures and follows sports and am willing to listen.

name: Great apartment with private bathroom and entrance
space: Completely private room in newer townhouse with it's own separate entrance and bathroom, a bay window, 1/2 kitchen with small refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and microwave oven.  Close to east and west subways: 2, 3, 6, and MetroNorth.  Easy walk to Central Park.  Sunny, clean and comfortable.  Wireless internet in room.  It's an easy walking distance to Red Rooster, Amy Ruth's, Sylvia's, Patsy's, Orbit, Harlem Tavern, the Apollo and the Studio Museum.  In three minutes you can walk to La Marqueta and get the best bread in the city.  The Townhouse is on tree lined street, all townhouses on the block are owner occupied.  The room gets a lot of light.  There's a locked door which connects to the owner's apartment.  If you want to have linens washed just unlock the door and put laundry in the provided basket. There's an olympic size outdoor pool, free, a few blocks away.  It's open summers only, from July 4th until the end of August. Minimum stay of 5 nights. - Private studio apartmen

name: Peaceful & Cozy 1Br Apt in Residential Harlem
space: Beautiful and large one bedroom above gardens,  quiet and full of light(south exposure)  on the top floor of a brownstone building on 121st street,  close to Lenox avenue,  in the residential part of Harlem. The neighborhood is very SAFE and drastically changed in the last couple of years. Many of my girlfriends came back home, walking around in the neighborhood at 2am, and, NEVER had any problem.  Large living-room , kitcken all furnished, internet wifi access, queen size bed. A few blocs from Central Park. Minutes walking to the subway 116th street or 125th street. 12 minutes to Times Square (express trains 2 and 3). Minutes walking to lines A, B, C, D at 125th street. There are a lot of restaurants around with international cuisine,  a lot of stores, supermarkets (Whole Food is 4 blocs away) and laundry around. You can definitely be up to 4 people. In the bedroom there is a queen size bed and in the livingroom the couch once opened is also a confortable queen size bed .  There is al

name: Private Garden Apt Û¢ New Renovation
space: PLEASE NOTE:  There is a minimum 3 night stay during March due to host availability - thank you. Welcome! I have a very comfortable  modern studio apartment to rent in a gorgeous three story house in the heart of Williamsburg, Brooklyn. It's your own self-contained studio within the house. You will have all the privacy you require. The place was renovated this year so everything is new. 15 minutes from Manhattan, East Village, Union Square. 25 Minutes from Times Square and Empire State Building.  It's a super location. Check the reviews!   You'll have your own private entrance from the front garden and your own brand new fully renovated bathroom. You also have full use of the upstairs terrace which looks over the park and front garden and has a dining table an chairs for eating or drinking outside.    The apartment is a large open-plan studio apartment. Chic and modern, the apartment features a very comfy queen (double) bed, brand new bathroom with all new fixtures and a really great s

name: Nature-Themed Studio Apartment
space: From the cow print wall to the exposed brick to the brightly colored walls this is the most adorable place in Brooklyn!! Located in the East Williamsburg/ Bushwick section of Brooklyn, this clean, quaint, basement studio apartment contains a kitchenette (no oven), a small bathroom with a shower, a dehumidifier (NYC is humid in summer) and queen size bed. It s located 2 and a half blocks from the train station (J train). It has its own entrance so you can enjoy the privacy and comforts of home. The train runs express during the day to early evening. Ten minutes express to Downtown Manhattan and Twenty minutes when its local. The neighborhood is very safe and the house is located on a quiet block with access to shopping, laundry, food, etc. near the train station. This place is convenient for a romantic getaway or just a nice retreat for friends looking to hang out in NYC. The apartment has dimmers on all lights to set the perfect mood for you and your companion. Wifi Included so you can

name: Cosy Cool Apt By JMZ w/Washer-Dryer + Roof Space
space: This is a super-clean, comfortable and cosy apartment in Brooklyn.  Building is a modern walk-up with big roof looking towards the city. Apartment has central air and heating, bathroom with washer/dryer, wifi, large eat-in kitchen and is 2 minutes walk from Myrtle Avenue-Broadway subway station. Manhattan is a 15 minute subway ride away. The neighborhood which borders Bed-Stuy and Bushwick has many local convenience stores (the closest being a 24-hour greengrocer's with fresh juice and lots of organic produce) hip bars - close to hub of Williamsburg. Please feel free to email me for more information.

name: NOHO/EAST VILLAGE, PRIVATE 1/2 BATH
space: - Shared 2 BR apartment with quiet, comfortable, guest room for YOU - Guest room includes private toilet and sink - Guest room is situated on the opposite side of the apartment as my bedroom, so noise is never a problem -  Kitchen, microwave, fridge, filtered water, toaster, stove, oven, Vitamix blender etc. - Coffee - Blue Bottle or Stumptown coffee on-hand for guests to make  - Comfy queen size bed.  - Clean, high quality linens and towels and plenty of pillows - WIFI - Alarm clock - Air conditioning - HDTV w Apple TV

name: Sleek & Comfortable Soho Apt
space: This is a very comfortable 1 bedroom apartment (not a studio!) with great furnishings in one of the best neighborhoods of NYC. With easy access to Soho, West & Greenwich Village and Tribeca - the apt is in the heart of downtown NYC on a beautiful tree-lined block. Great cafes, amazing restaurants and, of course, Soho shopping are all located just blocks away.  Apartment is on the 3rd floor and is professionally cleaned prior to arrival. Fully furnished (kitchen, etc.) with a queen-sized bed and a desk in a separate bedroom. Wifi internet access is also included. Linens & towels are provided.  There is a flat-screen TV in the living room (sorry, there is to reception of local TV channels in the apt) with a good selection of books and magazines.  In addition, there is a brand new washing room in the basement of the building with a row of commercial quality washers and dryers.  Located on the same block as the 1 (red) subway line, and 2 blocks from the C,E (blue) line. AMAZING LOCATION.
