name: Cozy 2 br in sunny Fort Greene apt
space: I bedroom available in 2 bedroom apt in the fantastic neighborhood of Fort Greene This is a much loved, sun filled apartment in the heart of Fort Greene, the bustling Brooklyn neighborhood full of cultural and artistic history -- it is most famously the inspiration for many Spike Lee films with its restored brownstones and dramatic stoops, from which kids sell lemonade and locals sell their eclectic wares on the weekend. The 'hood is now a favorite for HBO shows and indie film sets that casually rent out a beautiful brownstone just a few blocks over. The 2br apartment is located smack in between every train that runs to Manhattan and to neighboring Brooklyn hotspots, DUMBO, Williamsburg and Greenpoint. Mornings are dreamy in the comfy living room with floor to ceiling windows that bring in oodles of light. The new wood floors and 11ft high ceilings are distinctly "Brooklyn" and the kitchen is just spacious enough for an at-home meal or three. Step out to a friendly 'hood: within a bloc

name: Cozy East Village Railroad 1 Bed!

The apartment can sleep 3 people and opens into the Living Room where you can find a sofa-bed and a desk with a chair.  The open kitchen gets a dining table with 4 chairs and all the cookware necessary to prepare a cosy meal. . .  The Bathroom entrance is in the kitchen and has a bathtub and shower.  The apartment is fully equipped with fresh towels and linens.  The bedroom is located in the front part of the apartment and features a queen size Bed, TV, big closet (view of fisrt avenue ).   One can use the fire-escape as  porch during the summer.  Very East Village.  :-) Be warned that since the bedroom faces First avenue, the apartment might not be ideal for light sleepers, specially on weekends and holidays when there are a lot of people in the streets having a good time. name: MODERN 2 BED 2 BATH HEART OF WILLIAMSBURG!
space: Located a few steps away from the East River, in one of the most charming neighborhoods of Brooklyn, this 2 bedroom- white oak flooring and high-ceilings apartment, is in the beating heart of North Williamsburg. Originally a warehouse, the building just recently turned into a new 6-story complex, offering all the comforts of a modern apartment, while keeping the timeless charm of an industrial past. There are 2 luxury bedrooms, with queen size beds, AC, and built-in closets. One of the two bedroom has itÛªs own in suite-bathroom. The Floor-to-ceiling warehouse style windows cast natural light and make the whole interior feel bright and spacious. The two bathrooms blend mosaic tile work with high-end finishes, including rain shower heads, over-size soaking tub, and in one of them, you can find a new built-in washer and dryer. The industrial-era design intersects with the digital age in the kitchen that mixes sleek stainless steel appliances with sparkling white surfaces on the counter-to

name: Sunny East Village Loft Apartment
space: Enjoy our sunny, happy, recently renovated loft-style apartment in the heart of the East Village. Just half a block from Tompkins Square Park and right next door to fabulous restaurants, bars, and cafes.  The apartment is open loft style with the kitchen and living room in one space. There is a master bedroom (double bed) off of the living room and off the master bedroom is a small kids room with bunk beds. It's great for a couple or a family.  The F train and the L train are a 12 minute walk. Buses are across the park. But who needs to leave the neighborhood? It's funky and full of eclectic neighbors, community gardens and independently owned businesses. We love it dearly.  It's a six floor walk up, which is a trek for the feint of heart but it gets you that lovely tree-house view. And we've got a zippy wireless connection. It's a family friendly building. A great base for exploring the city.

The building has an elevator, laundry room, and common backyard.  It is located within walking distance to the most popular restaurants and bars downtown, with the NR train one block away, 6 train two blocks away, and the ACEFV three blocks away. name: ACCOMMODATIONS GALORE #2
space: My open floor plan apartment is located on floor #2. The entrance door opens up into the  kitchen, which has hardwood floors and all amenities for a very comfortable stay: dinning table with 4 chairs, coffee maker, microwave, toaster, refrigerator, stove with 2 burners and oven.  On your left upon entering,there is a huge furnished bedroom with a full size bed, suitable for both adults and children, with enough space left for a crib or small bed for a baby, or additional sleeping.  There's also a closet and 2 large windows over looking the garden, exposing lots of natural light.      The bathroom features a shower, tub, sink, toilet, vanity, cabinets and linens.      The living room features, 2 side chairs with a full size futon-sleeping for 2,flat screen TV, and a high ceiling window.   Bedroom # 2 features full size bed with a huge window and closet, with sufficient storage. name: Colorful Private One Bedroom Apt
space: Private one bedroom (converted from a two-bedroom) on the 4th floor of an apartment on in lower Manhattan. Location:  At the northwestern edge of Chinatown and eastern edge of Little Italy: 3 blocks from Broadway and Soho, 2 blocks from Nolita.  5 minutes walking from the lower east side.  10 minutes from the west village, and so on... you can walk to any neighborhood in lower Manhattan within 20-25 minutes.  If you like, there is an extra bicycle for you to use too. The closest subway is the D train, which is three blocks away.  There is also the 6 train, 3.5 blocks away, the NRQ trains that are 4 blocks away basically everything Manhattan train is easily walkable from here.  This apartment is arguably the most central location in Manhattan. There are two bedrooms. One with a twin size and one with a queen size bed. The apartment sleeps three very comfortably in real beds. 4 is the absolute maximum -- and it means that one person must sleep on a couch/blow-up mattress/or roll-out bed

name: Huge Chelsea Loft
space: Renting my two-bedroom loft in the heart of Chelsea. In the BEST neighborhood in NYC, we are steps from multiple subway lines, some of the best bars and restaurants in the city, and the pristine Highline Park.    Our apartment is located on the second floor of a three-unit building - we have the entire floor! - and is just a few tree-lined streets away from the West Village, Meatpacking District and Union Square.   If you're tired of renting small spaces in NYC, this is the place for you.  The apartment is 1,100 square feet with two Queen bedrooms.  Both bedrooms can comfortably accommodate two people.  The foyer, living room and kitchen are super spacious (check out the pics) and we keep the apartment spotless, with the aid of a cleaning service.   It's the perfect place to kick back in front of the exposed brick fireplace on a winter afternoon, or walk down the idyllic tree tree-lined streets for brunch. The home is a converted two bedroom apartment in a historic brownstone. The houses that cover Mount Morris Park Historic District are designed in the late 19th and early 20th century residential row houses and church architecture. Romanesque Revival, neo-Grec, Queen Anne, and 1893's World Columbian Exposition in Chicago were among the influences that created the eclectic style from the Gilded Age. name: A SpeciaL!! Private Room in NY
space: Staten Island... the often forgotten borough of New York City. Just a 25 minute Ferry Ride to and from the City of New York! You will also get to see unbelievable views of the New York City Skyline and Statue of Liberty while you are crossing over. Did I mention that the Ferry is Free??? Yes it is one of the best deals you will find in NYC!! Once you cross over to lower Manhattan you will find the Metro that will take you to anywhere you want in the City. name: Smallest House In The Village
space: This is a very small, but very unique, free-standing gate house. Located in Manhattan on 3rd St between Ave B and C in the East Village. Since it's free-standing, you have no neighbors and direct access to the street. It's just you in this studio-sized, ivy-covered, brick house.  The interior space is one very small room, furnished with a loft bed, kitchenette and separate, full bathroom. The ceilings are very high - 12 feet - and there are three skylights so it feels open and gets a lot of light. There's also a side door that leads to a gated, private yard space - very rare amenity in Manhattan! There are two places to sleep - a full-sized bed in the loft or the full-sized pullout sofa.  To give you a sense of how small the space is, when the sofa bed is pulled out, there's just barely enough room to walk around it. So the space is best suited for one or two people but can officially sleep a third if they are very small and don't mind the cramped space.    The house has wireless inter

name: Beautiful modern studio apartment in heart of NYC
space: This apartment is located in the heart of Chelsea. medium rise building with elevator and has hardwood floors throughout the premises. The apartment is in a new building and very bright and clean.  The entrance door opens up into a hallway leading, on your right, to the fully tiled bathroom featuring a shower in tub, a sink and a toilet.  Further away on your right is the open kitchen with a mini bar and three stools. It is fully equipped with a stove, an oven, microwave, expresso maker, dishwasher, a sink, a refrigerator and all cookware and kitchen utensils available.  The living room features a Queen size therapeutic bed, a sofa, a flat screen TV with basic cable, wireless internet, a desk with a chair and a large windows. name: Quiet room in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn
space: Beautiful, filled with sunlight, apartment takes the entire floor, beautiful wooden floors and a great fire escape to chill in the summer.  The living room is spacious and bright with plants and artwork.   Room has 1 large window and a comfy queen size bed. Has also a nice work desk and a stereo to listen to records. Old school neighborhood. Surrounded by trees, has lots of great restaurants and it's 10 minute walk to the waterfront in Red Hook. F and G train stations are 7 minutes walk from the house. There is a CitiBike station 1 minute away.  Bike path goes directly to Brooklyn bridge and it's a pleasant 10 minute ride.

For your convenience fresh bedding and towels are available. Free unlimited Wi-Fi Internet access. My apartment is located in a quiet neighborhood in Kensington area in Brooklyn. name: Small tidy bedroom in duplex
space: Our house is a duplex; we have the top two floors of a brownstone in Park Slope. There are bedrooms upstairs, and downstairs there's a big living room and and also big kitchen/dining room. There's a bathroom on each floor. The kitchen has a dishwasher, and also our very own little laundry room with washer and dryer. We have a projector and surround sound in the living room, and we project movies onto a wall that's about 15 feet wide. We have our own private entrance which sometimes has room for a bike. We live in a great area of Park Slope with tons of great restaurants and bars. We're on the same corner as the F and G trains, on the same block as two bakeries and a bar with great live salsa and slavic soul music, and half a block from not one but TWO gourmet delis that are open all night.  And again: dishwasher, washing machine and dryer in the kitchen!!

name: Cottage in the Village
space: This is a 2-story, 2-bedroom house in the East Village. It's a very unique space - a little cottage-like house in the middle of Manhattan surrounded by trees.  Truly a rare find.   Located on East 3rd Street between Ave B and Ave C. The house is set back from the street so it's very private.  There is a large front yard with a hammock, bonfire pit and outdoor seating.  There are also several mature trees including two apple trees, an apricot tree, magnolia and cherry tree, all which bloom and produce fruit when they're in season.  Inside the house, is an open floor plan with 17 foot ceilings in the living room/kitchen area.  There are three large skylights as well.  The downstairs area contains the living room/kitchen (no microwave but all the other basics including dishware and cookware), bathroom (with huge soaking tub and shower)and one bedroom.  The bedroom offers a full-size bed, 6-drawer dresser, desk, and a closet.   Upstairs is a second, larger bedroom with ensuite bathroom.  T

name: Prime East Village 1 Bedroom
space: A clean, organized, minimal apartment in a prime East Village location.  Close to subway stations, coffee shops, bars and all the other things the East Village has to offer.  The apartment accommodates 2 comfortably.

space: PRIVATE Studio apartment in century old limestone building on tree-lined street.  Perfectly located in the historical Crown Heights neighbourhood of Brooklyn, NY.  Original fireplace details and parquet flooring create a great backdrop for the modern udpates to this studio apartment. Large window overlooking landscaped backyard* bathes this beautiful space with natural light. PRIVATE entrance and bathroom, which includes walk-in shower, towels and toiletries.  The studio is not a shared space, you alone have access. There is a microwave and small fridge in the room.  Also, the studio is Wi-Fi enabled so feel free to bring your laptops. Air conditioned  during summer months. Bordered by Bedford-Stuyvesant and Prospect Heights neighbourhoods, you have access to great cafe's, restaurants, and activities. name: cozy bedroom in lovely garden apt
space: Cozy and cheerful, super large private bedroom in a lovely Brooklyn brownstone. Located on a wonderful landmark block in the ethnically diverse and vibrant neighborhood of Crown Heights. The space offers all the comforts that a home away from home can provide, plus a beautiful garden refuge! Approximately 25 mins. from Manhattan by train and in close proximity to some of Brooklyn's many charms ex. the historic Brooklyn museum,botanical gardens, prospect park,Brooklyn children's museum, and a host of wonderful restaurants,whatever your budget! Your own private bedroom has a sitting area with television,dvd player,ipod dock,wifi, selection of books and magazines... even a yoga mat!Sounds good,doesn't it? Well,it gets better ! The space has 2 separate entrances on 2 different floors... so you can come and go as you please. And let's not forget the benefits of a garden reprieve! When the weather is cool,have your breakfast outside. When it is hot,get all the sun you want without going to t

name: East village one bedroom apartment
space: Super cute east village one bedroom apartment available. There is lots of light, cute eclectic furniture, the apartment is very clean an comfortable.  There is a leaving room, a bedroom, a kitchen and a bathroom.  There is wifi and laundry in the basement. The kitchen is equipped with all you need to cook. I provide linen and bed sheets. You have the entire apartment for yourself and it's in the middle of "happening east village". Lots of new bars and restaurant on Avenue C, 5 minutes from lower east side, 15 min from Soho. It is facing a park, quiet and safe. You can come back at night to an area that is very alive and great for the nightlife if you wish or rest quietly at a comfy home. The place is great for a couple and can accommodate an extra person who  sleeps on an inflatable mattress. $50 per extra person per night. from $110/night. PLEASE AWAIT CONFIRMATION FROM ME BEFORE BOOKING:)

name: Crown Heights Garden Apt.
space: Spacious & modern (2010 construction) on a landmarked block. Mint condition, partially furnished (queen-sized bed, nightstand) 1 bedroom with en suite bathroom and private entrance.  Special amenities: microwave, toaster oven, wireless Internet, mini-refrigerator, cable television. Linens are professionally laundered and we provide towels. Ours is a quiet and safe building on a land-marked block in a safe, diverse and conveniently located a safe, centrally-located neighbourhood. Convenient and plentiful public transportation options - 'A', 'C', '3' and LIRR trains; bus lines - 'B44', 'B49', 'B65'. 30 minutes by train to Midtown Manhattan. 25 minute cab ride to JFK and La Guardia airports. Great dining - especially Caribbean & Asian restaurants. Brooklyn Museum, Brooklyn Botanical, Brooklyn Children's Museum are within walking distance.

name: Charming East Village Studio
space: The studio is well-designed and makes the most of a small space.  While perfect for 1 or 2 people, the space easily converts for 2 couples to sleep very comfortably.  Since the newest renovation in April 2014, the apartment has been redesigned to offer an entertainment space for you or your travel companions who are staying in hotels farther from the action than you are.  I've moved most of my stuff to storage to allow plenty of room to comfortably entertain guests before heading out to the clubs, bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.  You will surely enjoy the privacy and an absence of street noise as the cozy decor helps you rest up for your next mission out in the city.  I put together a guide for all the food and entertainment in the neighborhood to help make the most of your stay.  I want you to pester me with questions on everything.  NYC time disappears quickly, so I want you to have the best time possible.  When you arrive, I always make sure to spend the time to properly c

name: Pied-a-terre sort of place
space: ~Queen bed, full bath, small kitchen. Perfect for one or two person. ~Quiet, historic street off West End Avenue. ~I think this place is perfect, and you'll love it too if . . . ~You prefer warm, dark, cozy over sunny, big and bright. Writers, readers, binge watchers. And/or those who are out all day and just use the apartment as a big bedroom.   ~FYI, because it is on the ground floor, you will hear my neighbors come and go during peak hours - in the morning to work, esp. And the buzzer on the intercom at dinner time, since many people order dinner in on weeknights.

name: ENJOY Downtown NYC!!
space: Your own comfy and private room with a queen size bed in the fun & vibrant, bohemian enclave of the East Village. An awesome location for exploring the city, NYC's best restaurants & bars, live-music and seeing how NYer's live. Best for budget travelers looking for a safe, clean, convenient home base to experience NYC. It is in a three bedroom BASEMENT apartment with shared bathroom & kitchen. Sharing with other guests, my roommate and his wife. Experienced Host - ask me any questions you may have and read some of the reviews. Hundreds of guests have enjoyed NYC from this humble abode, and I have made it quite comfy. For travelers wanting to be in an awesome neighborhood for an affordable price, this is one of the best options out there.

name: Charming UWS Treehouse Apt
space: *Please be sure to make an informal inquiry before requesting to book, thanks! Lovely and amazing apt in the heart of the Upper West Side.  Conveniently located only a few minutes from the 72nd street subway station. Nestled between Central Park and Riverside Park on a quiet tree lined block, the apartment is only five minutes walking distance from Lincoln Center, and there are plenty of great shops and restaurants all within close proximity.  Comfortable, spacious living room leads directly out to a large private gardened deck that overlooks a quaint courtyard. Cozy bedroom dons an incredibly comfortable wall to wall king sized bed.   If you have any additional questions about the apartment or the neighborhood, please don't hesitate to inquire. Many thanks!

name: Share a HOME - $75 for 1 bdrm/++ for 2 - Brooklyn

You will be enjoying the top 2 floors of a 3 story home and have wireless internet, use of a kitchen for light cooking and a dining room as well. We are close to the A/C/G/Shuttle train and 12 minutes by train from Manhattan. Williamsburg can be accessed by the 44 bus, which is one block away - and the 26 bus drops you off in front of the house from downtown brooklyn.  A number of good ethnic restaurants and cute coffe shops are within walking distance. Single or couple are welcome. The space is available for full or partial week and prices may vary for a longer term booking, traditionally with a minimum stay of 5 days and maximum of 3 weeks. The room you will be enjoying is filled with light.  It  has a full size memory foam and coil bed that is brand new and wrapped in organic cotton.  Linens and towels provided are made from organic

name: Farmhouse Apartment in Williamsburg
space: Sublet-Fun and Dreamy 1 Bedroom includes WIFI/Utilities (Williamsburg, Brooklyn) Our entire fabulously furnished 1 Bedroom apartment is available with flexible dates while we are away. It is located near the coolest cafes, hardwood floors throughout, vintage clothing stores, health food markets, trains 5-10 minutes from Manhattan (L, J, M, & Z), free WIFI, the price includes the utilities, super clean bathroom, handmade rustic, wooden cabinets, tables and bed, separate kitchen and living room, and high ceilings!!! If you are searching for the PERFECT COZY AND SWEET apartment to rejuvenate after an adventurous day in New York City, then our farmhouse style space is your place!   GREAT LOCATION!  DELIGHTFUL & RELAXING! We can accommodate bag drop offs and late arrivals by request. As well as baggage storage if you arrive early. Please email for more details!

name: Bright+Spacious Williamsburg Abode!
space: There is one full size bed that comfortably accommodates up to two people or a couple. The bathroom has a shower with a very large old fashioned tub. And the kitchen has all of the supplies and cookware needed for a gourmet night in if you should decide to.  It is also nice to spend the mornings relaxing, reading or sipping tea or coffee in the light flooded living room.  In the summer there is a wonderful cross breeze when the windows are open, and there is a strong AC unit for when the temperatures get high. In the winter the heat is automatically on plus there is an additional radiator for very chilly nights. You will be comfortable and cozy no matter what the season. *Please get in touch before reserving the apartment to let me know how long you want to stay and a little bit about yourself/your trip to NYC. Thanks!

name: Suite Sugar Hill, Harlem, Private Rm in Hosted Apt
space: An urbane, bright study-guest room in the storied Sugar Hill Historic District--the Washington Heights bluff overlooking Harlem. Conveniently located near the blue A/C subway (metro) line and several bus routes. Ideal for the intrepid single traveler seeking an urban experience steeped in authentic neighborhood ambiance. The study-guest room's living area includes a firm twin (single) bed, 3-drawer clothes chest, hanging closet space, a/c and a lockbox with key for valuables. Study area includes a work desk, free wifi and shelves of NYC-related books, maps and guides at your disposal. The fully-equipped kitchen is also shared. Any race, nationality or gender and gay-friendly. I offer every guest a free walking tour of several sites of local interest, including: * Dance Theatre of Harlem * Marjorie ElliotÛªs Jazz Parlor * Hispanic Society Museum * Morris-Jumel Mansion * Trinity Church Cemetery & Mausoleum * Church of the Intercession * Yankee Stadium (Bronx) * Hamilton Grange * Convent A

name: Crown of The Heights I
space: Check-in is from 7am to 12pm.  Quiet, clean, air conditioned, private and cozy furnished room with shared bathroom. The apartment is WiFi ready.  A little history about our park. Ever wonder about a particular park you took the time to stroll through? Try this one out for size. Brower Park is located in north Crown Heights, adjacent to the Brooklyn Children's Museum. Its history is rich and its friends are many. It was once named Bedford Park. In 1894 Bedford Park contained five acres. It was laid out in early spring. Work had begun in March and was completed in July of that year. The Museum of the Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences was located in this park. It was housed in the William Newton Adams House until it moved to its new location on Eastern Parkway, to become the Brooklyn Museum. A little history on the neighborhood. name: Historic House Boerum Hill, BK, NYC
space: Historic row house on tree lined block of brownstone Brooklyn,  House on two floors  is dripping with architectural details and antiques. A washer/dryer in the basement, and a large living room/ dining room, kitchen on the parlor floor with 11 foot ceilings.  The kitchen was completely redone in 2010 and includes a cappuccino machine, dishwasher, microwave and five burner gas stove. The master bedroom and kitchen floors and walls were refurbished in 2013.  There's a lovely private back garden and two very sweet cats! Because of antiques and stairs it is not suitable for small children. Premium cable TV with Roku, wireless internet, linens, etc. are included.

space: ***Please inquire about availability before booking as my travel schedule changes frequently.*** This is not the apartment for people who like Times Square. While it's hard to go wrong most anywhere in NY for food, here new chefs are taking chances merging traditional food with new flavors. YouÛªll have access to your own private bedroom, and shared livingroom, kitchen and full bathroom with the host.åÊ

The Vernon on Greene is located 2 short blocks from the mass transit J line train which can then whisk you to all points in Manhattan within minutes.  The Vernon on Greene is fully furnished with lots of natural sunlight and designed with you as the guest in mind. From crisp high thread count sheets with cozy duvet covers and soft pillows to a 40 inch TV with FREE WiFi, cable TV and incredible audio docking station that plays your iPad, iPod & iPhone through out the apartment. The Vernon on Greene can accommodate 6 guests as follows: 2 ÛÒ Queen Bed in Bedroom #1 2 ÛÒ Full Bed in Bedroom #2 2 ÛÒ Pull out futon bed in Living Room 6   Total A fully functional kitchen awaits you where youÛªll find dishes and cookware for all your epicurean desires. space: The space Great apartment, large, beautiful, clean & cozy. Full of natural sunlight in a very diverse & friendly neighborhood, with a wide array of shops, parks, museums, clubs, restaurants, trains & buses nearby. A real gem, you are safe here. Welcome home. Also its well lit, you have windows in every room. It's fully furnished with the most comfortable King size bed, sheets, towels, TV, DVD player, stereo, plates, cups, electric kettle, utensils, and wifi Internet.

name: Lovely 1BR in Tree-lined WBurg
space: Light-filled 1BR apartment in a new building. 2nd floor of a 5 story building on a quiet, tree-lined street. There is a terrace which looks out to backyards and I have a giant bathroom (jacuzzi-style bathtub) and really nice, new, well-equipped kitchen (I am a chef:) with dishwasher.  The place is great for a couple or one person. I was born and raised in Brooklyn, so if you need any ideas of where to go or what to do, I can surely help. Especially for restaurants... The house is 3 blocks from the L and G trains, second stop in Brooklyn (Lorimer St.). It is also close to the JMZ. No smoking in the apartment (though you may on terrace) and please be considerate of neighbors as this is the more chilled, family-oriented part of Williamsburg, although the rest is a short walk away. Possibility of renting bicycle as well. 15 minutes on bike to Union Square in Manhattan.  I hope to hear from you!

name: Spacious Loft in Clinton Hill
space: This is a 1300 sq feet loft with a relaxed atmosphere on the Clinton Hill/Bed Stuy border that we mostly rent during summer vacations. Queen size bed on the loft and a full size bed in a separate room. In addition   there is a super comfy deluxe queen size blow up mattress that comes with a headboard and a queen size foam mattress.  The apt. can comfortably sleep a total of 6. Large eat-in kitchen where cooking is a pleasure. One bathroom with shower, no tub. There is large air conditioner that cools the whole loft in minutes and a Modine industrial heater. Supermarket right below that has everything you need. Subway(G train) is 4 blocks away. You can be in Times Square or Union Square  in about 35-40 mins. Lots of different restaurants in the area: Mexican, Chinese, Italian, Peruvian, Japanese....they all deliver! Our local wine shop also delivers...yeyy! Fort Greene Park is close by. Great hangout during the summer with lots of activities and free music. There is laundry on every flo

space: We are offering the entire bottom level of our spacious garden duplex apartment. The generous, beautifully appointed one bedroom studio space (650 sq. feet) is located in a prime, safe, and very convenient area of Brooklyn on a quiet tree-lined street.   Our location in the lovely neighborhood of Fort Greene/Clinton Hill, is just a short 12 minute ride from Manhattan. We are located 2 blocks from the C and G trains at Clinton/Washington, and an 7 minute walk to the 2,3,4,5,N,R,and D trains and LIRR (which can take you to the Long Island/Queens beaches) at Atlantic Terminal. We are a 3 mile walk across either the Brooklyn or Manhattan Bridge to Manhattan and only 11 miles from both major airports. This unique neighborhood offers everything for both the modern family and the modern hipster. We are within close and comfortable walking distance to Brooklyn's famous bridges, museums, parks, zoo, and other tourist attractions. Both have outdoor lights, overlook a nice garden, and have plantings.)   There is a queen-sized bed in the private bedroom with closing door. This beautiful home is on an historic tree-lined block, between Central Park West and Columbus Avenue, near major museums, shopping, and subways.   The owner prefers to accommodate two adults. space: Hi there! This is a cozy and impeccable one bedroom apartment in the heart of Williamsburg on North 1st Street.  One of the hippest and lively neighborhoods in New York City nowadays. As well as local Designer Stores, Vintage Stores, Apple Store, Whole Foods Supermarket, Food Town Supermarket, Urban Outfitters, Madewell, Music Hall of Williamsburg, Knitting Factory, Baby's All Right, Rough Trade, Brooklyn Steel, Yoga Studios, Pilates Studio, Spinning Studios, Equinox, Williamsburg Cinema, Nitehawk Cinema, Cafes, Citi Bank and Citi Bikes, Bank of America, Laundries, Pharmacies, Delis, Park, all just around the corner. name: 2 BR w/ Terrace @ Box House Hotel
space: Charming 2 bedroom loft @ The Box House Hotel. Located in the industrial chic area of North Greenpoint in Brooklyn, The Box House Hotel features contemporary lofts and suites with large windows. Each apartment-style accommodation at The Box House Hotel is styled with bright colors, hardwood floors, antiques and contemporary art. Select rooms have a terrace and views of Midtown Manhattan. Relax in the spacious living area with a 42" flat-screen HD TV with premium cable channels. One bedroom is equipped with a king size bed, while the 2nd bedroom features 2 twin beds. There is also a pull out sofa in the living room that sleeps two additional guests. The kitchen is equipped with a refrigerator, stovetop, microwave oven and dish ware. Free wifi is provided throughout the property. The suite offers 200 sq ft of private outdoor deck, which will be the perfect place to unwind and enjoy the NYC views!

name: Cozy/Stylish Williamsburg 1 Bedroom
space: My home is very charming and well-appointed. There's one bedroom which is ideal for a single traveler or a couple. It could also work easily for two friends so long as one doesn't mind sleeping on the comfy couch! There's natural lighting that flows into the eat in kitchen. Some of the amenities include air conditioning and can also be accessed by the L train at Lorimer. You're just steps away from Williamsburg's most fashionable bars and restaurants. You also get the old town feeling with a modern touch. There are also great parks in the area to walk around during the warm seasons! In terms of transportation, this apartment is just off the second stop of the J/M train and is great for getting around anywhere in Manhattan! So you know: the apartment does face the elevated subway tracks, so the sound of the train is unavoidableÛÓbut more than manageable.

name: Oceanfront Apartment in Rockaway

Any chef would love the spacious kitchen.  There is a dining table for four as well as a kitchen bar. The bedroom has a queen size bed and there is a queen size air mattress.  The couch is specially designed as an oversized couch that can sleep two people. The ceilings are high and the windows over sized, flooding the apartment with natural light. name: Bright Room With A Great River View
space: Come and enjoy a bright sunny cozy room in a  3 bedroom classic prewar building on Riverside Drive in upper Manhattan. The room has  a great view  of the Hudson River and the George Washington Bridge. This room is ideal for students or traveling adults looking for a  comfortable temporary and affordable accommodation.  The room is petite and is best suited for 1 person It has a semi private entrance with its own 1/2 bathroom. It's a large apartment by New York standards with 2 entrances. One entrance leads almost directly into the bedroom. This is great for the guest as your comings and goings don't bother anyone at all. The 1/2 bath has its own sink and toilet allowing for your additional privacy.  I will provide bedding,  linens and towels as needed. There is a laundry facility available for use 7 days per week in the basement of the building from 8am to 9pm. The apartment is located in front of Riverbank State Park offering a swimming pool, track, gym, soccer field, basketball court

name: Tree lined block modern apartment
space: Brand new large 1 bedroom + alcove on a beautiful brownstones tree lined block in Clinton Hill.  Located in a new development, very quiet, and spacious. Car service (taxi) available by phone call. Go to 'Bikesmith' on Smith St. to rent bikes. The neighborhood is very diverse with great local shops and places to eat. name: Sunny Top Floor Fort Greene Two Bedroom
space: You will love your stay in this beautiful two bedroom located on Mansion Row in the heart of historic Fort Greene/Clinton Hill. The apartment is on the top floor of a 6-story pre-war art deco elevator building -- tons of light, courtyard views, garden access and very quiet. There are two bedrooms both with queen/full beds, a large living/dining room, another small common area with loveseat, and a separate kitchen, fully stocked. I have a TV (but just for playing DVD's, no channels) and a projector for watching movies. There is laundry in the basement and access to a large courtyard with vegetable gardens and places to sit and relax. In the summer, you can enjoy access to my garden plot.  The apartment is just across the street from the Brooklyn Flea, near Fort Greene Park, the Fort Greene farmer's market, all Dekalb shops, bars & restaurants and a short walk to the BAM cultural district. Easy access to Manhattan on the C or G train and a short walk to most train lines at the Atlantic C

This duplex is located on the lower 2 levels of a historic rowhouse. space: High ceiling, tastefully equipped, brick walled studio with fire place, art and queen size bed. Sunny, 3rd floor walk-up. Wireless Internet. space: Welcome to the treehouse! It is an inspiring place to plan a day in the (URL HIDDEN) oasis above New York where you can feel safe, happy and inspired! space: This is a very central, large loft-like studio apartment with tall windows and lots of sunlight.  Apt has high ceilings.  Metro / subway is a few steps away from the apartment.  Times Square is only 15 minutes walk away.   Sight-seeing like the Empire State Building or the High Line Park are only about 10 minutes walk. The apartment is completely private.  I have a high response rate and excellent reviews from guests, so please feel free to ask me any questions.  My guests feel the location is perfect, especially for shopping & sight seeing, and I have lots of room for storing shopping.  There are 2 elevators right in front of the apt door. The metro / subway station and bus are right outside your door.   Herald Square / Macy's shopping area are just 5 minutes walk away.  The main train station, Penn Station, and Whole Foods grocery store, are both 3 minutes walk away.  Across the street is a 24 hour convenience store that sells all kinds of supplies and food, with a pharmacy.  24 hour

name: 3 Bedroom Soho
space: The apartment has a Eat in kitchen and full sized living room. The apartment  is in the Back of building so its very quiet. Right in the heart of Downtown. Two rooms have double beds one has a single bed. The tenants of the building have all lived here for years and are respectful and quiet. So inturn we return the favor =)  There are many train lines to take you to the best sites. You are walking distance Soho ( great shopping), Chinatown(authentic food), LES is walking distances for bars and live music, little Italy for coffee and canolli in the morning.  Tip: We are on 4th floor walk up so pack accordingly. This is a 100 year old building. The apartment is very clean but the appliances have not been updated.  Perks: Bug & Critter free!! Fresh linens and towels provided Non-Smoker Clean & tidy The apartment is a 4th floor walk up.  Wireless/cable.

name: Cozy Private Room in West Harlem!
space: Hey there!!  Thanks for checking out my room It's a spacious, warm, cozy bedroom in the heart of west Harlem. It shares an apt with 2 other rooms. Apartment has a bathroom, living room, kitchen, and wifi.  You're able to cook, use the fridge, but not eat the food (and please clean up after yourself). Room comes furnished with a clean full-size bed with comfy pillows , 2 windows, warm lighting, a table, a desk, and two chairs. My roommates will be home but at work or moving about the city. They are two amazing ladies, one with her mom coming to visit who will be sleeping on the sofa-bed in the living room at night. She is cooking Christmas dinner on Christmas Day and you're welcome to have some if you like :)  I love this house it's a really home. If you want to come to visit New York and feel at home and welcome this is the place.  Building has a secured,locked front entrance and secured apartment. Room is quiet and clean within a diverse community. The available room comes with a lock

name: UES Quiet & Spacious 1 bdrm for 4
space: Located on the same block as the subway this is a top-floor apartment that has tons of natural light (7 windows) and is a perfect alternative to being near the craziness of downtown Manhattan while also being within minutes of Museum Mile (Central Park is 2 1/2 blocks away and the Guggenheim & Met are only 15 minutes walking distance away). For sleeping there is a full size bed + a trundle bed (which can be used for 2 people separately or as a king). The sheets are quality high thread count and the towels heavy Turkish. There are plenty of linens, fresh towels, dresser drawers, and closet space for your use. Block is loaded with all the amenities of the city....2 grocery stories, pizza place, florist, library, Starbuck's, organic market, etc. There are several 24 hour vendors (a CVS, a fresh market, and a deli) within 3 minutes of the apt. Apt is located only 15 steps from the #6 subway station at 96th Street  yet because of its location in the rear of building, is extremely quiet. Mod

name: Rm in Beautiful Luxury Apt. Bldg
space: Private Bright Sunny Room in Beautiful Luxury Apartment Building in Downtown Brooklyn, just 10 minutes away from Manhattan and close to all subways, buses, bridges and railroads, with a large beautiful garden on the grounds with a variety of seating areas and a meditate areas, secure 24 hr. door-service and security, laundry room, and nearby parking. Also, shorts walks to Brooklyn Heights Promenade, Ft. Green Park and other cultural sites.

name: Brooklyn- Crown Heights Garden Apt.
space: 1 bedroom garden level apartment with private bathroom. Modern (2010 construction) on a landmarked block. Mint condition, partially furnished queen-sized bed.  Special amenities: microwave, toaster oven, wireless Internet, mini-refrigerator. Linens are professionally laundered and we provide towels. Ours is a quiet and safe building on a land-marked block in a safe, diverse and conveniently located a safe, centrally-located neighbourhood. Convenient and plentiful public transportation options - 'A', 'C', '3' and LIRR trains; bus lines - 'B44', 'B49', 'B65'. 30 minutes by train to Midtown Manhattan. 25 minute cab ride to JFK and La Guardia airports. Great dining - especially Caribbean & Asian restaurants. Brooklyn Museum, Brooklyn Botanical, Brooklyn Children's Museum are within walking distance.

name: Cozy room in Time Square!
space: Rent a cozy room in a huge and cozy 2br-apartment in Time Square for your staying in the big apple! All of the above just few steps from Time Square, with easy access to all the best spots in the city! You must be clean and responsible! and love cats!   The room (with Queen size bed) is available for up to 4 (four) consecutive days/nights, you choose the dates,according to availability! The price averages around $69-175 (depending on season and availability) per night for one guest, and additional $30-50 per night for a second guest, see updated listing for more accurate pricing.  The rental price includes unlimited WiFi internet access, and ALL THE APPLICABLE TAXES that are charged to me by the website.   No smoking, No excessive drinking, and No outside guests are allowed in the apartment. Absolutely NO FOOD

name: Style in Stuyvesant Heights
space: This charming and spacious 1+ bedroom apartment is located on a quiet block in the heart of the historical section of Stuyvesant Heights, Brooklyn. The apartment is on the second floor of an owner occupied brownstone and it was recently renovated and fully furnished.  The owner is an Italian woman from Florence, Italy with 20 years experience of New York (yes, we speak Italian!). Roberta is on hand to give advice about the neighborhood, make recommendations and give directions. The apartment has a queen sized bed (UK king) in the bedroom as well as a through room with a sofa bed that can sleep an additional two people. (There are separate doors to each bedroom) It is very comfortable for 4. Lots of the original details such as stained glass skylights, fire place mantels and moldings were saved during the renovations. name: Crown of the Heights II
space: Great room with a view of the park. Location is closed to two train stations that will take you into the city in 15 min. The neighborhood is iconically Brooklyn with lovely brownstones. Hallway full bathroom for exclusive use of my guests Washer/Dryer closet, large hallway closet, linen closet, kitchen pantry, and bedroom closets.

name: Park Slope Apt:, Spacious 2 bedroom
space: Imagine a quiet, spacious apartment, with beautiful sunlight, just steps from the terrific restaurants and shops of this wonderful neighborhood.  Near many subway stops (including the R train 1/2 block away), easy to get to Manhattan; four blocks from Prospect Park; near to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden and Brooklyn Museum.  You'll have the best of both worlds: you'll be in a fun, hip, laid-back neighborhood, but close to the sights and action of Manhattan! The apartment is a duplex with two large bedrooms, two full baths, terrace, fully stocked kitchen, dw, wi-fi. You would be sharing the place with me - and my cat. Extended stays and a willingness to take care of my wonderful cat yield a discount! I'd greatly appreciate it if you would make an inquiry so we can e-chat for a bit before sending an offer.

name: NYC Studio for Rent in Townhouse
space: This is a large studio room with a private bathroom for rent in the historical and breathtaking district of West Harlem in Manhattan.  Explore some of the oldest architecture  left in Manhattan. Near famous NYC restaurants like Red Rooster and Sylvia's.  Harlem stretches from the East River west to the Hudson River between 155th Street; where it meets Washington Heights. Central Harlem begins at 110th Street, at the northern boundary of Central Park; Spanish Harlem is in Eastern Harlem and extends south to 96th Street, while in the west the neighborhood begins north of Upper West Side, which gives aborder west of Morningside Avenue. Walking distant to Central Park and subway station. Cable Television, Wi-fi and private phone for your use. Close to Columbia University and less than 30 minutes to Times Square by train. Well priced and all you need for a holiday here in NYC. Why stay in the outer boroughs when you can be in the heart of the city in a place all to your own!  You also don't

name: Cozy and Bright One Bedroom in BK
space: Spacious and newly renovated one bedroom apartment just north of McCarren Park in Greenpoint, Brooklyn (on the Williamsburg border - perfect location!)  One block from Nassau G Train, 10 minute walk to Bedford L Train (one stop to Manhattan).  Close to great restaurants and bars - favorites include Five Leaves (incredible brunch) and No Name Bar (there's no sign out front, so you have to know it's there!)  The apartment is on the 2nd floor, and features a full size bed and large sectional couch. There is an upright piano in the living room, tuned and ready to play.  Sunlight really pours into the bedroom, keeping it bright and warm.  The building is quaint and quiet, and a perfect place to retire to after a day of exploring the city. Many of the past reviews mention a cat who lived here, but she will no longer be here while guests are visiting!

name: Beautiful & Quiet Williamsburg Apt
space: This  awesome, beautiful, spacious railroad apartment just 3 blocks to the Lorimer L train stop is all yours. Comfortable, quiet, completely furnished, wifi, air conditioning, all utilities and linens included. Private roof access with panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, Brooklyn and Queens. The master bedroom is peaceful and serene, with lots of light and a full sized bed.  Should you have an extra guest that does not mind a couch, there is a comfy couch in the living room to stretch out on, along with plenty of linens, blankets and pillows.  A very nice neighborhood with 2 supermarkets, laundromat, cool bars, coffee shops and restaurants very close, and only a 10 minute walk to the popular Bedford stop where it's all happening.  It takes under 8 minutes by train to get to the East Village in Manhattan or Union Square. The apartment includes two loving and delightful adult cats, who (if you are cool with cats), you will surely love and are cool and charming dudes.

name: Immaculate!1 BR East Village/Bowery
space: Come Play in New York, what are you waiting forÛ_Û_Û_ Live like a New Yorker in my Newly Renovated Apt with Modern Decor and A/C in Bedroom and Living Room on (East 4th street between 1st and 2nd avenues) a quiet tree lined East Village Street. Easy 1 Flight walk up.     You are in the heart of the East Village and only steps from Soho, Union Square, Greenwich Village, and the Lower East Side.   The City is Easy to Travel with the subway access only a few blocks away to the B, D, F, N, R, 6 Trains and Express Buses on 1st and 2nd avenues.   This downtown Manhattan home is perfect for accessing the city for a holiday in New York, Amazing Restaurants, People Watching, Shopping and Great Nightlife Surround this apartment.  There is a Whole Foods Grocery Market on 4 blocks away.  There is an amazing very large Wine Store (Astor Wines) 2 blocks away, East Village Cheese Shop is nearby and Laundry Service next door.  The East Village has everything you could possibly need and much, much more at

name: MINIMALIST APT. HIGH-LINE AREA
space: This is the most charming place in the area. The apartment is a one bedroom apartment with its own bathroom. Its an historic building in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Manhattan. In the heart of west Chelsea. 5 minutes walk from major train lines. All in the same area the best restaurants and nightlife of the city. (Chelsea, Meatpacking). Blocs away from the new High line. And right next to the Piers and the Hudson River Park. By far the most perfect place to be in the summer time in New York. The apartment is just elegant and cozy. Perfect for a romantic get away with your girl or your boy. You will be better than in a 5 star hotel. Like in the tranquility of your own house. The kitchen is full equipped and  there's also a huge living room with a Flat 46 LED with apple TV and Cable. Theres of course AC in the UNIT, security, doorman and elevator.

name: Park Ave 1Br - heart of Manhattan
space: The apartment has been updated in summer 2016:  Large 1 bedroom apartment is located on the 4th floor of an elevator brownstone. Brand-new furniture, top-of-the-line Tempurpedic full-size bed, comfortable sofa bed in the living room, 52" flat screen TV, high-speed Wi-Fi.  There is an AC in each room to provide an optimal temperature during hot summer days and "just-in-case" space heater for extra-cold NYC winter nights. The apartment faces south, therefore, gets plenty of sunlight.

name: Sunny and Spacious Designer's Home
space: This thoughtfully designed and light-filled space is located right in the middle of two of Brooklyn's best neighborhoods: Greenpoint and Williamsburg. It hits the sweet spot of being a quiet neighborhood but also a short walk away from all types of fun and excellent bars and restaurants. The space was recently featured on Homepolish (search for "Our Designer's Personal Brooklyn Retreat").

name: Sunny Apartment in West Village
space: Stylish one-bedroom in classic West Village prewar building. Ten-foot ceilings and great light. Renovated kitchen and bath with soaking tub. On a charming, tree-lined street, one block from the river. Elevator access.

name: Truly Amazing Oasis In The City
space: Holiday or business trip to New York City? Williamsburg is the spot for the globe-trotting young and hip. The coolest bars, restaurants, galleries and shopping in NYC in one of the most centrally-located and sought-after neighborhoods in the city. Just a 5 minute walk to the famous Bedford Avenue L train station (2 minute ride from Manhattan's East Village). Fully furnished. Gorgeous Wood Floors, Full Kitchen, exposed original wood beams, jacuzzi, free laundry + wi-fi and a huge Brooklyn Botanic Backyard on a quiet and safe landmarked historic street in the heart of it all. You are literally just steps from everything in the neighborhood (supermarkets, coffee roasters, cheese shops, bars, restaurants), and you are closer to downtown Manhattan (Soho, Village, Tribeca), than if you stayed in Midtown Manhattan. 10 minutes to Manhattan on the subway... including your walk. This very comfortable studio apartment sleeps 4 people and has a microwave, toaster, coffee maker, hairdryer, ironing

name: cozy room in east Harlem

name: East Village, King-Sized, Charmer
space: This charming three room, one bedroom apt in the East Village has lots of the old New York charm and was painstakingly renovated in November 2012. There's plenty of sunlight, and windows with cross breezes, on a quiet tree lined street with a police precinct up the block.  Added in the most recent renovation is a standing shower in the kitchen, a lovely sleeping loft, a king-size Tempurpedic mattress, 42" flat screen TV, and a European style cooking kitchen with a under-the-counter two drawer refrigerator. The Apt. Includes: - 3 separate rooms + water closet - A KING-Sized Tempurpedic Bed! - Sheets and towels are included. - A sleeping loft,  good for a tall adult or two small children. -  Free WiFi - 42" HDTV w/ Apple TV, Netflix, Hulu Plus enabled (no cable). -  iMac computer to check emails. -  Air Conditioning  - iPod hook-up to stereo w/ speakers in every room.  - Amazing soaking tub in huge kitchen with shower. - A separate water closet. - 4th Fl walk-up - a dog does live here, i

name: Affordable Furnished Apartment
space: Clean, uncluttered, fully-furnished studio apartment on beautiful tree lined block in downtown Brooklyn.  Minutes away from the hottest spots in Brooklyn and Manhattan.  Apartment has a queen sized bed and high quality convertible couch. Fully equipped kitchen, 3-piece bath with large tub, fresh linens and towels, hairdryer, iron, electrical converter are all supplied. Free cable, wifi and whisper quiet state-of-the-art air conditioning. Please read our reviews to see if the apartment is right for your travel needs!

name: Architect's Brownstone
space: Our gorgeous brownstone, deck and backyard is located on the most beautiful, quiet, tree-lined block in Park Slope.  It is a duplex recently designed by AJSDesign. The house includes 3 bedrooms (king, twin, and twin +  extra floor mattresses if needed), a separate study boasting an egg-shaped free standing stone-bath, and a contemplative area, overlooking our back yard.  The bedrooms floor includes a wet room, and another full shower.  The living floor includes a piano, and decorated in a tasteful mix of modern furniture and organic wood. The kitchen is a stunning combination of stainless steel and raw wood, and fully equipped chef's cooking facilities.  There is a living area and separate large dining area. The basement includes a washer-dryer.  The backyard includes a large trampoline. We are a quick 15 minutes car or train ride from downtown Manhattan, and are located 2 short blacks away from many trains. Steps from Prospect Park, the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens, Brooklyn Museum, Bro

name: LUXURY SOHO 2 Bedroom Apt
space: I am looking to rent my luxurious and spacious (1000sq. feet), two bedroom apartment in Nolita, a very high-end and luxurious neighborhood in New York City, steps away from Soho.  The area is one of New York's most desirable locations and is filled with shops, restaurants, art galleries and museums.  It is in walking distance of Little Italy, Chinatown, Greenwich Village and The Lower East Side. It is also close to many subways and a short taxi ride way to Times Square and Central Park.   The apartment is beautifully decorated and newly renovated. It also has wireless internet connection, a 47" Plasma HDTV with cable, exposed brick, wood floors, skylights, etc., along with a beautiful outdoor garden area. It is also equipped with every amenity one could need in the kitchen and/or home. Its really a find for the city and is just a beautiful place.  Please let me know if you are interested and would like to learn more. Cheers!

name: Charming Nolita Apartment!!
space: amazing 1 bedroom apartment with charm & character in one of NYC best neighborhoods! The apartment is on the 2nd FL, gets lots of sunlight & has all the amenities you will need. Steps to the best restaurants & shopping in the city. Access to the subway outside my door. Nolita/Soho is a neighborhood filled with things to do...art gallery's, museums, spas, Angelika Theater. Great central downtown location where you can walk to the East or West Village & Lower East Side within minutes.

name: EAST VILLAGE STUDIO, sunny & quiet
space: Greetings from the East Village and welcome to my apartment. It's a fantastic place in my favorite New York neighborhood with hundreds of restaurants and bars within a few steps. Located in the heart of the East Village, my apartment is newly renovated, with a super comfortable bed, couch, kitchen and bathroom. There is lots of sun in the apartment in the afternoon and it is incredibly quiet since it faces the backyard and a retirement center across the way. For transportation, the apartment is a 10 minute walk to the L train or the F train and a 5 minute walk to local buses. Taxis are easily accessible as well. Please email me if you have any questions, would like more pictures or need references of folks who have rented at my place before. If you're interested in weekly or monthly rates, let me know. Looking forward to hearing from you and please tell me a bit about yourself as when in your message. Cheers.

name: LUXURY OF THE HORIZON

When you step into the apartment, you are into the very sunny living room, it has wooden floors. This is a very spacious room, it is furnished with a sofa, two armchairs, a coffee table, a dining table and four chairs, a flat screen TV and a closet. There is also one HI-FI Stereo Dolby Surround where you can put your own iPod, and the sound spreads in all the rooms of the apartment through speakers in the ceiling.  On the left of the living room, you have the open kitchen, it is equipped with a stove, an oven, a sink, a refrigerator with freezing compartment, a dishwasher and a microwave. There is cookware available, dining ware and other kitchen utensils. There is also a washer and a dryer.  On the right, the living room

Very close to the F, J,M,Z, 6, and L trains. Basically you have access to Manhattan and most of Brooklyn in just a few minutes.

name: 1 bedroom midtown east, 50th & 2nd
space: One Bedroom apartment in Midtown East. Convenient location with easy access to subways and bus lines around the city. Large Flat screen TV w/ Cable TV & Hi-speed Wireless Internet

name: The Heart of Prime Williamsburg
space: This vibey, spacious and bright apartment is an oasis located right in the middle of the action of prime Northside Williamsburg (even though the listing shows up as Greenpoint), a block and a half away from the Bedford L stop.  Even though it's right on Bedford Avenue (btw N 8th and N 9th) it can feel like a world away from the bustle with an outlook onto a leafy backyard. Amazing restaurants and cafes are minutes away including Hotel Delmano, Cafe Collette, El Beit (incredible coffee), Egg, 5 Leaves, Manhattan Inn, McCarren Park, Farmer's market, Brooklyn Flea, Nitehawk Cinema and other gems of the 'burg and Greenpoint are all a short walk away.  Yoga schools, gyms, and McCarren pool are all also a short walk away. Literally 5 minutes to Manhattan on the subway on the L train (station is two blocks away), although you'll never want to leave the area! name: Parisian apartment in Chelsea
space: A charming 550 square ft. 1 bedroom in the heart of New York's Chelsea community. The apartment is on a historic, tree-lined street, 1 block away from the High-line and 5 blocks away from the Meat-packing district (to the South) and Chelsea art galleries (to the north). People who visit say it looks like a Parisian apartment and the building has old-world charm.  It's a walk-up and I am on the 4th floor.  Amenities: Wifi  air-conditioning Washer/Dryer in basement Newly renovated bathroom  No pets please.

name: Quiet house in a family friendly neighborhood
space: We are renting our 3-bedroom apartment in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn. It consists of three floors in a four story building. Steps from Prospect Park and two blocks from the subway to Manhattan or Coney Island. Wireless internet, large backyard and deck, dishwasher, and washer and dryer. There are 2 full bathrooms and three bedrooms. Please note that one of the bedrooms does not have a door so it is not completely private. This is a very sweet and quiet neighborhood with the park and playground 1/2 block away. There are grocery stores, cafes and restaurants in walking distance. F train stop is two blocks away.

name: Beautiful Duplex w/Private Garden
space: Old world meets new in this stunning 1500 SF, fully renovated in 2011, 2 BR/2 BA Parlour Duplex with Garden in a 1903 townhouse located in the heart of historic Harlem. Meticulously restored original stained glass panels and floor-to-ceiling gigantic mirror coincide with stainless steel fireplace, Bosch kitchen appliances and quartz counter top in this amazing home. Cozy private 500 SF garden with antique travertine pavers and flower bushes completes the picture of ideal vacation property. This amazing apartment is located in a splendidly cool neighborhood. You will immediately feel that unique old New York vibe in an area that is safe, and getting more and more internationally diverse. It is simply loved by the Europeans! Selecting this apartment will allow you to feel New York with all its history. name: Lower East Side 2 Bed Apt.
space: A comfortable, super cozy second story walk up on the lower east side of New York City! Master bedroom plus kids bedroom with two single bunk beds. Perfect for a family with kids, ages up to 13/14 years old. Full, modern kitchen with new appliances. Hard wood floors with colorful rugs. Conveniently located less than a minute's walk from the Essex/Delancey F train stop. On a quiet street in the heart of the lower east side's restaurant and shopping district. Walking distance to the unique Essex Street Market, Whole Foods, and a host of some of New York's best restaurants!

name: Astoria Apt-Private Home NYC

name: Park Slope Apartment
space: A nice and sunny 1 bedroom apartment in a small, charming Park Slope co-op townhouse. The whole apartment is for rent while I am away for work. It is on a residential, quiet avenue and one block away from many great shops, restaurants, bars and cafes. It is three blocks away from Prospect Park, and there is drop off laundry service nearby. The neighborhood is a wonderful slice of Brooklyn. Apartment amenities are air conditioning, ceiling fans, clean appliances, clean bathroom with shower.  There are many options for getting to Manhattan by subway - it is a 10 minute walk to most stations and the train ride is about another 15 to 20 minutes.  The neighborhood is very safe and the building is secure.

name: Charming 2 bdr Apt- East Village,NY
space: This charming apt is located in the heart of East Village. It's an area known for its bars, restaurants, wine, cheese shops and little community gardens for anyone to relax after a long day at work or exploring the city, yet on a side street and peaceful w/out too much noise. This two bdr apt is filled with sunlight, red brick walls in the living room, basic furniture, separate kitchen and a bathroom w/ bathtub&shower. The room is available upon request. I am looking for a commitment of at least a week. Please feel free to contact me anytime with any questions  Via email or (Hidden by Airbnb)   (Email hidden by Airbnb)  Warm Regards, Ewelina

name: Greenpoint Spacious Loft
space: Similar to the contrast between the city skyline seen from our roof and the bird sanctuary outside of our window, we built a loft that captures an NY artists energy and a quiet refuge.  We our so lucky to live here and even more to share our home. Cozy 800 square ft loft with views of city skyline.  Rooftop access and a location 2 blocks from East River ferry or subway giving you almost instant access to New York city whether visiting or admiring from across the river. Would you believe that Brooklyn is quiet?  Maybe not all of our borough is so sweet and serene, but we are lucky enough to wake up to a bird sanctuary in our backyard.  Our FOUR large  windows look out to trees and beyond that, the midtown skyline.  After living street-side in my first two apartments here,  I thought New York really was the city that never sleeps.  Now I know that some of us sleep perfectly well!  You just need to be in our apartment. Great shops and restaurants in our quiet neighborhood give you perfect

name: Private E. Village Townhouse Stay
space: Situated on the second floor of a Civil War era Townhouse with private entry and bath the suite is light filled and serene.   It is perfect for an individual or a couple.  It overlooks a garden and is a quiet oasis in the middle of the city.  There is a fridge. microwave and coffeemaker but my guests don't tend to use any of that. You would be just around the corner from some of the best food in NYC.    The luxurious queen size bed is made of organic materials, the walls are painted with low V.O. C. paints, furnishings are well appointed reclaimed wooden and antique, bedding is natural. EVERYONE IS WELCOME!!!! You will be within walking distance of the Lower East Side, SoHo, NoHo, West Village (Far West Village, Greenwich Village), Bowery, Union Square, Gramercy Park, Chinatown, and Little Italy and Williamsburg. name: Harlem/Hamilton Heights Cozy Room
space: Private sunny room in the heart of Harlem available in large apartment in a building erected in 1933 that now has landmark status. The apartment is located in Sugarhill, an historic area of Harlem on the Upper Westside of NYC. The room is about 100 sq ft with a built-in floor-to-ceiling closet, twin size bed, nightstand, and lounge chair and a lamp. I have 2 additional bedrooms listed on airbnb. I open my space to people like you who are in need of short-term accommodations while in NYC for work, pleasure, or both. If you book one of my rooms, there may be others travelers in my apartment upon your arrival. So If you book one of my rooms, please be trusting and open to the marvelous opportunity to get to know new people. The apt decor is mid-century modern. I am a fashion designer and often work from home in my studio. I have a lovely little cat named Missy. The neighborhood is undergoing gentrification and has an eclectic mix of artists, and professionals of various income levels and

name: SPACIOUS 1 BR LOFT IN EAST VILLAGE
space: Experience New York City from this charming spacious and open 1 bedroom loft apartment, with exposed brick walls and hard wood floors.The bedroom has a framed queen size bed for 2 people. In addition its possible to accommodate 1 more person on a comfortable airmattres bed.  The apartment is located in the heart of trendy East Village, in a conveniently central position to the rest of Manhattan. A short walking distance from great shopping areas like Union Square and Soho. The area itself has plenty of charming and inexpensive restaurants and bars with cuisine from all over the World, and is a popular place for the local hipster Manhattanites.  You can easily walk from this location to other downtown areas in Manhattan, but other great options are taking subway (1st Avenue stop on the L train) located a few blocks from the apartment. Taking a taxis is an aprox. $5-10 ride to most of NYC's famous spots.  Rent Includes: All Utilities, heat, water, electricity Wifi internet  Flatscreen Tv

name: Incredible Prime Williamsburg Loft!
space: This incredible 1200 square ft. loft smack dab in the best part of Williamsburg,  is truly something special. The photos really don't capture how large and open the space is. It's a magical spot and the people who rent it keep coming back!Light floods through the massive windows in this corner apartment at all hours of the day. The loft was once a sweater factory, and although the whole building has been wonderfully restored, it's maintained much of its original charms. While staying here you are just a few blocks to the Bedford L train stop which takes you into manhattan in 5 minutes, or you are a 10 minute cab ride straight over the bridge into the East Village. You are surrounded by some of the best food, coffee, music venues, shopping in all of New York. The flea market, and famous Smorgasburg are just down the block. I'd love to direct you to all my favorite spots! The apartment boasts: -incredible 16 ft. ceilings  -fully stocked and very spacious kitchen for cozy meals in -baby g

name: Room 1, Victorian Home to Enjoy!
space: Come and stay with our family in our 119 year old Victorian home only 35 minutes from downtown NYC. It is a 4 min walk to the B/Q train station. We have 6 bedrooms, 4 queen size beds, 1 full and 1 small room with a single bed.  Please look at my other listings if you are looking for two or more rooms. You will have to book each room separately.   There are two shared bathroom, one on each floor.  All rooms are well decorated and attractive.  The room will have fresh sheets and towels for you.  There is an AC unit in each room.  Enjoy using the front porch, parlor, living room, and kitchen on the main floor. Please come and experience our wonderful and diverse neighborhood. You are close to Prospect Park, Brooklyn Botanical Gardens, Coney Island, Brooklyn Museum and NYC Aquarium to mention a few attractions. That is not even considering all NYC has to offer. We have a lovely family home. Come and have fun and enjoy.  You never know who you will meet at our house. Feel  free to use the g

name: Sunny 1 bedroom apt & private deck
space: A cozy sunny and fully furnished entire one bedroom apt in Clinton Hill Brooklyn with a private deck accessible from the living room. The apt is spotless, has a queen size bed.  Very quiet building. Friendly neighbors. From April till October the private deck with lots of plants and sitting area is very nice to enjoy your breakfast/lunch/dinner under a garden umbrella.    This is our home and we wish for people who stay here to have a pleasant stay during their visit in New York. If there is anything you would like or a question you might have, please do not hesitate to e-mail us.  Thank you for looking and good luck finding the best place  ps: In response to a guest's comment: the queen size bed lies on a wooden frame. For the shower, it has been replaced with a higher pressure shower head.

name: Large  Loft Style  Studio  Space
space: This studio loft is city living at its best, lots of light and sun enters this spacious apartment.  The energy of the city is balanced with charm, character, and the critical comforts of home.  The structural highlights include exposed brick walls, hardwood floors, a beautiful fireplace (not functional), modern appliances, and a comfy built in bed that sleeps two.   AIRPORT PICK UP: For a standard fee door to door airport pickup/drop-off is available from LGA and JFK airports to the apartment. (Please request once you've booked) What to expect and enjoy using: Tastefully furnished space Fully equipped, modern kitchens with appliances (Microwave, Standard Gas Oven, Coffee Maker) Air-conditioning Modern & Clean Bath & Shower  Large Windows (3 in total)  Fireplace - Non Functional  Spacious room - (can accommodate 1 additional guest) Fresh Linens & Towels - (No daily maid service)  Workspace (Wi-Fi | Printer | Computer) Small Flat Screen TV with cable and surround sound Convenient to Mass

name: Hancock Town House!-Stuyvesant Mews
space: Hello, my name is Fred.  This is a 20 year old town house located on a picturesque tree lined street in Stuyvesant Heights, formally known as Bedford Stuyvesant.  A safe and racially diverse neighborhood.  There are markets, local shopping, pharmacy and popular fast food eateries within walking distance. The J train is located at the Halsey Street station - about a 5 minute walk from the house.  The A and C trains are located at the Ralph Avenue station - about a 10 minute walk from the house.  All transportation will get you to Manhattan in under 20 minutes.  Trains, taxi and buses run 24/7.  Relax in a clean room with wood floors, flat screen tv, blue ray dvd player, access to closets and dresser draws accented by modern decor.  Feel free to enjoy the comforts of a garden back yard space.  There will always be someone available to assist and/or answer any (Website hidden by Airbnb)  we can coordinate the time of your arrival ALSO I have a exterminator come monthly.

name: Entire Apt in Heart of Williamsburg
space: Stylish one-bedroom apartment in Williamsburg - perfect for a couple or an individual wanting to stay in NYC's coolest neighborhood.  It is located in the center of the amazing Williamsburg neighborhood, just a few blocks from the Bedford "L" subway station (6 minutes to Union Square in Manhattan), near McCarren Park, the waterfront, and terrific restaurants, galleries, music venues, bars, boutiques, etc. It's a charming, colorful, fully furnished one-bedroom apartment with a kitchen, living room, study, and access to the rooftop with spectacular city views. Wireless internet is included. There is no cable tv. The apartment is on the fifth floor and it's a walk-up (no elevator).  Within one block, there is a lovely wine bar, shops, a grocery store, a bank and 24-hour drugstore/market. Let me know if you're interested and I'll get in touch with you promptly! Please let me know the exact dates you're interested in and a little bit about yourself.  Guests have access to the entire apartme

name: Clinton Hill + Free Coffee = #smile
space: Enjoy the historic Clinton Hill district in this two room clean apartment.   This sofa bed is easy to put away the room is great for anyone needing to convert their room into an office.  Or you can say "screw it" and leave the bed out because you got 5 minutes to catch the next train. Either way this room is great for two, fits three or it could just be for you. The neighborhood is very convenient and residential.  Great places for juices, coffee, beer, wine & sweets. The trains are under a 5 min walk and in under 15 minutes you'll be in Manhattan. How can you not stay here? Û¢ Wi Fi Internet Included Û¢ Cable TV (basic) Û¢ 4 min walk to the Clinton-Wash A & C stop Û¢ 2 blocks from Supermarket Û¢ 1 block from neighborhood laundromat Û¢ 10 min walk to Pratt University Û¢ 15-20 min walk to Prospect & F. Greene Parks Û¢ 15-20 min train to Manhattan

name: Nice, cozy, neat apt Greenpoint,BK
space: Hello, I will be away for the holidays. So I would like to share my cozy, well equipped and perfectly located apt. to either 1 or 2 responsible (couple would be ideal), clean and respectful people.  Im sure you would feel the same if opening your apt as well ;).  I've been living here for 10 years and love the neighborhood and all it has to offer. I also have a great neighbor whom will or can help with any questions or concerns.  Everything is included: Kitchen, internet, air conditioning, bed, bath, TV/DVD player.  Its very close to almost everything, bars restaurants, laundry, shopping... Its perfect for a couple who are looking to be close to Manhattan (only 25 minutes away) The apt, is perfectly located between Long Island City and the hip Williamsburg. There are 2 subways close by (G & L trains). There are tons of cool and hip bars and nice restaurants very close by and McCarren park is just down the block.   Im hoping to find a couple or a single person to come and relax and enjo

name: PRIVATE and SUNNY Williamsburg Apt!
space: **Please note that the mattress have been replaced with brand new orthopedic mattresses :) This is a beautiful 2 Bedroom apartment with a living room and kitchen. Great for singles, couples, or groups of up to 6 (I can provide an air mattress for extra guests). Located in a quiet street just one block away from the L train,15 min from Manhattan, and within walking distance from the heart of Williamsburg and Bushwick - two of the coolest neighborhoods in Brooklyn, filled with amazing restaurants, bars, art galleries, and shopping.  The two bedrooms are air conditioned and located on opposite ends of the apartment, so each enjoys their own quiet and privacy.  The apartment is on the 4th floor, so it's quiet and has lot of privacy from the street, but please be aware there is no elevator in the building. :) The Amenities include: * 100% 2 Bedroom, private apartment all to yourself!  * 1 Block from L Train Subway Line  * Air Conditioning in BOTH bedrooms * High Speed Wireless Internet   *

name: Brooklyn Riad, Easy to the City!
space: Lovingly renovated by us, we've been customizing this home with handmade tiles and reclaimed wood over the last 7 years. We've installed 100 year old salvaged French tiles mixed in with colorful handmade Moroccan tiles that cover half of the apartment. We even added floor drains to give a truly European feel. The apartment has a super cozy, and earthy atmosphere. The apartment was decorated with sweet perks: reclaimed vintage hanging lights, antique Viking stove, exposed brick. Bathroom is spacious and has rain shower head and two double sinks.  Truly a unique space. Must see for yourself. Located on a quiet beautiful block, 1 block from major banks, organic market,  local organic eatery. YMCA Gym,  clean laundromat and Nassau avenue G train stop. Three blocks from McCarren Park It's truly a wonderful apartment. Hearing the birds early in the morning is also a sure plus.

name: Purple Room for 2/3 in brownstone $1450 per month
space: A beautiful large sunny room in a historical four stories brownstone with a fireplace and original wood details from the 1800s. Three large windows let the sunlight in from a quiet tree lined street.      The room is gracefully furnished with a sofa, a coffee table, an antique dresser, a closet, a table/desk. Two beds comfortably sleep three people - a queen size bed and a French bed (in between an extra large twin size and a full size bed).  Private bathroom with a shower only.  Linens and towels are provided by us. Subway, bus stop, laundromat, supermarkets, shops, convenience stores, restaurants, wine bars, and coffee shops are all a block away from the house.  When they are in groups of four or five or of six or seven, guests can also book the Blue and the Red Room, if these are available.  Each room has its private bathroom. Only the Blue Room's bathroom has a tub. The Purple Room and the Red Room each have a shower. There is only one guest kitchen on the upstairs floor. It is ful

Cafes, restaurants, and wine bars all around. Private bathroom in the room (shower only). It sleeps two in large canopy Balinese bed and sits two around large oval desk/table. Plenty of books to read in Italian and English, in a well-furnished library while sitting on a comfortable chair. Refrigerator, toaster, coffee maker, and microwave in the room. name: In the heart of East Village
space: Cozy, clean, secure one bedroom apt in East Village. Queen size bed, tv/cable in bedroom. Eat in kitchen. Fully equipped.  Neighborhood is safe and friendly. Many restaurants, cafes, bars, clubs, and shops to explore.  Close to Soho, Lower East Side, Little Italy. 7 min crosstown to west village. 15 min to Times Sq/theater district. Closest subway line is the  "L" line, one block away. Buses one block away New "citibank" public bike rentals on corner. Apartment has internet connection and wifi. Air conditioning in both living room and bedroom. Overall a wonderful and comfortable space to use as your home base for your stay in NYC.

name: Surfer room 15mins to downtown NYC!
space: Big, quiet room in a four bedroom apartment. Your room: small private balcony/ fire escape, queen-size bed, WiFi, Air Conditioning, 27" Mac Cinema Display (for your laptop), computer desk. The apartment has a kitchen, bathroom, small living room and three other rooms. The apartment is located in a in a quiet street just a few blocks from the subway (L train) and 15min to Union Square (downtown Manhattan) during rush hours! The neighborhood: Williamsburg is the best neighborhood to be in NYC! -- it's one of the coolest, hippest place to be in all New York City and probably the best place to go out at night. Cool bars, great restaurant, interesting stores and all you need close to the house. You will love it! Brooklyn has played a major role in various aspects of American culture including literature, cinema and theater.
