name: Private Spacious Modern Studio
space: This studio is located on the Williamsburg waterfront, in a modern full service luxury building. There is a queen size bed, great for a couple or 2 good friends. Building has 24 hour doorman, game room, common roof deck with grill, lounge chairs and showers (beautiful views of Manhattan), open courtyard, and large gym facing the water. name: Sunny 1-BR, Meatpacking District

name: Greenpoint Loft / Le Chez Andrea
space: Hi there!  Available for short term stay is ONE of three separate small private rooms, each about 90 SF, with full bed mattresses lofted above the floor with some short steps up. There is a roof with some chairs and a good view of the Manhattan skyline. It's very near delis, fun bars, really great restaurants, awesome pizza, a nice cafe, 15 minute walk or 5 minute b24 bus ride to the Graham L subway stop and 15 minute walk to the Nassau G, and 30 minutes total travel time to Union Square. That is a central subway hub. From there you can get to Times Square, Grand Central, Chinatown, and Wall Street area in 5-10 minutes, or the major museums in 15 minutes. It is a 15-20 minute walk to Williamsburg, a very nice Brooklyn area with many great shops, restaurants, bars and a huge music scene. There are free transfers between the buses and trains. Also it's right off the Morgan exit of the BQE/395, which makes it a 10 minute, $20 dollar cab ride from LaGuardia and 20 minute $40 ride from JFK.

name: Nice Manhattan Apt Near Central Park and Subway
space: Great Manhattan apartment only a block from Central Park and just a couple blocks from the Subway station. The apartment is located in a safe quiet neighborhood ideal for families and kids. name: Sunny Luxury East Village Apt w/ Private Roof Deck
space: This listing is for a room in a duplex penthouse apartment with a private roof deck. The room has a queen size bed. The apartment is split on two floors with a spacious open air atrium and skylight. A spiral staircase leads upstairs to the private roof deck. There are two bathrooms, one on each floor. Your bedroom & bathroom are on the lower floor. The bedroom has a south facing window with lots of sunlight (and thick drapes). Downstairs, the living room's wall are covered with graffiti art by famed industrial musician Peter Missing when he stayed here several years ago. Now I'm opening it up to share with others and hope you'll come spend a couple days, weeks or months in my beautiful apartment in the most amazing place in the world: the East Village.  Your bedroom is furnished with a bed that can easily sleep two (the mattress is a luxury mattress and the bedding is 500 thread count), a vintage desk, gorgeous walnut mirror, and other high-end pieces. You have a large closet (by New York City standards) in addition to under-bed drawers. The apartment has hardwood floors and exposed brick throughout, giving it a Downtown New York feel that you won't find at any hotel. name: Elegant 2-BR duplex, Union Square
space: This spacious, elegant 2BR duplex with garden in Gramercy/Union Square is ideally located for NYC visiting and touring. The large master bedroom with king bed and 40" flat-screen TV and ensuite master bath gives onto the garden.    A second smaller bedroom next to the master, with an attached study, has a full-size futon bed, also with a view on the garden. Strong wi-fi network throughout the apartment. You will enjoy the elegant living room with 11-foot ceilings, tasteful furnishings (and a pull out sleeper couch), 42" TV; large formal dining room, and light-filled cook's kitchen and breakfast nook. The caretaker stays in the downstairs front bedroom with a private bath for herself, and has her own private entrance, and does not use the rest of the house except for the hall bathroom (next to her room). Owners will be based a little over an hour upstate (in Hopewell Junction, NY), in a 1759 coach house on 2+ acres on the Appalachian Trail, which is also for rent when we are traveling.

name: Private Bedroom for Rent -Near All!
space: Hey, I'm renting a room in my Harlem, New York apartment, which is near a major shopping center, several subway and bus lines. Did you know that central park is a few short stops away? If you take the subway, which is only two blocks away from my doorstep, then you'll only be 15-20 minutes from Times Square 42nd Street and 34th Street Harald Square. Yes it's Harlem! Let me tell you something, I've been living here for 12 years, and this neighborhood has changed dramatically and I'm so lucky to be living here to this day.  Let me share this great energy that I call Harlem.  I work full time as a professional Dental Hygienist. I live with my partner and one poodle (male) which i love dearly. Pet-friendly is a must! There is an a/c and Wifi.  The full bathroom and full kitchen are common. There is dining area available by the kitchen. An apartment is located in a safe elevator building on the 6th floor. Subway is only 1 short block away.

name: Private Bedroom in 2 Bedroom Share
space: The rental available is for the master bedroom pictured in the photos.  The bedroom you will rent  faces the church behind the building which is very quiet.  We are a 10 minute walk to Central Park and all the museums.  Wonderful gourmet food shops, and anything you could need one block from the apartment. Very busy but peaceful neighborhood.  Cross town bus stops directly in front of our building.  Subway #6 train is only 6 blocks away.  Beautifully furnished room (10 x15)  available w King size bed for two people in a two bedroom/two bath elegant doorman elevator building on the Upper East Side. The entire building was renovated in the last year.     Laundry and bike rooms in basement. name: New Yorker (near 96th subway)
space: Welcome to NY : ) A studio on the Upper East Side, 96th st and Lexington, 20 meters from subway, 3 blocks from Central Park! Not huge but just the perfect size (only 2 people are allowed). It has a private entrance, and kitchen and washroom, and is furnished with a queen bed, T.V. wifi, coffee table, closet. Bathroom is located in the apt. The apartment is on the 2nd floor, and it is in the back of the building, so it is very quiet.  Pets-case by case. No smoking inside. included Wi-Fi and TV, and AC.  Kitchen includes:  microwave, full sized refrigerator, stove, dishwasher    CONTACT: Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns. Welcome to NY! Alon

name: Cheerful, comfortable room
space: Bedroom in Manhattan's Washington Heights, 2 doors from subway. Very near the Cloisters ,Harlem and other upper Manhattan historic sights. Attractive, clean and safe. Besides what is listed below, the room comes  with closet and a well stocked book case. Linens,blankets and bath towels provided. 3 subway stops from Columbia university, walking distance of Columbia medical school.A short bus ride will get you to the Cloisters. My neighborhood now ranks higher  than Soho and the Village for safety. There are 3 churches and a high school on my block. It is an area that has a combination of having deep traditions as well going through exciting changes.  I am a life coach who works from home and lives with 2 feline companions. I am equal parts homebody and world traveler. In the last year I have visited Bali and Costa Rica. I am looking to provide short term stays and a comfortable place for you to rest after your adventures in the Big Apple.

name: Hospitality on Propsect Pk - Hosting for 10 Years.
space: I live in a historic district a block from Prospect Park. The apartment is a large, 3 bedroom with most anything you may need during your trip. Each room is large and has a desk. I have a cat even though I am allergic, but no one has ever had a reaction to her. I keep the place super clean using natural oils and steam.  My motto is No one's actions should impede the enjoyment of another! There are little notes around to help guests. I enjoy being hospitable & welcome those that truly want the home vibe.  Those that know the difference between a host and hotel concierge are a def plus! I love my residential hood with plenty of island flavor and historic homes and sights nearby! I rent two rooms and take every precaution to assure each guest has a wonderful stay. I'd describe myself as an emotionally intelligent and sarcastic I've mostly hosted Europeans - its an opportunity to learn about other cultures or reminisce about my times traveling Europe.  No guest has ever felt unsafe coming

name: Prospect Pk, 4 train lines, 5 stops to NYC & Clean
space: Great new restaurants and bars in the hood or more options two stops on train in either direction. There are plenty of food options near  - Chinese, Indian, Italian downstairs, and grocery store, liquor store and laundry are all across the street! The flat is on the 4th floor of a walkup. Its a large, 3 bedroom, with shared a shared bathroom. I live in the unit and rent out the other two rooms.  Iron, blow dryer, power adapter and just about most things you may need. I am mature, fun and easy going but also very responsible - I actually host because I like to take care of people and this is a way for me to extend a bit of hospitality.  I have always subleased to Europeans so I am very comfortable with foreigners and see it as an opportunity to study other languages. There has never been a problem for anyone coming home on the train late at night and a taxi from midtown will run you about 25 dollars.

name: Sunny, Large, Park Slope Bedroom
space: Imagine a quiet bedroom in a spacious apartment, with beautiful sunlight, just steps from the terrific restaurants and shops of this wonderful neighborhood.  Near many subway stops (1/2 block from the R train), easy to get to Manhattan; four blocks from Prospect Park; near to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden and Brooklyn Museum.  You'll have the best of both worlds: you'll be in a fun, hip, laid-back neighborhood, but close to the sights and action of Manhattan! The apartment is a duplex with two large bedrooms, two full baths, fully stocked kitchen, dw, wi-fi.  You would be sharing the place with me (and my cat) - I'm in the upstairs bedroom and have my own bathroom, you have the downstairs bedroom (double bed; there is a queen-size raised aerobed if you prefer) and bathroom, and we share the open living/kitchen/dining area.   I'd greatly appreciate it if you would make an inquiry so we can e-chat for a bit before sending an offer.  Thanks!

name: Huge Bklyn Loft w Private Roofdeck
space: Discover why Park Slope was called New York's best neighborhood. Located right on the corner of 5th avenue and Union Street, you'll feel like your living in a small town while still being 12 minutes away from Manhattan, Chinatown, Wall Street, World Trade Center memorial, and 20 minutes to Times Square by subway.  So many outstanding restaurants right outside the door.  Theres tons of unique boutiques and Prospect Park has events planned all summer long and all are in walking distance from our loft Our clean, 1300+ square foot loft with sectional couch, 47" plasma TV, free internet, A/C, queen size bed, full bathroom and HUGE full equipped modern kitchen is an oasis from the busy city life.  Best of all, lounge upstairs on the private roof deck that overlooks Manhattan.   Want to venture into Manhattan?  The neighborhood is well served by the New York City Subway. Several lines have stops in Park Slope. F & G Trains run along 9th Street, a main shopping street, stopping at Fourth Avenu

name: Large room in elevator drman bldg
space: Large furnished room (11 x 13) in large beautiful prewar apartment in wonderful Hamilton Heights, Harlem neighborhood Room has large closet, bed, desk, dresser, air conditioning. Large kitchen, living room, large bathroom Well lit- room has large window 24 Hr Doorman Elevator - apartment is on 6th floor Laundry in sister building next door or laundromat 1 block away Comfortable, quiet - room is to the back.  Short walk to #1 train at 145th. 20 minutes to midtown and Times Square. Safe, lively neighborhood. Easy access by subway (#1, A, C, D trains in walking distance) to most New York City sights: Times Square, Theater District, Greenwich Village, Soho. 3 stops away from Columbia University at 116th, and Columbia University Medical Center at 168th. Beautiful Riverside Drive w/ a view of the Hudson River just a block away. Fabulous Fairway Supermarket a few blocks away.

name: Manhattan Large R by Columbia Uni and CENTR. PARK
space: I would love to host you during your upcoming New York stay!!! I have a lovely, peaceful rooms available in the Manhattan neighborhood of located just north of Central Park 3 blocks away. My building is located on west 116 street and corner of Lenox Ave. You will find yourself in the middle of a very vibrant restaurant/lounge/bar/boutique scene.   Our location has wonderful subway and bus access. Almost every subway line is within a 1/2 to 4 blocks walk.  2 or 3 express train is half block from my building. Times Square is a quick 10 minute subway ride. Columbia is a short 10 minute walk away through the beautiful Morningside Park. If you don't feel like walking, there are several buses that will take you to Columbia or a cab will cost $5. The room is fully furnished. I will provide you with sheets and towels. Cleaning fees $25 in every other 2 weeks for long term stay( more then 1 week stay). Take a look at my posting and if you have any questions about the room, the city, please don'

name: Comfy, Cozy, Brooklyn close to Manhattan
space: Established in September 2011. Thanks for looking at our space! You will find a private, cozy, clean and neat, two bedroom apartment  in a five bedroom brownstone. The two bedrooms are on the top floor in a vibrant, eclectic neighborhood on the Clinton Hill/ Bedford Stuyvesant border.  Obtaining keys is not an issue as I live here and there is a lock box for late arrivals. No pets, no smokers, no noise please. Please do not wear outside shoes indoors. This is a quiet family building- please be mindful of not running up and down the stairs late nights and early mornings. We are all mature and respectful of each other's space and tranquility.   A five minute walk  to the A/C/G/S trains, restaurants and shopping. We are just 15 minutes from Manhattan and 5 min. from Brooklyn Academy of Music, Botanic Gardens, Brooklyn Museum of Art, Barclay Stadium and Metrotech. space: Come have a wonderful get away in NY, in a beautiful, cozy apartment, with wonderful light even on the darkest of winter days! Fluffy Quilts, and Duvets, Loads of Pillows, you may never get out of bed! Especially since you can order room service from our cafe down stairs! Apartment is on top floor (3rd, 2 flights of stairs), Ground floor is wonderful little wine bar, with beautiful garden, serves a great brunch! name: Manhattan modern apartment with huge terrace
space: Brand new building with elevator. Safe, secure apt with key card access. Each floor is locked meaning outside people without key card or even tenants from other floors can not have access to the floor. 24 hour security camera inside and outside of the building. Its a residential building with fully occupied by mostly professionals and families.  Spotless clean building with super and you can even order packages to be delivered to you during your stay. Charming Cafe, restaurants right downstairs. Supermarket is within the building. 24hour 7Eleven across the street. 24 hour flower shop right downstairs outside the building. 3 blocks to Central Park. 2 mins walk to the park. 2 blocks to the famous "Museum Mile" with world class museums.  Spacious rooms and great sunlight in all rooms. Open kitchen with dishes, pots/pans for home cooking. name: Quiet Studio - Prime UWS Location
space: Prime area of Central Park just steps away!  World famous gourmet food markets and high end shopping around the corner. Yet, it is in the heart of Manhattan's Upper West Side, five blocks to Lincoln Center, 11 blocks to The American Museum of Natural History.  It is within easy walking distance to Central Park, Riverside Park, Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle and so much more. Major subway hub two blocks away! You'll be at Macys in ten minutes on the train! name: Sunny Space in Williamsburg
space: The guest room has a full size bed, ac, wifi, tv (local channels only) with dvd player (netflix - you can order movies beforehand!) and a radio alarm watch with ipod console.  For families - there is enough room to set up a bed for children.  There are two more bedrooms in the apartment occupied by me and my roommate. (shared bathroom) And two cats.  I will provide you with the ingredients for breakfast (can adapt to your taste). I will not make breakfast as I might be at work when you get up.  You can use the kitchen and living room at any time for other things than breakfast.  The building has an accessible rooftop with great 360 degree views. Great sunsets behind the Manhattan skyline! You can use my small bbq if you like. There are tables and chairs on the roof.  There is a laundry in the building and a larger 24 hour laundry one block away.  The building also has a gym in the basement. (separate business)  The area is three subway stops (L train) away from Manhattan, located betwe

name: 1b EHarlem Condo
space: one bedroom condo in the heart of east harlem...aka Spanish Harlem and often referred to as el barrio.  The condo is in a very chic yet exclusive newly built building. Located on a safe beautifully kept street also with roof deck access. The neighborhood boundaries are Harlem River to the north, the East River to the east, East 96th Street to the south, and 5th Avenue to the west. East 116th Street from 5th Avenue east to its termination at the FDR Drive is the most notable business hub of East Harlem along with a minor business hub along Third Avenue between E 103rd Street and E 110th       Streets. The area is filled with an overwhelming amount of culture, arts, and history. It truly embodies the melting pot NYC identifies as.  The condo is 2 blocks over from the newly constructed shopping mall. There you can find stores like Target, pet's mart, costco, marshals, bestbuy...and many more.   Look forward to your stay! You will never want to leave!

name: Family-friendly, ideal location
space: A full floor in a family friendly neighborhood.  Large bedroom with king size bed, living room has a "queen-plus" sleeper sofa. French doors open into a kids room with bunk beds.  There is also a small study/play room.  Large, stocked kitchen.    Bathroom with shower and tub.  Internet and streaming TV via ROKU, plus air conditioners and ceiling fans in each room.  On street, very safe parking is available.  The neighborhood just doesn't get better.  Great restaurants, shopping, close to trains, and 15 minutes from Manhattan.   We love the apartment and neighborhood and can provide tips and suggestions for your stay.  Looking for a family, or couple, 5 max.

name: Modern apartment / Perfect Location

name: Best Manhattan Studio Deal!

name: STYLISH EAST VILLAGE FLAT

Book-lined bedroom (20 feet x15 feet) with huge desk, dresser, queen sized CB2 metal bed, large closet, and two southerly facing windows. name: Sunny Bushwick Loft
space: A sunny clean 800 sq ft loft in Bushwick with 14ft high ceilings and a sunny southern exposure. Two massive windows bring in lots of light. The queen size bed sits on a 5ft tall loft and is super comfortable. The "havana sleeper sofa"is possibly even more comfortable than the bed.  There is an AC, fan, and heat . The shower pressure is strong. The kitchen has all the right stuff. Its got a great homey feeling. There is fast internet and wifi. I like my place clean and make sure its spotless for guests.  I know and love all my neighbors in the building - they are good friends, good neighbors, and are good help in a jam. The loft is on the top floor with roof access and sunset views of Manhattan.

name: Serene Park Slope Garden Apartment
space: Our one bedroom "floor through" garden apartment is on a tree-lined street in the heart of Park Slope.  With white walls, hard wood floors, marble mantels, tin ceilings and simple contemporary furniture, it will appeal to your modern aesthetic. The living room opens onto a peaceful garden with a bluestone and brick patio for outdoor dining (and can sleep one adult (two, in a pinch) on the sofa-bed).  The large bedroom has a queen-sized bed with white Egyptian cotton sheets and lovely original details.  Amenities include a Bosch dishwasher and a microwave oven in a fully-equipped kitchen, along with wi-fi and cable TV.  If you're traveling with a baby, we can provide a "Pack'n Play" infant bed.   This apartment is in our family's brownstone, and we will be here to assist you during your stay. You will have private access to the apartment through your own separate entrance.

name: Cozy and spacious - rare for NYC!
space: *** FEATURED AS ONE OF THE TOP 25 BROOKLYN APARTMENTS ON AIRBNB'S "Best of Brooklyn" LIST! *** There's a waiting list of friends who want our apartment if we ever move out - but why would we? It's got: Û¢ Charm to spare: hardwood floors, vaulted ceilings, original moldings and fireplaces and that greatest Big Apple rarity - SPACE! There's a big living/dining room, bright kitchen, and beautiful bathroom. Plus, one of us a professional performer so there's even a mirrored studio for yoga! (It can also be used to host additional members of your party on a case by case basis - we've got an air mattress.) Every detail in the place has been lovingly considered. It feels open and fresh in the warm months and homey and inviting in the cold ones, providing a tranquil contrast to the lively streets below. name: Beautiful UES apartment
space: Large, beautiful 1 bedroom apartment that has never disappointed. My large, comfortable one bedroom apt is in a 24 hour doorman, elevator building with incredibly friendly and helpful staff.  In addition to laundry in the building, there are also all the other amenities including WiFi, cable, flat screen TV and a renovated kitchen and beautiful hardwood floors. Charming bathroom with great water pressure.  Large, amazingly comfortable bed.  Full of light, with windows in every room, including the kitchen and the bathroom.  Plenty of storage space. The apartment sleeps 4 because there is a queen sized bed in the bedroom and a pull out couch in the living room.  It is also decorated with beautiful furnishings and artwork from around the world, giving the apartment a unique and exotic feel. Other guests have been extremely happy with their stay!

Your choice of restaurants and services are nearby on DeKalb Avenue and Fulton Street. Fort Greene Park and BAM (the Brooklyn Academy of Music) are a leisurely 15 min walk away. name: Ideal Brooklyn Brownstone Apartment
space: Welcome to Brooklyn! Modern, fully furnished  brownstone apartment in Stuyvesant Heights, Brooklyn  hidden  "jewel."  This ideal location accommodates 3 guests comfortably and offers convenient travel to Manhattan, Park Slope, Brooklyn Heights, Williamsburg or any other part of New York City via car, subway or bus. The apartment is walking distance (3 blocks) to the subway (A,C lines) supermarket, fresh fruit vegetable markets and several Zagat rated restaurants and lounges.   If driving, there is plenty of street parking available. Guests will find all of the comforts and amenities of home, including hardwood floors, towels/linen, a full kitchen, office space, wifi, cable TV, A/C and a comfortable queen sized bed.  The apartment also includes a full sleeper sofa. It's the ideal spot to call home while vacationing, on business or just exploring and passing through.  Any questions?  Feel free to email me. Thank you for your consideration. Chris and Zora

( Danielle will be happy to make you one!) Modern and fresh. Creams and pale blues start the day in the city that never sleeps. name: Private Entrance - Private Parking
space: Private 1 bedroom (queen size bed) apartment - a/c, private entrance, washer and dryer, paved backyard - free secure parking in backyard if needed and a comfortable pull out couch in the living room.  Free WIFI. Pets are allowed. No smoking. Inflatable twin bed available. The apartment is close to local restaurants that are great. The trendy part of Williamsburg is a walkable distance (so you can visit without staying in it) and going to the city is super easy with a short walk to the subway. If you like to cook while you're on vacation there are several supermarkets, seasonal farmers markets and Brooklyn Kitchen (look it up!) all close by and the huge kitchen is asking to be used. The apartment is bigger than regular NY apartments and has everything you need.

name: Cozy Budget Oasis 5 Minutes To Manhattan!
space: You'll be in the private bedroom all to yourself. You *WILL NOT* be sharing with anyone else. There's two double beds that fit 2 people each and a single bed for one person if needed.  I understand how important to feel as if you have a clean, safe and comfortable "home" away from home. I'm also an very experienced host of 8 years hosting over 500+ guests with 350+ positive reviews from happy guests. Something I'm proud of because I take my guest's holiday very seriously. I know exactly how to make you feel welcome and right at home and ensure that you have an amazing New York experience!  My home is located right by the famous Yankee Stadium, you can even hear the crowd roar with the windows open! **It's a 5 minute walk to the subway!** There's a truly cozy and zen-like warm vibe inside. The neighborhood is safe, colorful and family oriented with great energy. Everything you need is within a 5 minute walk (see map below) including the subway, restaurants, stores, banks etc. It's conve

name: Sunny, Spacious Studio in Ft.Greene
space: Enjoy the privacy and ideal location of this warm and sunny studio in Ft. Greene, Brooklyn. Access to C and G trains within 1 block, and a 5 minute walk from the 2/3, 4/5, N/R, B/D and Q trains. 15 minutes and you are in Manhattan. Ft. Greene park is 1 block away as is DeKalb avenue filled with wonderful bars and restaurants.  Apartment is furnished with a full sized bed and a sleeper sofa with a queen sized mattress. Other amenities include full kitchen with dishwasher and laundry in the building.

name: Williamsburg Exposed Brick Loft
space: This is a beautiful loft with exposed brick walls on the Southside of Williamsburg, Brooklyn.  Blocks away from the best restaurants and bars and conveniently located near both the JM and L subway lines, the East River Ferry, and the Williamsburg Bridge.  Manhattan is just 1 stop away on both lines or you can easily walk across the bridge for a nice, leisurely stroll with a great view. This is a 4th floor, elevator apartment with a warm, cozy feel with Modern and mid-century furniture.  It has a great view of Manhattan, the Williamsburg Bridge, and the East River. The bedroom area is outfitted with a queen-sized new tempur-pedic mattress.  It gets a lot of natural light and view of the river.   The loft also features a brand new bathroom with a curbless walk-in shower.  All fixtures are brand new, including a rain shower head, Kohler thermostat and volume control, recessed medicine cabinet and a floating vanity.     The open kitchen is fully equipped with an electric kettle, blender, a

name: Bright Modern Charming Housebarge
space: Fully insulated and heated for winter! A/C for summer. Unique houseboat with all the ammenities... Wireless internet/TV with large screen TV in bedroom.  Safe environment. There are lots of neighbors and the owner also stays on the dock in another houseboat.  There is one full size bed in main cabin for guests who are comfortable bunking together. The furnishing of the front cabin is setup to suit the average guest mixture. In summer its a family with 2 small children, or, two adults who want more bed space each, or, two couples. To accommodate this mix we furnish with a four seater breakfast nook that folds down to a "Standard" width bed plus a round table that has seating for 4. For long staying single guests or a couple who on occasion my have a sleep over guest, we furnish with a small square table and 2 chairs and a futon type bunk (As shown in the photos) This is a great neighborhood to relax in after the hubbub of the city! Its relatively quiet (compared to other neighborhoods)

name: Big Quiet Mod 1BR with Green Views
space: This is a large one bedroom apartment which takes up the entire second floor of our private house.  The apartment has a private entrance, a full bathroom, eat-in kitchen, living room, and big bedroom with a king size bed.  One of the couches in the living room can be converted into a full size bed to accommodate another adult couple or kids.  The apartment is sunny and quiet with leafy great views out the front and back windows, along with two skylights and chirping birds. There is internet access and a TV with basic service.

name: Central Bedford Avenue Apartment
space: This fully furnished 1-bedroom railroad apartment is located in the heart of Williamsburg, Brooklyn, just one subway stop away from Manhattan.  You'll be renting the entire apartment, located on the first floor of a walk up. The apartment is perfect for a single traveler or a couple. It features one bedroom with a Queen size bed. The kitchen is equipped with a full size refrigerator, a gas stove, coffee maker and all cookware/dishware you'll need for entertaining. Towels, linens and internet access are included.  Located on Bedford Avenue in Williamsburg, and right across the street from McCarren Park. The neighborhood is safe and lively, steps away from some of Brooklyn's best restaurants, bars, art galleries and trendy shops.  By public transportation, Manhattan is only 1 subway stop away from the nearby Bedford Avenue L line.  Please message us with any questions!

name: Metro to Midtown, Manhattan Views
space: (This listing receives one guest at the time, preferably female. Unlike hotels, home renting requires you to have a picture profile to introduce yourself. And so, to put me at ease. Thanks for your kindness and understanding.) Located in Sunnyside- Queens, lovely and very safe neighborhood, close to Manhattan (3 stops to Bloomingdale's shopping area and 4 stops to Central Park- 5th Avenue, Apple Store), 20' from the Grand Central Station and also direct line to Times Square (30') and The High Line, Megabus, Jacob-Javits Conventions Center at the stop Hudson Yards. Also airports or port, by metro, train and buses. If driving, scarce but safe street parking. Elevator, 4th floor, sunsets and city skyline. Downstairs is a 30 years old bakery where you can find coffee, danish or strudel starting with 6 am or a pizzeria until 1 am in the night, while in the vicinity, lots of ethnic restaurants/take-outs, all fresh and affordable, including food markets and CVS pharmacy open 24/7. Public tran

name: Sunny Bedroom in Charming Harlem Pre-war
space: This is a small quiet private room with a single bed. There is shelving and also a desk and storage under the bed. Kitchen and bath are shared with me. This is my home. it's filled with interesting objects I have collected. My 22 year old daughter is also here, as well as our cat.  The apartment is in the back of the building so there is little street noise. Its the top ( 6th) floor of an older pre-war building and get's lots of light and a tiny view of the empire state building.

name: Greenpoint Waterfront Loft
space: *NOTE RE: PASSAGE OF NY RESTRICTIONS -- THIS IS A FULLY LEGAL LISTING IN AN OWNER-OCCUPIED ROWHOUSE.  Please note, I don't accept reservations more than 3 months in advance... The Loft is a lovely & light-filled apartment in a waterfront rowhouse in Brooklyn's booming Greenpoint Historic District, on the riverfront just north of bustling Williamsburg. Walk to the Bedford "L" subway stop, or just a few blocks to the Greenpoint "G" stop. East River Ferry service (with multiple stops in Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens) is 2 blocks from the house, on the India Street waterfront. Plenty of restaurants, bars, boutiques, cafes, galleries, banks, gyms, etc all within blocks. 800 completely open interior square feet; kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom nook and private on-floor bathroom. The apartment is located on the 2nd floor of a building which houses an antiques store on the first floor (which has a lovely garden, of which you have a view down below while gazing out at the stellar M

name: East Village House -- Unique!
space: One of the coolest spots in Manhattan, this is a bizarrely quiet and serene little cottage in the middle of the East Village of NYC.  It's 2 blocks from Tompkins square, but this house is for cat lovers only!  That's because 4 cute cats live here that you need to feed twice daily (these are otherwise independent cats that spend most of their time outdoors!).  Other than this requirement, this is one unique place that is close to everything cool that is New York.  It's funky, so if you're used to 5 star hotels, beware.  But if you'd rather be in a quiet and charming 2 story cottage with a toasty fireplace and a large front yard to enjoy your morning coffee or bbq, then you've come to the right spot.  There's 1 full sized bed upstairs and 1 daybed (slightly wider couch) downstairs.  There's no tv, but you're not coming for that anyway.  Wifi and great sound abound, this is a writer's paradise.  please message me for more info.. Note:  there is no air conditioning as this is against my pr

name: 2-bed share in heart of W. Village!
space: This apartment is a well-appointed and warm home, located in one of the most desirable streets in the popular West Village.  1,100 square feet / 336 square meters, PLUS 200 square feet / 60 square meter private terrace with BBQ and roof deck with views of the Empire State Building.  2 bedrooms, laundry (in the apartment!) well-stocked kitchen with brand new appliances, large bathroom, large dining/living area, elevator, doorman.  This is a share with a woman who is well-traveled, kind and a dear friend (Susan) and 2  friendly cats. The apartment is truly a wonderful home and would suit a female non-smoker who is tidy and respectful. Includes everything and yes, is below market!

name: 1 Bedroom Pre War apt
space: Decorated one bedroom apartment located in the heart of New York City's Time Square ( Hells Kitchen) area! Full Kitchen and bath. Living/Dining area with lots of light. Steps away from all the Broadway shows! Full access of all the subway lines within two blocks of the apartment. Full Internet access included.

name: Charming Abode In The Heart of NYC
space: One bedroom studio in Murray Hill.  Large(r than most) kitchen and bathroom.  Full queen size bed plus twin size futon.  Fresh, clean linens and towels are provided. Located minutes away from Grand Central Station by foot (12 minutes) and the 33rd Stop on the 6 Line at Park and 33rd (less than 10 minutes).  Since it's located on 36th street just down the entrance of the Midtown Tunnel, it can be a little noisy, but I am used to it and a small price to pay for being in the heart of the city. The neighborhood is incredibly safe.  Murray Hill caters to the young urban professionals who work mostly in finance and law.  So the area is lively and young at night, even though plenty of families share the neighborhood. Plenty of shopping and other conveniences, and near all the sites (15 minute walk to Empire State Building), bars, and fine dining that Manhattan has to offer.   Internet is available.  Email me for specifics.  Fireplace doesn't work.

name: Quiet One Bedroom in Park Slope
space: Quiet One bedroom in Park Slope / Carrol Gardens. Large bedroom and living room.  Two bathrooms.  Family friendly building. Perfect for a couple or friends. Train Access on the corner.  Bagels, Pizza, Laundry Supermarket all one block away as well as easy walking to two of the nicest neighborhoods in brooklyn - Park Slope and Carrol Gardens.  These neighborhoods are full of great restaurants, cafes, and bars. Very close to the beautiful Prospect Park, Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn Museum of Art and the Botanical Gardens.  There is some greta BBQ right on the block and a Whole Foods just opened a few blocks away. The apartment has easy access to Manhattan. There are several Subway options all in walking distance:  R,F,N,Q,D,B are all nearby. [The R train is right on the corner.]  The D and N trains are only 1 stop from downtown Manhattan. There is a Holiday inn that is directly across the street from the apartment that goes for upwards of $200 a night.  I think this apartment is a way

name: RARE Penthouse Oasis featured on DesignSponge
space: One bedroom available in three bedroom penthouse with private roof deck, terrace and kitchen balcony.  There is a garden terrace off the living room with dining table to enjoy your breakfast or dinner al fresco. Relax on the private rooftop complete with lounges. Then fire up the grill for a delicious BBQ whilst you take in the nearly 360 degree views of the Manhattan skyline.  See all three bridges (Williamsburg, Manhattan, Brooklyn) to the east. The Freedom tower/World Trade Center to the south and the Empire State, the western hemisphere's tallest residential building and the Chrysler building to the North. Prime LES location on quiet block surrounded by cool galleries, and some of the city's hottest cafes and restaurants. Close to public transport, citibike and an easy walk to Soho. You will have you own private entrance and bathroom with shower/tub. Candles and bath products available should you want to take a relaxing bath. The private bedroom features a large double-wide closet

name: GREAT LOCATION- 2BR- KINDA NOISY!
space: Hello!  We live in a great location downtown. It is where Chinatown meets Little Italy, four blocks from Soho, Tribeca, and walking distance to the Financial District, Nolita, the East Village etc.  We are right next to the subway - the 6 train, the N, R, Q, W and the J, M, Z.  Or you can walk about 10 minutes to the A, C, E or 1.  We usually walk or bike most places.   We live above a (delicious) restaurant and so it can be a little noisy.  We don't have any issues and don't use ear plugs to sleep, but some people might! The apartment has a fully equipped kitchen, large living room and two small bedrooms (one with double bed, the second is for children only with a set of bunk beds). The living room has a fold-out couch that sleeps two more adults. We also have a pack n'play if you have a baby.   The apartment gets great light- southern facing.  It is not a fancy doorman building- just a one floor walk-up in an old Chinatown building (no intercom). There is some normal city-living stre

name: Sunny bright 2 bedroom apt
space: Cute private bedroom available in a nice two bedroom apartment in Spanish Harlem.  The apartment is sunny, clean, and well ventilated with windows in every room. Your room is looking North, facing the street. Across is a cute community garden with a park, basketball hoops and a children's playground.  We are conveniently located half a block from the number 6 subway at 103rd and Lexington and two blocks from Central Park. Museum Mile, also know as Fifth Avenue, is also two blocks away with access to dozens of world class art and cultural institutions. We are also just a few blocks from the Upper East Side--a neighborhood known for fashion, shopping, and fine cuisine. In addition, Spanish Harlem is filed with its own list of delicious and affordable restaurants. We live in an up-and-coming neighborhood enriched with a fascinating political and cultural history! You would share the common spaces with me: a large and well equipped kitchen which you are more than welcome to use, a central

name: Large, open space, nature, artistic
space: Prewar building with high ceilings, large bedroom/living area for guest. Guest room next to bath. Family oriented building. Quiet, safe. It is important to be mindful and respectful of the space and the neighbors in the building.

Our charming rooms are located on the fourth floor of our 19th century Victorian home with all its original detail. (If you wish to book the two rooms at once, please find "Charming Rooms in Victorian Home" on Airbnb.) The Room: Each room has a full-sized bed, dresser, bedside tables, large closet, original detail, and abundant light.  Fresh towels and bed linens will welcome you. The bath and kitchenette (microwave oven, refrigerator, coffeemaker, and dishware), located on the same floor, are shared with guests from the other room.  Transportation: A quick subway ride will put you in downtown or midtown Manhattan in fifteen-to-thirty minutes.  We are

name: Modern Unique Studio in NYC
space: Welcome to this modern, high-design, studio apartment in Astoria, New York City. It is conveniently located just a short 3 minute walk to the train station. From there, it takes only 10 minutes to reach Manhattan. This beautiful studio has high ceilings, hard wood floors, exposed brick wall, and three very large windows in the living room and kitchen. The space receives plenty of sunlight. The studio is designed with high quality, ultra modern, and mid-century modern furniture and fixtures. There is a large tweed sofa that flattens into a long twin bed (80'' x 40''). The sofa sits on a custom built platform, which houses the therapeutic queen size Tempur-Pedic mattress. The door to the platform opens and closes easily and the bed rolls smoothly in and out of the platform. There is a large flat-screen television with cable tv, which sits on a Mid-Century Modern Danish walnut dresser. The dining area has a walnut table with modern dining chairs. name: Zen Home near Cafe Habana & Gitane
space: The apartment is a zen space, quiet, sunny and simple, located is in a beautiful historic tenement building built in the year 1900.  It is fully renovated, clean and has red floors!  Included: 1 full bed 1 couch / full day bed built in kitchen linens towels hairdryer  A/C and good heat stove and oven small fridge WIFI internet connection (for your laptop)  and lots of sun and open space.  During renovation I decided to keep the original (extremely comfortable) bathtub in the kitchen, so you will be living like the original immigrants lived, taking relaxing baths or use the shower head attached to the bath tub faucet for a quick rinse.  About the neighborhood... Elizabeth Street is in the NoLita (North of Little Italy) area, and has plenty of unique shopping, restaurants nice bars. My favorite restaurants include Cafe Gitane (hangout for models, artists, and great food and excellent coffee), and Cafe Habana feet away from our front door.  The original St. Patricks Church is right across

name: Perfect for Yout Parents (Part 2)
space: Are your parents coming to town? They'll love this space -- high-end Victorian townhouse (no New York chippy paint here). Very spacious and clean. You will be on the top floor of a brownstone -- and have the entire floor. Note that that is two flights up. Tree-lined street and around the corner from park; huge guest room; private bath with tub and shower; laundry room/sitting room. Bright and sunny. Very private, though shared entrance downstairs. Wireless Internet. No phone or TV or kitchen (although you have access to one in building).  Air-conditioning.  See "Perfect for Parents, Part 1" for other space available in building, if you need more space (special rate if renting both).

name: Cozy Room in the East Village
space: PRIVATE, FURNISHED BEDROOM IN A 3 BEDROOM APARTMENT, WITH SINGLE LOFT BED, CLOSET, WIFI, AND AIR CONDITIONER. IN A BEAUTIFUL AREA IN THE EAST VILLAGE,  CLOSE TO GARDENS AND PARKS. NEAR A SUPERMARKET, BANKS, SHOPS AND RESTAURANTS. SHEETS AND TOWELS PROVIDED.

name: 1-BR Apt in the Lower East Side!
space: A queen size bed that comfortably sleeps two people in an a apartment in the Lower East Side and a 7 minute walk to the F/J/M/Z subway lines.  The area offers great, affordable bars, restaurants, coffee shops, etc.  Some of the best brunch spots and speakeasies in the City are within 5-10 minutes of the apartment.

name: Your Haven in the Upper West Side
space: Near Columbia University, Morningside Heights and in the heart of the 'new' Harlem, you will have a chance to live in a neighborhood that is experiencing a renaissance.  The cozy bed room has two north-facing, large windows and includes your own closet and air conditioner.  Shared free WiFi, comfy kitchen and clean bathroom, the apartment is great to base yourself as you explore Central Park, Harlem, nearby Museum Mile or to the West Side. It is just 10 minutes to 59th Street Columbus Circle.

name: Wonderful Studio In Brooklyn, NY!!!
space: This is a great walk-in studio apartment in the hear of Boro Park, Brooklyn, only 20 minutes from Canal Street, in Manhattan, by train. The N train is across the street and the D train is 3 blocks away. Perfect location for a visiting guest on a budget!  There are two large closets, a kitchen with a full size fridge, stove and sink. The bathroom is very nice and spacious with a standing shower. This is a pristinely clean and well maintained apartment! Please let me know if you have any questions. THIS IS A STRICTLY NON SMOKING APT!

name: A Cozy Brooklyn Hideaway
space: Enjoy the historic Clinton Hill district in this two room clean apartment. During your stay you will have the entire place to yourself, a king size room and a deluxe crash pad. There's also a nice sound system for you to enjoy!  KING SIZE comes equipped with a king size bed that can fit a family or 2 people very comfortably. Also included in the room is a nice sound system. Enjoy your tunes during your stay.  DELUXE CRASH PAD has a sofa bed that's a piece of cake to put away. The room is great for anyone needing to convert their room into an office. Or you can say "screw it" and leave the bed out because you got 5 minutes to catch the next train. Either way this room is great for two, fits three or it could just be for you. The neighborhood is very convenient and residential. Great places for juices, coffee, beer, wine & sweets. The trains are under a 5 min walk and in under 15 minutes you'll be in Manhattan. space: Lovely 1 room (furnished) rental in a fabulous brownstone apt located in trendy Harlem! The apt is 5 blocks from Columbia University and City College! The overall space is huge, 2 floor, townhouse style, harwood floors with lots of light. It's very refreshing and a change from the usual cramped quarters of most New York City apartments. The apt is right around the corner from the world famous 125th street and the A,B,C,D,1, and 2 trains are all 5-7 minute walk. Including the express trains that will get you to Time Square in 15-20 min! Make sure you checkout TKTS to get all the great discount theatre tickets for the hottest shows! The world famous Sylvia's and Amy Ruth's Restaurant are both within 1 mile on Lennox Ave, as well as all the cool new hot spots in Harlem! Great to go exploring down Frederick Douglas Blvd and stop at the Bier Garden, Harlem Tavern, Lito or even 67 Orange. Lots of out door seating, good for people watching! space: Welcome to New York and all it has to offer!  We offer this small room with 1/2 bath, In a nice prewar elevator building located on beautiful Riverside Drive. Across the street is Riverbank State park a sports complex. WIFI access is included and laundry facilities are available in the building.   The apartment is located 1 block from the number one train and a 5 minutesÛª walk to the A/B/C/D. Time Square is about 15- 20 minutes away on the 1 train. . There are Deli's, convenience stores and a grocery store 1 short block away And here are just a few of the many cool Restaurants/Venues in the area within walking distance: -Caridad Restaurant-Delicious affordable Dominican cuisine -Trufa Restaurant-breakfast/Lunch  -Taanto Dulce Cafe-Contental style, brunch and bakery -Tonalli Cafe/Bar-good menu,nice decor and free music on Thursdays

name: Lovely HUGE Master Bed + Study
space: *** FEATURED AS ONE OF THE TOP 25 BROOKLYN APARTMENTS ON AIRBNB'S "Best of Brooklyn" LIST! *** There's a waiting list of friends who want our apartment if we ever move out - but why would we? It feels open and fresh in the warm months and homey and inviting in the cold ones, providing a tranquil contrast to the lively streets below. name: Huge, Sunny 'n Swank Brooklyn Loft!
space: Our place is a beautiful and sunny 1050 square ft 1 bedroom loft with stunning views of Manhattan through a bank of large windows (8 in total in our place) and a balcony.  Amenities include high speed wireless internet, large flat screen TV across from the bed with a BluRay player and Apple TV. The bedroom has a beautiful queen sized bed. We say the place sleeps 5 potentially which means 2 in the bedroom, 2 on a large raised queen sized air bed, and 1 on the large L shaped couch. The kitchen is HUGE with a 12 foot granite island that is perfect for cooking, it can seat 12 or more people comfortably. We have a regular stove/oven, full size stainless steel fridge, toaster oven, espresso maker and french press, and a set of pots, pans and knives for you to use. We also provide fresh linens and towels. Everyone who sees our space agrees that it is one of the nicest lofts in the neighborhood.

name: BEAUTIFUL APARTMENT, GREAT LOCATION
space: Beautiful 1st floor spacious and furnished two bedroom apartment in the heart of Boerum Hill. Only 2 blocks away from the  famous Smith Street for the best dining and bar experiences in Brooklyn, if not New York City. The property is located on a beautiful tree-lined street in a prime Brooklyn location on Dean and Bond, with plenty of cafÌ©s and great spots to dine and drink at any time. The apartment is furnished with a queen bed in the master bedroom and a double bed in the side bedroom and a sofa in the living room. The  kitchen comes fully stocked and the bathroom has a full bathtub and shower. In addition, the apartment has cable TV and internet connection. Boerum Hill and neighboring Cobble Hill and Carroll Gardens are well known for fabulous restaurants on Smith Street (restaurant row), great shopping, cafes and antique stores. Well known artists and actors live in the area as well. It is a few blocks to the F/2/3/4/5/B/D/Q trains which take 10 - 15 minutes to get into the city.

name: The Erhart { low season discount }
space: {BEST OF NEW YORK} The 10 Coolest Airbnb Rentals in New York Timeout New York, 2014 . "Staying with Jessica at the historic mansion was quite a remarkable experience. It was not only one of the nicest homes I have ever stayed at on Airbnb, but Jessica made one of the best breakfasts that I have ever had . . . better than any breakfast spot we found, so if you stay here, I recommend sticking around for breakfast. The photos do not do the first floor justice. It is massive, but also very charming. We stayed in the top floor, and the room was beautifully designed and arranged for us. After staying with Jessica, I would recommend it as one of the best Airbnb's in New York, and a must visit if you want to experience the authenticity of a Brooklyn brownstone neighborhood, the charm of an historic mansion, and the soul of Jessica's hospitality. In other words, this is a 6 star experience, even though we only allow 5 stars to be left."  . Brian Chesky, Co-founder and CEO, Airbnb ..............

name: Private studio in midtown NYC
space: Bright, lightly furnished, studio on 2nd floor in walk-up building in Hell's Kitchen, Manhattan. Across the street from West side running and biking path. Best part is the 10-15 min walking distance to pretty much anywhere in midtown.  Central Park and Columbus Circle is also a short walk away. space: Enjoy your time in New York City in a very comfortable, artistic, large, light-filled apartment in the Hamilton Heights neighborhood in Upper Manhattan. Towels and linens are provided and you should feel free to snack on whatever we have in the fridge and cupboards. We'll make sure everything is in tip top shape upon your arrival.

name: Bright, Private Crown Heights Room
space: Clean, quiet and bright private bedroom in brownstone Brooklyn.  The space:  This is a quiet and very pleasant, small bedroom - excellent and cozy for sleeping.  It is ideal for a light-packing person who needs a wonderful place to stay in a great house with friendly people and big common areas.  The bedroom has a keyed door for privacy, a twin-sized bed, a nightstand and a small hanging closet.  Wood floors are accented with regularly cleaned throw rugs. name: Astoria Garden Suite
space: (Description en Espanol hacia abajo.) Staying in the North End of Astoria - Ditmars Blvd. train station area is the best for those who are looking to enjoy what it is like to live in a Village type atmosphere. Plenty of restaurants, beer gardens, lounges, cafes and yoga studios to keep you busy. If you are here to spend most of your days in Manhattan then Ditmars Blvd. - Astoria Queens is the way to go. It is the first stop of the N or Q line, you will always have a seat on the train at this station and the best part is that because it is the first stop there are always 2 trains at the station so no need to stand on the platform in the heat, rain, cold or snow while waiting for the train.  The other advantage to being at Ditmars is that the trains run Express during rush hour so you bypass all the other people waiting at the other stations. The train ride is 12 minutes to 59th Street & Lexington Ave - Midtown. Our place is 5 blocks & 1 avenue from the train station and is always busy s

There's a part-time doorperson who takes packages and laundry machines in the basement of the building. People in the building are friendly, a mix of those who have been here a while and those who arrived within the past 5 years, or so. name: The Wallace { low season discount }
space: {BEST OF NEW YORK} The 10 Coolest Airbnb Rentals in New York Timeout New York, 2014 . "Staying with Jessica at the historic mansion was quite a remarkable experience. It was not only one of the nicest homes I have ever stayed at on Airbnb, but Jessica made one of the best breakfasts that I have ever had . . . better than any breakfast spot we found, so if you stay here, I recommend sticking around for breakfast. The photos do not do the first floor justice. It is massive, but also very charming. We stayed in the top floor, and the room was beautifully designed and arranged for us. After staying with Jessica, I would recommend it as one of the best Airbnbs in New York, and a must visit if you want to experience the authenticity of a Brooklyn brownstone neighborhood, the charm of an historic mansion, and the soul of Jessica's hospitality. In other words, this is a 6 star experience, even though we only allow 5 stars to be left."  . Brian Chesky, Co-founder and CEO, Airbnb ...............

name: Loft Suite @ Box House Hotel
space: Loft Suites @ The Box House Hotel. Located in the industrial chic area of North Greenpoint in Brooklyn, The Box House Hotel features contemporary lofts and suites with large windows. These loft units feature 16ft ceilings, kitchenettes, and translucent glass block wall giving ample light. Fully equipped with everything you need for your stay. The loft is equipped with HD TVs in both the living and bedroom areas with premium cable channels. There are hardwood floors throughout and a full bathroom with shower/tub combination.

name: 1 Bedroom Available In My Two Bedroom Flat
space: Two couches in living room, a 42" flat screen TV. Modest kitchen is equipped with everything you need to cook (pots, pans, spices, etc.). Nice, clean bathroom with great water pressure. Two separate entrances (one on the ground floor and one on the parlor floor) allows maximum privacy for guests! Exclusive access to HUGE back yard. I have made this apartment a very comfortable place to live and it is in a terrific location. Situated on the very best block in this red-hot neighborhood (St. Marks Ave bet. Franklin and Bedford), you'll be a short 7 minute walk (in either direction), to all the subways you could need: 2/3/4/5 @ Franklin Ave./Eastern Parkway; the C @ Franklin Ave./ Fulton St. & Franklin Ave. S (Shuttle) in between. Franklin Ave. has quickly become the new Smith Street in Brooklyn and is literally 5 doors away. It has EVERYTHING you could possibly need: supermarkets, laundromats, great bars and restaurants (Barboncino, has recently been touted as the BEST pizza in NYC!) are

name: SPACIOUS PRIVATE LITTLE ITALY FLAT
space: This spacious renovated studio with semi-lofted bed is nestled on the second floor in a rear building (VERY QUIET) in the heart of Little Italy. Clean, safe and fun neighborhood!  Amenities include: wifi, basic cable, an amazing stereo and record player, and probably one of the most comfortable eco-friendly mattresses in town (KEETSA Tea Leaf Supreme) with all organic and non-allergenic bedding :) There is also a clean and freshly new filtered Brita water jug, coffee maker, tea kettle, toaster and blender, full-sized kitchen and fridge and plenty of dishes, glassware and pots and pans for cooking. Clean bedding and bath towels are also provided. The full-sized bathroom has a full-sized bathtub and new shower head with plenty of water pressure (and hot water) and clean towels will be provided. The apartment is within walking distance to Soho, the Lower East Side, Tribeca, Noho, and the East/West Village, aka the location is amazing. Some of the city's best shopping and restaurants are o

name: The Lenox in Harlem
space: This beautiful, spacious apartment is just 4 blocks from the 2/3 express train. Building has 24 hour doorman, free gym, and rooftop terrace with grill. The apartment is 1,450 sq feet, 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom. 1-2 people can stay in private room with private bathroom. An additional 1 - 2 people can sleep on a pull out couch. They would share the same private bathroom.  Bedroom has flat screen tv with cable and a queen sized bed. Apartment has wireless internet. Full access to kitchen. The fee for 1 - 2 people is $125/night. Additional guests $50 per person per night.

name: Heart & Soul of Greenwich Village
space: PLEASE DO NOT SEND A RESERVATION REQUEST WITHOUT  COMMUNICATING WITH ME FIRST.  Perfectly situated in Manhattan's legendary Greenwich Village: a truly unique 4 bed/1 bath, giant sun-drenched loft space with 20-foot ceilings, full-kitchen/dining area, washer/dryer, and private outdoor rooftop garden terrace complete with outdoor heated shower, and skyline view.  Step from the bustling street energy in one of New York City's most vibrant and trendy neighborhoods into a quiet oasis of calm, comfort and class. It's the ultimate New York living experience: the city is at your doorstep, but the sound stays behind.  Just steps from all subway transportation, historic Washington Square Park, NYU's Main Campus, Bleecker Street, the world-renowned "The Blue Note" jazz club, and several other notable fine dining, nightlife and entertainment options. You will not find a better location! Ideal for corporate teams, visiting families, couples, or singles looking for a clean, comfortable urban living

name: Prime Williamsburg Loft off Bedford
space: Settle into your own private room and work space in a spacious and stylish loft on one of the best blocks in the Burg. Ideal location - just a 3-minute walk from the Bedford stop on the L train, which will get you to Union Square in Manhattan in 5 minutes. You can also catch the East River Ferry from the nearby North 6th Pier.  On North 9th St., you are in the center of it all but still on a quiet, tree-lined block. The high street of Bedford Avenue is two short blocks away, and one block in the other direction is gorgeous East River State Park. YouÛªll be perfectly positioned to take in the neighborhoodÛªs countless cool bars, restaurants, boutiques and events.  As for the space, the loft is on the 3rd floor of a former factory building. In all it is approximately 1,100 square feet (102M sq.), with 12-foot (3.6M) ceilings throughout, a huge common living room space with Manhattan and Brooklyn views, and a massive roof deck with sweeping views of the East River and Manhattan skyline.  Th

name: Private Bdrm /Bath 1 block Ctrl Prk
space: Beautiful spacious apt in a prewar building.  My apartment is located on the 5th floor of a pre-war building on 86th Street .  Central Park is just one block away and the apt is in an area that is walking distance to many of the city's attractions-The Metropolitan Museum of Art is walking distance through Central Park, The Museum of Natural History is only a few blocks away, and Lincoln Center is just a few bus or subway stops away.  The subway is less than two blocks away, and the crosstown bus in right on the corner. There are plenty of good restaurants, bars, and shopping in the area. Private bedroom and private bathroom. Fresh towels, sheets, comforters provided. Pull out couch/sofabed, air conditioning.Computer access and tv also available.

name: +Highly Satisfactory LES dwelling++
space: To share with kind people in a relaxed atmosphere. Your vibe and chemistry makes it a unique experience. Not for profit... Good sleep for NYC adventures. Your hospitality is personal. Private room in an L.E.S flat, Extra comfortable, minimal style..  Exclusive 242 sqft size Bedroom with shared bath on the best and safe block of the Lower East Side. Most convenient In most interesting Neighborhood. The apartment is a 2 flight of stairs walk-up in a 5 story building. Designer by profession, the decor has been kept simple to allow more space, think, and relax. The room is bright and spacious with a table to help plan your day in private.  I'm at hand to help with your Luggage should you need, just ask! Great deal for amenities in a location as the Lower East side.No hidden fees, all Inclusive.  Wholefoods Natural Market. IÛªm an old New Yorker, worked in Japan and South East Asia, and have some idea of unique spots.  Central heating and Air conditioning for your comfort.

name: Big Apple Biggest Luxury Space -Grand Villa
space: 8 bdrm villa

name: Whole apartment / 2 bedroom in NYC
space: Welcome!  Whole apartment for rent in a spacious fully furnished, 2 bedroom apartment located on 112th street between Park and lexington avenues. 2 bedrooms with shared bath, separate living room and separate dinning room area.  Two bedrooms each with a double bed that can accommodate 4 people. The apartment is on the top floor of an elevator building. The building also has washer/dryer located on the first floor along with 2 courtyards. The apartment is located just 2 short blocks away from the 6 local train located on 110th street and lexington avenue, makes it very convenient to visit the city and also a 5 minute walk to central Park. This apartment is very spacious, bright with natural lighting and quiet. Being so close to the subway and with the apartment features and its space, this rental Ideal for your stay here in NYC!

name: 21% off 21 days! BEST NEIGHBORHOOD!...NY Magazine
space: "I had a wonderful time in New York City. The room at Taylor & Grace's apartment is spacious, very clean and makes you feel being at home. The area is just great, close to subway trains, you can go for runs in Prospect Park and have all kinds of restaurants and shops close by. I highly recommend this place for your stay in NY." Olaf from Germany writes. On the 4th floor of a secure (walk-up) apartment building, your private room comes with  - a comfy, twin bed  - desk and chair and  - armoire for clothes. The flat is in the back of the building so it is quiet. A bathroom and living room is shared with the host. Kitchen use is available for vegetarian foods please. Other amenities include wireless internet, coin operated washer and dryer in the basement and air conditioning. Note: we do not have a landline phone, television set or microwave. Located in what the New York Magazine calls the "BEST PLACE TO LIVE" in NYC, North Park Slope, just a few blocks from the B/Q and 2/3 trains.  - go

name: Private master suite in a spacious loft apartment
space: The apartment, just two flights of stairs up on the 3rd floor is extremely spacious. There is a lot of space to cook, eat, and hang out, and there is even a laundry room in the apartment!

name: Mid-Century Modernist in Chelsea
space: This beautifully appointed apartment is in the heart of Chelsea (21st Street, between 7th Ave and 8th Ave). There are a lot of great places in the neighborhood for you to enjoy and we're conveniently located near the A, C, E, F, and 1 trains. We live close to great food, good shopping, Hudson River Park, The Highline, and Flatiron District. You'll love being in this centrally located spot in Manhattan. Our standards are very high. We're looking for someone who is conscientious, respectful, educated. Oh, and no Republicans or Conservatives, please. You'll need to be incredibly fastidious with the apartment (it's more like a museum than a home), and always remove your shoes before entering. We've done a VERY expensive renovation with the apartment and need someone who will be VERY careful with everything. If you're sloppy or clumsy or heavy-footed, this isn't going to work out. :) If you fit these requirements, we'd love to hear from you. Serious inquiries only, please. Best, Munawar

name: Loft Suite @ The Box House Hotel
space: Loft Suites @ The Box House Hotel. Located in the industrial chic area of North Greenpoint in Brooklyn, The Box House Hotel features contemporary lofts and suites with large windows. Each apartment-style accommodation at The Box House Hotel is styled with bright colors, hardwood floors, antiques and contemporary art. Select rooms have a terrace and views of Midtown Manhattan. These loft units feature 16ft ceilings, kitchenettes, and translucent glass block wall giving ample light. Fully equipped with everything you need for your stay. The studio loft has an alcove bedroom area with a comfortable queen size bed and a pullout sofa in the living room area, which in total can easily sleep up to 4 guests. The loft is equipped with 42Û LCD HD TVs in both the living and bedroom areas with premium cable channels. There are hardwood floors throughout and a full bathroom with shower/tub combination.

name: Large 1 Bedroom furnished on UWS
space: I have a very nice 1 bedroom available for the Holidays on the Upper West Side at Broadway and low 100's. Available in advance for any dates.  If interested please email me for dates, I will accomodate with advance notice.    The apartment is within walking distance to Riverside Park. The apartment has a large 1 bedroom, with queen size bed,  A full size living room with a non convertible couch, a eat in  dining room  and a roomy kitchen. There is also Wifi and everything you'll need if you need to cook. The kitchen has stainless steel appliances, furnished with all towels, linens,plates, cookware etc..  It is a quick subway stop to central park for THE MACY'S DAY PARADE BALLOON BLOWING UP EVENT! and Ice skating in Central Park. close to the subway (local and Express lines) 3 subway stops to Times Square.Great, safe neighborhood.

name: 2 BR Duplex @ Box House Hotel
space: Unique 2 bedroom duplex @ The Box House Hotel. Located in the industrial chic area of North Greenpoint in Brooklyn, The Box House Hotel features contemporary lofts and suites with large windows. Each apartment-style accommodation at The Box House Hotel is styled with bright colors, hardwood floors, antiques and contemporary art. Select rooms have a terrace and views of Midtown Manhattan. Authentic factory converted loft. This unique space will leave you wowed with its soaring ceilings, curved wall, and translucent glass block wall giving ample light and maximum privacy. The loft features a kitchen with center island. There is a large open living area that is great for relaxing and entertaining. A spiral staircase then takes you up to 2 private bedrooms: one with a king size bed and a queen size bed in the other. A great place for friends or family to spend a holiday.

name: Husband & Wife Art-Filled Apartment
space: Comfy 1 bedroom apartment in convenient, charming Fort Greene, Brooklyn. I'm a filmmaker. My wife is a writer and musician. Our house is filled with art, books, movies, comfortable vintage furniture.  We love to cook, so the kitchen is well stocked. The house is warm, tidy, and gets a lot of light. We have one double bed and a pair of long couches that can make a nice bed.  The building is friendly and there are great neighborhoods all around, with restaurants, bars, cafes, all sorts of shopping, parks, greenmarkets and more. In Fort Greene, near Clinton Hill, Park Slope, Prospect Heights. 15 minutes to Lower Manhattan, Williamsburg, Cobble Hill, Carroll Gardens. Half a block to the C train, 8 minutes to the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, D, G.  WiFi included. Stereo with speakers in both rooms.  We'll admit that the paint is peeling a bit on the ceiling, and there might be some dust if you peak behind the furniture, but this is a loved and well lived-in place that will make you feel right at

name: Lovely Radiant Private Room Williamsburg Bedford L
space: ***IMPORTANT: Please message me to inquire about availability before sending a Reservation Request. BEFORE BOOKING PLEASE READ WHOLE DESCRIPTION. ***  This listing is for a beautiful private bedroom available in a 4 bedroom apartment in trendy and charming Williamsburg, Brooklyn. If the calendar shows as booked, feel free to contact me anyway as I sometimes have availability for another bedroom in the same apartment. Just 4 blocks from the Bedford Avenue stop on the L line (a mere 5 minutes from Manhattan), the location canÛªt be beat. WhatÛªs more, this neighborhood has been featured as one of the new spots to visit while in New York City. There are plenty of boutiques, small businesses and art galleries as well as delicious restaurants and coffee shops within walking distance. Plus two parks, one with a variety of activities and a weekly green market, and the other with a beautiful view of the East River and the Manhattan skyline. Speaking of which, the rooftop in the building is equip

name: 3BR, 2 bathroom condo in Bushwick
space: 3 real bedrooms and 2 bathrooms in a bright and modern condo comfortably accommodate up to 6 guests. Conveniently located 3 minutes from the subway (L train at Dekalb Ave station).  Only a 15 minute commute to Manhattan.  Before booking another room in Bushwick, look at an online map to see where it is located. You might be walking for 20 minutes just to get to the train.

name: ENTIRE FLOOR in VEGETARIAN WBURG DUPLEX wBACKYARD
space: Seriously beautiful duplex, new construction, 2br/2ba, just 3 blocks from the Lorimer L stop (2nd stop in Williamsburg) Lots of light, lots of excellent closet space, HUGE open kitchen, hardwood floors throughout, brand new finishes/appliances, high ceilings WASHER/DRYER IN UNIT! Dishwasher! The bedroom is completely furnished with a queen size tempurpedic mattress & pillow with a huge, beautiful closet with three big drawers, desk & swivel chair, side table, lamps, rugs, mirrors, books and adjustable a/c/heater/fan. ThereÛªs plenty of floor space to stretch & do yoga, if thatÛªs your thing ;) (yoga mat & foam roller available for use!) ECHO is also available to play your favorite music or update you with news & weather on command. YouÛªll have a private half bath with sink & toilet and plenty of room in the oversized medicine cabinet. Upstairs is the shower that is shared with my very clean & kind roommate :) Super, super comfortable shared living space - very zen and homey.  55" flat sc

name: Cozy 2 Bedroom 20 Min from City
space: Beautiful renovated 2 bedroom apartment, nestled on a quiet block on the edge of Clinton Hill/BedStuy.  The neighborhood is rich in culture and foot steps away from Clinton Hills, Fort Greene, downtown Brooklyn and Manhattan. The neighborhood offers a cozy coffee shop (Civil Service) three short blocks away and three full service restaurants (the Black Swan, Pilar and Coladors) four-five blocks away. The "G" train is three blocks away at the Bedford/Nostrand or four blocks to the Myrtle/Willoughby train stops.  In fifteen to twenty minutes with a connection to the "L" you can be in the city and get off on the East or West side of Manhattan. If you want to stay above ground and ride the bus to downtown Brooklyn, the B38 and B44 are a block away.  You can also walk 4 short blocks over to Myrtle Ave. and jump on the B54 and ride down Myrtle Ave. and jump off at any of the many restaurants, bars, stores and coffee shops along the way. Pratt University is walking distance.  The BARCLAY Cent

name: Prime Prospect Heights, Brooklyn
space: Private, sun-filled bedroom in ground floor stylish apartment.  Bedroom is furnished with a full-size bed (photo is out of date; a brand new bed now occupies the room), which connects to a large living room (photo out of date there, too; brand new sofa) with full windows, sofa, and bookshelves.  Eat In kitchen is stocked and ready to go with anything you'll need for your stay.    Apartment is fully (and charmingly!) furnished, with Wi-Fi. Apartment is filled with amazing objects and books that you could get lost in.  A record player, vintage toys, cool artwork, chairs on the wall.  But you won't get lost in it, because you are not only in New York City, you are in the best neighborhood in Brooklyn.   You are 2 short two blocks from Prospect Park / Grand Army Plaza, 585 acres of wandering, walking, biking, and running.  And don't forget the Zoo, the Audubon Center, the boathouse, the parade ground.   And the legendary weekly Farmer's Market on Saturday morning, perfect for stocking up.

name: West Village Amazing 1Bedroom/1Bathroom+Patio area
space: Ideal West Village location at the corner of Bedford and Christopher streets. A minute walk from the famous Bleecker Street and two blocks from the beautiful Hudson River Park. The apartment is located in the Greenwich Village Historical District and is a part of a Greek revival townhouse build in 1847. The building and the apartment are well preserved and maintained. Very close to shopping, cafes, galleries, bars, many different restaurants and much more! Everything is nearby including grocery shops, laundry services, playgrounds for children and different types of transportation for traveling all over Manhattan (Subway, Path train, Buses,). This is a cozy, warm, comfortable and fully equipped apartment. One out of two apartments in a private townhouse, 5-6 steps above the street level.   Perfect for 1 or 2 couples, a couple with kids or 2 singles. name: NOLITA! LOCATION! LOCATION! VIEWS! FREE GYM!
space: Please send us a note inquiring about availability before trying to book. Our condominium is a boutique elevator building located in the heart of Soho / Nolita, in one of the most desirable neighborhoods in downtown Manhattan. The building is new construction, so expect only the finest amenities.  It is steps from numerous art galleries, The New Museum of Contemporary Art, Whole Foods, LombardiÛªs Pizza, Torrisi Italian Specialties, Rice to Riches, Balthazar, The Bowery Hotel, all major subway stations, SoHo shops, downtown nightlife and so much more.  If luxury living is what you seek, this is for you! The condo is on a high floor so you will have spectacular sunset views of Downtown New York and the World Trade Center every night! name: Lofty Illuminated Brownstone Beauty
space: This Zen inspired, artist-friendly space is one you'll love! On the ground floor of an architecturally beautiful brownstone, you will be greeted by a warm environment and gracious hostess where a welcoming abode awaits you!    Upon arrival, you are greeted with an abundance of delectable fresh fruit, coffee/tea, juices and pastries which you'll enjoy each morning, for the duration of your stay.   Your private, spacious sleeping and meditating quarters (yoga mat provided) is sun drenched and air conditioned and quiet. You'll comfortably rest on a comfortable full size bed with a cozy warm cotton comforter & fluffy pillows.  A closet is provided for storage of your belongings. Clean linens are provided.   As you enter common area of this loft-like home away from home, a fully equipped, open kitchen lends itself to the airy feel of the apartment, as it pours out into an inviting living/dining space flooded with natural light. The view from here is gorgeous as you take in the ever changi

name: The Notorious B.N.B. { low season discount }
space: {BEST OF NEW YORK} The 10 Coolest Airbnb Rentals in New York Timeout New York, 2014 . "Staying with Jessica at the historic mansion was quite a remarkable experience. It was not only one of the nicest homes I have ever stayed at on Airbnb, but Jessica made one of the best breakfasts that I have ever had . . . better than any breakfast spot we found, so if you stay here, I recommend sticking around for breakfast. The photos do not do the first floor justice. It is massive, but also very charming. We stayed in the top floor, and the room was beautifully designed and arranged for us. After staying with Jessica, I would recommend it as one of the best Airbnbs in New York, and a must visit if you want to experience the authenticity of a Brooklyn brownstone neighborhood, the charm of an historic mansion, and the soul of Jessica's hospitality. In other words, this is a 6 star experience, even though we only allow 5 stars to be left."  . Brian Chesky, Co-founder and CEO, Airbnb . .............

name: New York - 15 minutes from Times Square/Midtown.
space: Small cozy 2 bedroom apartment, just a few steps from the subway. Near everything, 15 minutes to Times Square and Grand Central. 24 hour drugstore, diner, deli. Plenty of restaurants, laundromat, bars.

name: AMAZING BROWNSTONE 3 BEDROOM DUPLEX
space: This is an amazing 3 bedroom 3 bathroom duplex in a beautifully newly restored and renovated brownstone in historic Bedford Stuyvesant Brooklyn.  The home has modern design and art drenched decor.  The new open concept kitchen has all new modern appliances.  The bedrooms each have queen size bed.  The huge master bedroom has an en suite bathroom with double sink and skylight.  A washer and dryer is available along with the comfort of central air. The huge sun drench living room is decorated with a mix mid century and modern furnishings.  Modern amenities includes flat screen TV and WIFI. It is 3 blocks from the J train and 6 blocks from the M train Both will take you China Town, Bowery, Lower East Side, East Village and Mid Town in 15 - 25 minutes.  4 blocks away, the G train with take Williamsburg and Downtown Brooklyn. name: Luxury Chelsea Townhouse at the High Line

The home feels like a five star botique hotel, it's interiors are 20th century Modern Design.
