name: Classic and Comfortable Manhattan
space: Comfortable pre-war apartment with many bars, restaurants, and shopping within blocks. One bedroom with a queen size bed. An additional sofa bed in the living room sleeps 2 more. Bathroom has a bathtub with a shower. Kitchen has stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher, and toaster. Near to Baruch College, Gramercy Park, Madison Square Park, and the Flatiron Building.

name: NICE ONE BEDROOM APT by PROSPECT PARK
space: Hi, I live in a one bedroom apartment and I will be leaving for some time. We also offer you a towel, use of your own closet, a chair, a table and computer (if needed) plus free internet access.  There is an AC in the room-trust me it will get really hot in NY during summer. Also feel free to use the kitchen, glasses and so forth. The neighborhood:  I am located in Lefferts Gardens, right by the Prospect Park, less then 1 minute from a subway stop PROSPECT PARK (Q & B trains), it takes exactly 17 minutes to come to Union Square, Manhattan. name: A Little West Village Charm...
space: Simply the most charming apartment you will set foot in, located in the heart of the West Village. This is real New York City Village life. Gorgeous attention to detail and fully furnished. The apartment is equipped with luxury large queen-size bed, ultra-luxe mattress, usable kitchen (though, no oven) and much more.  Located on Charles and West 4th, this is a unique opportunity to experience life in the Village. Your neighbors include Liv Tyler, Hugh Jackman and Sarah Jessica Parker and some of the best restaurants in New York City. Amazing cocktail bars, cobble-stoned streets and the best local shopping in town. The Apartment: One flight up from West 4th street in a classic land-mark building awaits an amazing corner 1-bedroom apartment; hardwood-floors, custom-paint job and 11 foot ceilings. Designer lighting and old-world sconces create a remarkably quaint and romantic experience. You will have full view of the romance unfolding on the West Village streets  from the floor-to-ceilin

space: Two bedrooms, one with Queen size bed, the other with a full size.   Although we have two beds, we can only accept two people, so as not to disturb our neighbors. name: Your Own Comfy Room, 1 Bl. from Subway, Great Nabe
space: YOUR OWN ROOM in a super-safe Upper West Side 1-bedroom apt. share in wonderful, leafy, classic NYC nabe that's 1 block from subways that take you to Midtown or the Village in 10-15 minutes. name: Sunny 2 Bedroom Duplex with Garden
space: Entire house to yourselves:  On the first floor is a living room with TV (roku: HBO, Netflix, Amazon), vintage couches, real furniture, a half bathroom, and the kitchen/dining room with a back door to the yard. name: Beautiful apartment in Prospect Heights
space: Beautiful, light and spacious apartment Located in a pre-war building in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn. 6th floor with beautiful light and great views of Manhattan and the Brooklyn Museum. Beautiful sunsets and rooftop views straight to the stunning Verrazano Bridge.  And when you want to get to Manhattan, every major train has its first stop in Brooklyn Heights. name: 1 BR with garden--East Village
space: The apartment is small, but about average for 1 BRs in the East Village. It's in an old tenement house, built in 1911, and has a couple of the original brick walls. We have a full kitchen, including spices. We have a private bathroom, wireless internet, and many books on New York, including Lonely Planet, a regional hiking guide that includes a couple of places in the city, and a historical book that includes several self-guided walking tours.  We have a large communal garden in the back. Spring through fall we grow herbs and a few vegetables back there.  It's an excellent space for a BBQ.  Since it is such a happening neighborhood, it can get loud at night and sometimes the jukebox from the bar below can be heard in the apartment.  We use a fan and sometimes white noise to help us get to bed on early nights Great location, historical building, cute apartment, private spaces--it's an excellent find in the East Village.

name: Gorgeous Chelsea loft in the heart of Manhattan
space: Perfect location!! Stylish, spacious, 2000SF loft fully loaded with all amenities in an elevator building. Step in and you are greeted by a huge living room, 12 ft high ceilings, a master bedroom with en suite bathroom, a second bedroom with a king size bed (which also shrinks to a twin size bed if preferred), and a sleep-in study with a couch, that functions as a third bedroom. There is an additional full bathroom (a total of 2), and a washer/dryer in the apartment.  Seven enormous 7ft by 5ft windows give you a fascinating view of 20th Century New York City architecture and our iconic Water Towers. Step outside and you are minutes walk away from some of the best restaurants, bars, classic sites, and shopping in Manhattan. Wonderful playgrounds for kids are 2 to 4 blocks away. Walk to Madison Square Garden, Union Square Farmers' Market, Chelsea Piers, the Joyce Theatre, Times Square, and Broadway.  10 minutes by cab to the Javits Centre or the United Nations. Close to nearly all subway

name: Chans Comfy Artsy Beach Condo
space: Well appointed fully furnished 3 Br 21/2 bathroom home welcomes you with great accommodations; includes utilities; Private community; 2 blocks from ocean and private beach; front and back porches; close to all Coney Island.   Both Room and full apartment offers will be considered.   Only gated community in the City of New York with private police force for additional safety. Accessible by either and both bus and train; only minutes from Manhattan;  and right off the Belt Parkway by car..

name: Private BR, Bath & Books in BRKLYN
space: Classic Brooklyn view of the S train and Prospect/Crown Heights rooftops as sunrise streams into your room.  The apartment is a bright, modern 2 bedroom, 2 bath (945 total sq ft), filled with books, art, photos and tapestries from my international travels.  I sleep in one bedroom with en suite bath, you in the other bedroom, with your own full bathroom.  The lovely corner living room and open kitchen area we share.  A child or third adult guest can possibly be accommodated short-term with a deluxe twin air mattress, if needed. Eclectic decor, stainless appliances (including a dishwasher), new twin mattresses, closet space and shelves for you, and a small washer and dryer in the unit (!!!) for your use (supplying your own laundry supplies or replenishing mine).  The balcony, with comfortable chairs and sweet view, is a perfect place for your morning cup of french press coffee or evening glass of wine.   Houseplants offer green inside.  Need more nature?  It's a fast two stops on the S t

name: Brooklyn Amazing 2bedrm Luxury Apt
space: Coming into town on Business or Pleasure? Tired of paying outrageous Hotel room prices? Well, live the Lavish life on your Business trip or Vacation for a fraction of the cost!! Book Now! Amazing 2 Bedroom Luxury Apartment for rent now! Hot Location surrounded by Art and Culture! Close to transportation, Restaurants, and entertainment. Book Now! Dates going fast! Don't miss your opportunity to rent in style while you work or play! Apartment includes gleaming hardwood floors, Flat Screens TV's, Basic Cable, Amazon Fire Stick, wireless internet, & WIFI. A Chief Kitchen with stainless steel appliances and Jacuzzi Tub in bathroom to relax in.  1st bedroom features a queen sized bed, flat panel TV, AC window unit 2nd bedroom features a full sized bed, flat panel TV w/built in DVD Player, AC window unit. The living room futon opens into a Full size bed, flat panel 40" TV. This apartment is located on the 2nd Flr in a beautiful Limestone in the Historic Crown Heights neighborhood in Brooklyn.

name: Beautiful 2-BDRM Brownstone Apartment
space: Enter the property from a quiet, tree-lined street, into an apartment with modern amenities and appliances, charming decorative fireplace, hardwood bamboo floors, and furnishings from the owner's travels worldwide. The living room, bedrooms, dining area and full kitchen are equipped with free wireless Internet (WIFI), cable TV and international channels (TV5, RAI, BBC), and all of the comforts and conveniences of home.  Upon arrival, guests will find 100% cotton, freshly laundered linens on the beds and towels in the bathroom. Down comforters/duvets and bed quilts are available for seasonal use.

name: Adorable Upper West Side Apartment
space: Great apartment conveniently located near the 1, B, and C subway lines, three blocks from Riverside Park and Central Park.  There is a comfortable queen bed that sleeps 2, and a twin bed that sleeps one. Full bathroom with shower/bathtub and fully-stocked kitchen.  All linens and towels provided. Free WiFi and A/C in the summer.  Free parking is available on side streets. Convenient paid parking available in the neighborhood in a 24-hour garage for $20-$30 a day.  Also conveniently located near the last stop of the M60 bus that goes to and from LaGuardia Airport, 24 hours a day.  There are two adorable and friendly cats that just require feeding first thing in the morning.

name: One Bdrm in Trendy Prospect Hts
space: Come stay in my cozy one bedroom apartment.  It's steps from tons of great restaurants in both Prospect Heights and Park Slope.  It's also near most trains (B/Q, 2/3 and all trains to the Atlantic/Pacific station) and less than 10 mins walk to Prospect Park, the Brooklyn Botanical Gardens and the Brooklyn Museum.

name: Feels like home with park view
space: Find a hidden gem in the Northern most part of Manhattan. Comfortable, clean, large and sunny apartment on Seaman Avenue across from Inwood Hill Park. Fully furnished for your needs, no personal items other than books and art to help you really feel at home. The kitchen is fully equipped for your cooking needs. Bathroom recently had a facelift so tiles and tub are blindingly white and clean. First floor will make it super easy to carry in your luggage!! One bedroom apartment, super clean and tidy. Queen sized bed is very comfortable. Apartment is very quiet and peaceful with great energy.  Beautiful Park right outside the window. The building and neighborhood is safe with friendly neighbors. The park is amazing. You can play tennis, basketball, baseball and canoe on our gorgeous lake overlooking the Hudson river. You can go hiking and explore the last forest land in New York City. The Inwood Hill Nature Center at the north end of the park is both a location for educational programs and

name: Bedroom, kitchen and private garden
space: The bedroom has a Queen sized bed, ceiling fan, comfy leather chair, coffee table, desk with lamp and chair, huge closet, 7 foot mirror and direct access to the backyard.  Spice up those steaks with fresh herbs from the garden and enjoy a glass of wine by the fire. Guests are welcome to use the spacious kitchen.  It is equipped with a microwave, toaster, blender, gas stove, grill, dishwasher and coffee maker. There is a laundromat next door and a grocery store a block away.   There is a fold out sofa that sleeps two in the living room if you need that too.   Wake up in a sun filled bedroom in Park Slope, Brooklyn. Open the backdoor and sip coffee while watching the birds play in the private garden.  Explore the wonderful shops, restaurants, art galleries, movie houses and bars in the neighborhood. Take a Yoga class, or maybe a Salsa lesson at one of the Dance studios nearby.  Perhaps walk up to Prospect Park, go to the Brooklyn Museum, visit the Botanical gardens, or see what looks goo

There is full privacy on this floor except for my ocassional use of the kitchen and the front door.   Please dont be put off by the airmattress.  When its made up, the room is very nice. name: COLORFUL AND SUNNY ROOM
space: BEAUTIFUL, COLORFUL AND LOTS OF LIGHT makes this room very appealing.  Its a real double bed and also has a television. Located in the very diverse Sugar Hill section of Harlem at 145th Street, we are very convenient to the subway system, approximately 2 blocks, to the A,B,C,D., Jackie Robinson Park, which has a public swimming pool (with fee), numerous new restaurants within a ten block radius (short blocks) two stops to Columbus Circle, Central Park. We have the convenience of several supermarkets, Pharmacy, gym, Star Bucks all just a stone throw from the apartment. And do not forget the infamous 125th Street which is also the site for the Apollo Theatre. A few blocks from the Apollo we have Sylvia (who havent heard about Sylvia of Harlem). The Abyssian Baptist Church is also within walking distance.  We really have a lot going on in Harlem. There is nothing not to love. One of the best move I made

name: Brand new 2 bed with gorgeous view of skyline
space: Romantic 2 bedroom with a picturesque view of the Brooklyn skyline, and right next to one of the oldest trees in Brooklyn. We are on an extremely quiet street with no through traffic, and you'll have the entire apartment all to yourself.  The apartment is brand new, built less than a year ago. There are hardwood floors, high ceilings, radiant (floor) heating, AC in each room, stainless steel appliances, and high speed WiFi. There is a full bath, full kitchen, towels / linens, and a washer / dryer. There is one bedroom with a king bed and a second bedroom with sofa that converts to a double bed. This is not a typical sofa bed as we have a custom memory foam cover which makes it more comfortable than most normal beds. We also have a pack n'play crib for infants and toddlers.  The living room has a pull out sofa. You can comfortably sleep 3-4 adults or kids, and if you are willing to have 2 people sleeping in your living room then you can have another 2 people (max 6).  In addition there

space: Hello, I am an Italian photographer based in Brooklyn, NY and I have a huge room (250 square feet) for rent in an awesome Williamsburg loft (1500 sq feet), by the Graham stop of the L train. The house features exposed white brick walls, wooden floors, big bathroom and kitchen, and a private and large rooftop with plants and garden where you can read, sunbathe and have dinner parties. We are both relaxed, mature and responsible, both very clean and tidy.  She occupies the second bedroom, and I sleep in the outer area of the apartment -- modified into a third bedroom and separated at night by a floor-to-ceiling, full-length partition, so everyone enjoys complete privacy.  The shared, common spaces of the apartment (the areas of the apartment that everyone is welcome to use) are the kitchen, bathroom, entry and hallway. All subways are also walking distance and the closest trains are the 1, 2 or 3 or A, C, E. Penn Station is also walking distance at 12 blocks. Cabs are also easy to get on the corner. Greenwich Village is 4 blocks away. It's one of the best neighborhoods in NYC! The apartment was recently completely painted in June 2015. It is very clean and fresh with new paint.

We like to keep it clean. About the neighborhood: We love our neighborhood and our block. Bed-Stuy is gentrifying fast and one of the roomates has been in the apartment for over 10 years. space: Bedroom has a queen sized bed that sleeps two people and the living room has a sofa that becomes a full sized bed that sleeps another  two people.  There is also an inflatable queen mattress. name: Bright, Airy Loft Apt in Bushwick
space: A lovely loft apartment (approx 600 sq ft /60 sq m) in a converted building with nice, young people/artists/young families (not a party loft). It feels a lot bigger than that because of the super high ceilings.  It will fit 2 people perfectly with a full sized mattress in the living area, and an alcove space (mostly storage for myself), full kitchen amenities, clean bathroom with shower. There is laundry on the same floor. Its super sunny and super quiet (I face the back), which is very rare for NYC.  This is my own apartment and I keep it extremely tidy and clean.

name: Cute 2BR East Village Best location
space: My AIRBNB listing is LEGAL in New York City, it's ok to rent rooms in a townhouse, and not ok to rent them in an apartment building. This place is close to everything, its in an amazing little building that I own. on 2av and 6th street.  Times are slow for January and February so feel free to ask me for a deal, specially for longer days. I have two other listings in the building: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/126443 for a 2BR and https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/163814 for the studio. This is one floor apartment. There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and two single beds in the other  room. The couch in the living room can sleep 1 person. Small fridge, coffee maker in the flat. It has a nice bathroom with tub. There is a cooking area on first floor, which is shared with studio guests on the first floor. The apartment comes with fresh sheets.  This is by far the hottest area of Manhattan to live at the moment, the subway N R and 6 is 2 1/2 blocks away, F is 5 short blocks away and L is 8.

name: Spacious beautiful 2br in Manhattan
space: This 2-bedroom apartment is located in Hudson Heights, only a two - minute walk from the express A train. The apartment is very quiet, located on a residential street and only steps away from Fort Tryon Park, the Cloisters, and Fort Washington.   The apartment is fully furnished, with internet, kitchen (dishwasher, microwave, oven), play station, elevator, and laundry in the building.   If you are visiting NYC as a tourist, this place offers you a very quick connection to Times Square, Columbus Circle and all the major attractions in NYC.  When you're done exploring the city, you can come back home, relax and have a quiet evening, feeling like you're home.

name: Duplex 1BR Apt in Ft Greene, Bklyn
space: We are going away for part of the summer and we are subletting our fantastic one-bedroom apartment in Fort Greene, right by BAM and the Atlantic Center Terminal. The apartment is 2 floors, lofted, and very spacious. There is a loft with an extra bed that fits a guest/roommate comfortably. It is fully furnished and your rent covers all bills (cable, tv, gas, electricity). Extra features: # one block from Atlantic Center Terminal and Mall # one block from BAM # 2 blocks from center of Fort Greene's shops and restaurants # Access to these trains: B,C,D,G,N,R,Q,2,3,4,5,LIRR - 25 minutes to Times Square on the N and Q trains # King size bed in bedroom # Full size guest bed in loft # Roof access # Cable and DVR # Wireless internet # Baby grand piano # Faces East and West - East view has 2-storey windows # Very calm and quiet Our apartment is ideal for a responsible and respectful individual or couple.

name: WINTER SPECIAL! spacious 2bdr
space: Modern and prestigious, this cozy apartment is on the ground floor of a centennial Brooklyn townhouse located at the heart of vibrant, dynamic Crown Heights ÛÒ the perfect urban haven after a full day of shopping and adventure in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Two different subway stations (See Guide for more details), each only a 10-minute walk away, connect you to New York's most visited borough, weither you are going to the West Side, MidTown or East Side of Manhattan. Some visitors will also be pleasantly surprised to find out that we are located 30 minutes away, door to door, from the Barclays Center. The apartment easily fits up to 6 adults, with a queen-size bed in the master bedroom, a full-size bed in the second bedroom and a comfortable sofa bed in the living room. Foodies who enjoy cooking their own meals will love the fully-equipped kitchen ÛÒ and delight in the gourmet grocery stores, as well as a variety of coffee shops and restaurants, located in the neighborhood within 15 minutes

Great  for 4 adults Or  a couple  with children. We are not a hotel and people love that.  Amazing location.  Subways: B, Q, 2, 3.  Atlantic terminal which is less than a 10 minute walk. name: large spacious room

Not far away is the  downtown metro tech center  and not to forget the newly built basketball multi million dollar stadium.

name: Fabulous Manhattan 1 bedroom apt
space: This apartment is fully decked out with everything you need for your New York stay: - Convenient to public transportation: 1 block from #1 train at 157th St; 4 blocks from C train at 155th St. You can reach Times Square in 20 minutes. - Tastefully furnished throughout - Fully stocked, eat-in kitchen - Bedroom has queen bed, armoire, closet - Living room sofa has a pull-out bed (queen size) for extra guests -Flat screen TV - Wifi - Grand piano - South facing on quiet street directly across from the American Academy of Arts and Letters - Elevator - Laundry facilities in the building - 24 hour doorman building - Historic building, residents are a mix of professionals, artists, Columbia professors, etc. *Click on "Read all reviews" to see most recent reviews; they appear out of order!*

name: Quality Safe Space w/ Deck Access

A new split unit AC was recently installed. Fresh bedding, towels and shampoo are available. The room faces the backyard, so you don't get much street noise.

name: Sunny spacious room close to transportation

Located in beautiful, safe Fort Greene, Brooklyn, you will be walking distance to the Brooklyn Academy of Music, Barclay's Center, parks (with free movies and concerts in the summer), restaurants, beer gardens, wine bars, groceries and shopping. On Saturdays you can find unique handmade and vintage wares at Brooklyn Flea,  just a 2-block walk, and farm-fresh produce at the green market just a 4-block walk. The apartment is a few short subway stops from the Brooklyn Botanical Garden, the Brooklyn Public Library, Prospect Park, Pratt Institute, Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute, Brooklyn Navy Yard, the Brooklyn Bridge and art galleries in DUMBO and LES. name: Your own floor (private) in prime Williamsburg!!
space: Fully furnished bedroom/floor in modern duplex (with your own private bathroom)! It's practically a separate apartment all to yourself with your own private garden ;) Your space: entire bottom floor of this duplex is yours - including your own entrance to the apartment itself. The room is secluded and quiet - with large sliding glass doors that open into a private patio/garden. Your private bathroom has an awesome shower head(!) and deep-soak jacuzzi tub surrounded by stone tiling. Cozy common living area is upstairs along with the kitchen, and bedroom where the owner resides. This apartment is a great deal - practically a separate unit downstairs for the price of a share and quieter than most apartments in NYC. Located in the very heart of Williamsburg - just 2 blocks from the L train (Bedford stop) and within walking distance to great restaurants, bars and music venues, The L Train crosses every line in Manhattan for quick, easy access to all of New York City!

name: Bright and Spacious Manhattan

This is a two bedroom with a large living room. It is a fourth floor walk-up. Washer/dryer inside apartment. I am happy to answer any questions you may have and look forward to hearing from you.

name: Beautiful, Quiet, Spacious 1BR - UWS by parks

If you are a musician, you can even tickle the piano keys in your spare time! We prefer a one-week stay minimum. We ask for a cleaning fee. We will be happy to provide with sheets, towels and basic supplies.

space: This apartment is a sanctuary. I keep it clean, tidy; it's quiet and calm. In the summer, the apartment has a lovely breeze coming from the east river, in the winter it's cozy and warmed by central heating system. It's on the top floor the light and view of the New York skyline is magnificent. It is shared with one person only and it's for a single guest only.

name: Beautiful Park Slope 2 bedroom
space: Stay in a cozy treetop retreat in one of Brooklyn's most beautiful neighborhoods!  The apartment his big windows with lots of light, two decorative fireplaces, brick walls, queen-size bed, views of Manhattan, plants, well-appointed kitchen with dishwasher, stainless steel appliances, SodaStream, plenty of counter space, A/C in all rooms, consistent heat in winter, air purifier, laundry in basement, in a very nice building with newly renovated common areas. And from inside the apartment you can sit on the couch as you see the lights of lower Manhattan twinkle in the distance - there are views all the way from the Freedom Tower to midtown!  Plus, no nosy neighbors can see i

name: Sweet n' Spectacular PARK SLOPE!
space: Our apartment is on the fifth floor of an elevator building in leafy, Brownstone-clad Park Slope, Brooklyn.  Due to how high up we are in the building, it sports a beautiful view of NYC.  We like to describe the look of the neighborhood as akin to the Upper West Side in Manhattan but on a gentle incline and in a different borough : )   It's quite safe in our opinion and is within spitting distance of dozens of restaurants, bars, cafes and the F, G and R train lines (10-15 minutes from Downtown Manhattan), several gyms and a post office.  It's about 3 blocks from Prospect Park and an easy walk to the Brooklyn Academy of Music (BAM) which hosts international cutting edge performances, the Brooklyn Museum, the Botanical Garden, the brand new Barclays Center, the Brooklyn Public Library, gorgeous Greenwood Cemetery (final resting places of Jean-Michel Basquiat, Leonard Bernstein and Louis Comfort Tiffany) and some really great neighborhoods (Fort Greene, Carroll Gardens, Boerum Hill, etc.)

name: Upper East Side LG BR in 2 BR apt.

(please note I have 46 reviews in total between the large bedroom and the small from this same apt. so please be sure to read all of my fantastic reviews) This room is very large, with a queen size bed that is like sleeping on a cloud.  It super spacious, has a desk and chair if you need to work.  The fire escape is made into a cute area with lights and plants, so if you smoke or just want to relax with glass of wine, you will adore this make-shift outside space.  This room has its own closet, a small chest of drawers and a lot of space to leave and organize your personal belongings.   This bedroom is right off the living room and has glass pocket doors.  But please dont let that deter you from loving the space.  The doors have a black-out curtain that slides right over the glass and you are in perfect privacy.  See photos.  This makes the room very unique. It is perfect for 1 or 2 people.   No

name: Beautiful Fresh Studio for Sublet
space: Studio apartment for rent in one of Brooklyn's hottest neighborhoods: Fort Greene / Clinton Hill. The apartment can comfortably sleep 2 people in two full-sized beds (one is a futon).  The apartment is equipped with all the comforts you might desire. You won't feel like you are staying in another person's 'space'. It's immaculately clean, efficiently designed, and functional. Rebekah and Lexa (= Bexa) are bffs who've lived here for 5 years. Rebekah used to live upstairs, but sleeps mostly with her bf in Manhattan now. She keeps this apt as an office / guesthouse / bff sleepover palace.

name: Escape to our Great Beach Getaway
space: Air conditioning recently added! The large, clean one-bedroom apartment is furnished with a full-size pull out bed, a queen-size bed, all linens, and kitchen needs. Parking is extremely easy on the street. There is a backyard to lock up any bikes or kayaks.  We are across the street from Jamaica Bay, so the view is beautiful. We are 8 blocks from Rockaway Beach, with its clean beaches, lively surfing community, and active night life. Since we are across the Bay from JFK airport, occasionally airplane noise can get a bit loud. Free WiFi is included with the rental. You can go kayaking (not provided, sorry) or take a swim in Jamaica Bay, or enjoy a beautiful bike ride along the Rockaway Boardwalk. The neighborhood is quiet, with restaurants just a 10-minute drive away, or if you're not driving, there are places to eat on the Boardwalk. There's the famous Rockaway Taco, the new brick oven pizzeria, or the new boardwalk restaurant where you can get a delicious PoBoy sandwich. If you prefer

There is a large couch that can be used as a bed as well, and a twin air mattress if necessary.  I love my place and you will too.   If you have any questions feel free to send me a note.

The Apt has wifi access and includes all utilities. The loft is on the 4th floor of a quiet building with a lovely common garden patio. name: PRIVATE ROOM in HELL'S KITCHEN, NYC

Vibrant, safe and hip with anything you need, from bars, restaurants, coffee shops, clubs, art galleries to laundromats and 24 hour groceries. The apt is located on the 5th floor of a historic pre-War building. It is fully furnished with A/C and WIFI. It has one bedroom, a living room and an eat-in kitchen. It's very airy, full of light and relaxing and you will love to spend some cozy time in there after the whole day around the City.

name: Beautiful Modern Apt in Brooklyn
space: Our guest apartment is on the top floor of our recently renovated townhouse in the Prospect Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.  A separate entrance leads to the 600 sf apartment that has a loft-like feel and open floor plan with a kitchen/living room area and a bedroom area. The spacious bedroom has a queen size bed and a dresser. The living room couch can turn into a comfortable double bed as well. The two (yes 2!) bathrooms have both a shower and toilet.  The design and furniture are modern with a focus on comfort and usability. Up to 4 people can comfortably sleep in the apartment. Modern luxury with all new appliances and Wi-Fi. The kitchen is fully furnished with all the basics. It has a stainless steal 4 top gas cooking range /oven and a microwave. We will keep a French Press and fresh coffee on the shelf for you! name: Comfortable 1 Bedroom in Greenpoint
space: Charming one bedroom floor-through apartment located in a two-family townhouse, on a tree-lined, landmark block in historic Greenpoint, Brooklyn. Recently voted "Best Block to live on in the Metropolitan Area" by New York Magazine. This tranquil neighborhood is filled with wonderful parks, restaurants, book shops, and all you'll need for a wonderful stay in New York. Walking distance to Williamsburg, currently one of New York's hippest neighborhoods, with its galleries, boutiques, bars, and restaurants. There's a health food grocery store on the corner and the subway to Manhattan a block away. Manhattan's East River Ferry is just 2 blocks away. With public transportation, you are 10 minutes from Midtown.  Our one bedroom apartment has been recently renovated with many original details and is clean and comfortable.

name: Zen Room in NYC close to Columbia U

Breakfast is self-serve: toast, jam, cereal, coffee and many choices of tea. You are welcomed to use the kitchen for minor meal prep and fridge storage, just keep it tidy and we prefer that you don't cook meat in the apartment.  We work from home. We're a non-smoking, non-drinking and no drugs house. Meditation and dance junkies welcomed! We ask that you don't wear shoes inside the apartment and prefer that you don't cook meat in the house, but it is fine if you order or bring pre-made non-vegetarian meals or make sandwiches. Just be conscientious and tidy with your meal prep and storing in the fridge. Ideal for students (Columbia U or City Co

name: Cozy Brooklyn "Treehouse" Apartment

They just opened and the owners know so much about wine and just lovely people; they always give me excellent recommendations to go with dinner.   If you're looking for a fabulous, but well-priced brunch, stop by Maggie Brown on Myrtle, just past Washington Ave. Cozy atmosphere and delicious food. name: Williamsburg Artist Loft with kids room and piano
space: Our home is a 1200 square foot loft in the heart of Williamsburg Brooklyn. We're a 7 min walk to the Bedford Ave L train which is one stop from Manhattan, but you will find it hard to leave the 'burg' with it's incredible restaurant/food culture, markets, boutique and grass root stores, and incredible coffee. Our street has the best chocolate in brooklyn in Mast brothers chocolate, great beer garden with live music in Radegast, amazing brunch in Egg and cosy coffee food spot Gotan. Our building has below it an incredible gourmet corner store where you can get organic milk/eggs, the best bread baked at Robertas and Balthazar, cheese from NY and abroad and even vegemite if you're an Aussie like us!   Nearby you have the Nitehawk cinema, blue bottle coffee, toby's estate. Uber's are a plenty if you want a ride into Manhattan and you can generally flag yellow cabs at the end of our street.  Our home has been custom built by us, with huge 'chef' kitchen with espresso machine and kitchen Aid

name: Adorable 1 Bedroom

name: Beautiful Bedroom in Brooklyn

The beautiful Fort Greene Park is only several blocks away. There are also many restaurants and bars in the neighborhood, many of which are located on DeKalb Ave and Myrtle Ave and the little Lafayette Ave/ Fulton Ave. triangle. name: Cozy 1BD Manhattan close Central Pk

name: Ultimate Bachelor Pad/Best Location
space: Fully renovated studio apartment on 56th and 9th, minutes from Columbus Circle, Central Park, and the Hudson River. The ultimate bachelor pad, perfect size for a couple on vacation, perfect base. Taxis on the corner 24 hours a day, A/C/E/1/2/3 Trains 3 minutes away. Video Intercom, double glazed windows, Strong air conditioning, cool fire escape balcony, awesome super leafy back garden, 3D flatscreen Smart TV with Netflix, very safe area, right at the top of Hells Kitchen but far enough away from the bars so it's peaceful. The Central Park horse and carts come up the street early in the morning so if you're awake you can hear them clopping which is hilarious given you're in a very busy and happening part of Manhattan. There is a 24 hour deli RIGHT ACROSS THE ROAD which is amazing. Also a late night Psychic... name: NYC/Chelsea-very spacious 1 bdr apt
space: Sunny and extremely spacious One-Bedroom apartment in the heat of the city (Chelsea / Meatpacking District / Greenwich Village). Great spot in Chelsea (15th Street / 7AVE), very spacious one bedroom apartment with about 750 sq ft, brand new bathroom, tons of closet space, elevator, sound system, 42" flatscreen TV, high-speed internet (up to 75Mbit/sec) and 125 TV chanels plus Netflix via Apple TV. It has tons of windows and it's very bright.  I've a few friends living in the building in case something would be needed. All people in the building are very friendly and mostly quiet. Not the right apartment if you want to celebrate a party :) Absolutely no smoker apartment and sorry, no pets, no kids.

name: Greenwich Village Skylit 1BR +deck!
space: This top-floor, floor-thru apartment in a brownstone dating from the 1840's is located on historic 11th Street in Manhattan's Greenwich Village, between 5th and 6th Avenues.    Best described as a small country house in the city, the  apartment has 7 skylights, one working and one cosmetic fireplace, built in bookshelves, and, in addition to a generous living and dining areas,  a 300 square foot roof deck with grill that overlooks the block's central garden and can seat 10 for dinner.  The abundant windows, skylights, and fireplaces make this a perfect place to enjoy summer, fall, winter or spring in the VIllage.    The apartment is furnished with a mix of American antiques and modern furniture, with a smattering of contemporary art, and is situated on one of the most central, charming blocks in the Village:  4 blocks from both Unions Square (with its abundant farmer's market)! and  Washington Square, across the street from the New School, adjacent to many NYU facilities, and a short w

name: Williamsburg Peace for the Solo Traveler
space: Sunlit open kitchen, comfortable living room area, meditation/yoga studio, and large bathroom.  A very peaceful and creative vibe in this residence.  Perfect for a traveling artist or someone looking to make Brooklyn home sweet home. 2 bedrooms with Queen beds - renting just one bedroom, I live in the other. Apt is located at the 2nd stop in Brooklyn from Manhattan (10 minutes from Union Square) and there is a grocery store across the street. Laundry is available on the same block.  There are many great restaurants, bars, and parks nearby.  Wireless is available.   Neighborhood is young, hip, creative, and a mix of families and singles.  Events are happening nearby - the waterfront is close as are concerts, flea markets, boutiques, yoga studios, coffee shops, cinema and art spaces. The L & G trains are nearby - the L takes you back to Manhattan and the G train goes through Brooklyn and Queens. name: Sunny Room in Creative Brooklyn!

name: Beautiful Chelsea 1 Bedroom!
space: This listing is for a beautiful 1 bedroom 1 bathroom 800 square foot condo in Chelsea/Meatpacking District. This is the hottest area in New York, and where all the fun is. The unit itself has a queen bed in the bedroom, as well as a sofa that can sleep additional guests.  The unit is also equipped with ultra-fast Verizon FIOS internet, at 75 mbps downstream and 35 mbps up.  This is the fastest internet available in the US, so you'll be able to work seamlessly.  There is a large, 10,000 sq. ft. sundeck just outside the apartment for outdoor leisure (see pictures).  The unit has full A/C and heat in both rooms, as well as an in-unit washer/dryer. name: Modern, Bright, Spacious 2 Bed, 2 Bath
space: 2 full bedrooms/2 full baths. The apartment is 1200 sq. ft and has a washer/ dryer and a 300 sq. foot terrace. Master bedroom is approx 13 x 18 and has a queen bed and en suite bath with glass shower & double sinks. Smaller bedroom is 11 x 13 and has a trundle bed (twin that has another twin beneath that pops up to full height). Hall bathroom features a large soaking tub and shower. Sonos speakers in living room and master. There are large flat-screen TVs both with cable and Roku (Netflix & Amazon Prime) in the master bedroom and living room. Wifi. Kitchen is fully equipped. Dining area seats 6.  The building is a 7 story condo built in 2008  with an elevator, small gym on the ground floor, additional common terrace with a BBQ and an enclosed landscaped backyard with seating.  Non-smokers only. Parking potentially available for additional fee.

name: The Perfect Brooklyn Heights Apt
space: Prime location just 10 min from Manhattan in the convenient and gorgeous neighbourhood of Brooklyn Heights.  2/3/4/5/R/A/C/F Subway trains a 5-8 min walk away.  A functional cosy light filled junior 1 bedroom furnished in great taste with everything you need, full bathroom, desk. Wireless Internet, AC in the summer. Trader Joes, Health food store, Cinaplex Theatre, Barnes and Noble, Barneys Co-Op and laundramat all around the block. A 5min walk to the Brooklyn Bridge Park and Promenade, and the ferry to Governors Island, not to mention a range of great restaurants and bars. This is truly the perfect space for 1 person or a couple visiting New York.  The bathroom has a full bath and shower...The bedroom has a raised bed so enjoy stepping up into the most comfortable bed ever! Large open closet with shelf and hanging space. The kitchen is compact, so understand it is a small fridge freezer, and a convection oven, slowcooker and an induction stovetop, so only light cooking is encouraged..

You'd also see a unique wooden dining table made of antique material from Brooklyn. More, there is a huge and private balcony that easily accommodates 5 people with a dining table and chairs looking into the beautiful communal garden that you can spend day&night. The apartment has dark hardwood floors all through, has a queen-size bed, lots of storage place, a big desk and comfortable sofa. It is right in the heart of Park Slope, Brooklyn - just some ft away from 5th Avenue where you can find many supermarkets, coffee shops, great bars and restaurants. It is located in the hip and safe neighborhood of Williamsburg, full of restaurants, bar, cafes and two blocks from the L train, 10 minutes from Manhattan. You will be sharing the common space with 2 other people: a photographer and a journalist.

Baths are framed by custom tiling, contemporary chrome fixtures and a frameless glass-enclosed shower with rain head and separate soaking tub. It is easy to relax and enjoy this exclusive view from the comfort of the stylish living room when the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building sit right in front of you or while lounging on the terrace. name: Spacious Room in Shared Apartment

Three blocks from the A, C, 1 trains at 168th street in Washington Heights. Also four blocks from Columbia Presbyterian Hospital. The George Washington Bridge to New Jersey is a couple of blocks away. Highbridge Park is around the corner. One of the most attractive parks in the city, Fort Tryon, as well as the Cloisters Museum, is just a five minute subway ride away. Many options for Dominican and Puerto Rican food in the neighborhood, as well as many other restaurant and bar options nine blocks up on 181st Street. If guests wish to cook, there is a grocery store on the end of the street.

name: Convenient, Central, Comfortable
space: Pleasant and well kept, modern studio apartment (350 sq feet) in the Spanish Harlem neighborhood of Manhattan. The building and apartment were recently renovated and remolded. name: Beautiful Designer's Loft in the Heart of Downtown
space: This quiet, warm, rustic two bedroom/solarium + loft duplex condo (sleeps 4) is located in Nolita, a charming, chic, and trendy neighborhood in Lower Manhattan.   Features: -Newly renovated bathroom in Carrara marble, clean and simple. -The living/dining room features 15ft ceilings, a reclaimed wood dining table suited for morning brunch or an elaborate dinner lit by a custom chandelier floating from above.  A small love seat converts this space into both a dining and living area.  -Master bedroom is on the 2nd floor, with loads of closet space, featuring a glass partition wall peering into the living room and a queen size bed on an oak bedframe.  TV in the room - Solarium/Bedroom is defined by a curved glass window resonating a vibrant light throughout the day.  If you love the sun, this is the room for you! One bedroom, w/ a Queen size, memory foam mattress. The Front Room gets plenty of daylight and is a great place to relax at the end or the beginning of the day.  Watch a movie, read a book. Kitchen with gas stove, kettle for the morning, fun cooking tools, pots and pans, etc. to make a meal...Enjoy. WiFi Internet, Air Conditioning, Heat, Quiet Street. Close to everything in Williamsburg that everyone else mentions on here...  Our building is home to creative 30-something's, we know and like all of our neighbors!  We love our apartment... We'd like to share it with you.

name: NYC Exposed-Brick Dream Spot!
space: Prime East Village location close to THREE different subway lines, near New York University. A great neighborhood filled with amazing fashion boutiques, restaurants, bars, culture, and entertainment. Live like a real New Yorker!!!   Jimi Hendrix once lived in this wonderful East Village walk-up building.  Accommodates up to 2 people.   Right in the heart of it all with large kitchen, bathroom with cast iron shower tub, and living room available. Private bedroom has a full-sized  bed. Living room has a queen-sized pull-out bed (for full apartment rental only, not during a share). Air conditioning in private room. Spacious spot and surprisingly quiet in the heart of it all. Cable and internet service. Please no smoking or use of illegal drugs.  Please notify of any additional guests... there will be an additional charge for extra people or queen sleeper in the living room.  This is a really delightful spot within a two block walk of the #6 Astor subway line, three blocks from 8th Street

name: Great house in Williamsburg
space: Williamsburg, currently one of New York's hippest neighborhoods, is an unlikely amalgam of small houses, warehouses, clubs, coffee shops (LOTS of coffee shops) galleries, new condominiums, dozens of restaurants, a wonderful book shop, bars, performance spaces, a world-class cheese shop, thrift stores, clothing boutiques, and looming remnants of the New York waterfront's industrial past.   Our apartment is on North 7th Street, two and a half blocks from the Bedford Ave stop on the L train, the first stop in Brooklyn and a 5-minute ride from Union Square.  It's a half-block from the East River State Park, which has summer concerts and a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline.  An esplanade runs south along the river. From a landing at North 6th Street thereÛªs ferry service to various stops in Manhattan and Brooklyn. There's a running track in nearby McCarren Park and a bike path along Kent Avenue. At the end of our block, every weekend between April and November, there's Smorgasburg:

name: Feb/March/April $100 or less a night!

One block away from the library, laundry mat, grocery store, cross town and uptown bus, duane reade (pharmecy) and post office. Nearest subway is the 6 train which is four blocks away. There is also a nice couch and room on the floor if anyone wanted to camp out. I have had up to 5 people staying my place at one time. name: Sunny Sanctuary in Crown Heights
space: Welcome to Brooklyn! The room is in a spacious, sunny top-floor apartment overlooking the beautiful thoroughfare Eastern Parkway, in the bustling, culturally diverse neighborhood of Crown Heights in central Brooklyn. The kitchen is well-stocked for those who love to cook. Here are the vital stats: -Beautiful block near Lincoln Terrace Park, Prospect Park, Brooklyn Botanical Garden, Weeksville Cultural Center, Brooklyn Museum, and plenty of supermarkets, shops, banks, bars, bike lanes and restaurants. -Diverse, up-and-coming neighborhood.  -Lots of families and ambient sounds of the city. -Nearest laundromat one block away. -Well-lit -Hardwood floors -Convenient transportation: 3 local / 4 express trains, about a seven minute walk to the station -Five train stops to downtown Manhattan -Elevator in the building. It's not the most attractive elevator, but it works.

name: 1 BR Apartment near Prospect Park!
space: Hello!  This lovely apartment is located in Prospect/Crown Heights, just steps from Prospect Park, the Brooklyn Library, Brooklyn Museum, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, and plenty of great coffee shops, restaurants and bars on Franklin Avenue! The apartment is a large one-bedroom on the fourth (top) floor of the building.  It faces northwest, and has a great view of the Manhatten skyline.  There is one large bedroom that sleeps two and I have an aerobed, which can sleep two more in the large living room.  The kitchen is large enough to work comfortably in, and has a counter/breakfast bar and stool.  The bathroom is new and has a full bathtub and shower.  The building is a medium-sized apartment building, and is quiet and respectful. The apartment is just steps from the subway, with access to the 2/3 and 4/5.   These will take you into Manhatten and up the west (2/3) or east (4/5) side.  ItÛªs a quick 25 minutes into downtown.  These two trains also stop at Atlantic Ave/Pacific Street here in

name: Brooklyn Carriage House
space: Come stay in our quirky little carriage house in Prospect Heights. The house is set off the street in a former stable and features an open floor plan on both stories, with a large kitchen/living room on the first floor, and a loft-like master BR on the second floor. We list this as a 2BR because there is a small child's BR off the master BR. Shared garden space. Creamy terracotta tiled floor. Oriental rugs. Antique movie posters. Tasteful taxidermy. You would never know that it's there from the street. Our place sits behind a two-story former pickle factory. The entrance is through a workshop hallway. When you walk through the front building and pop out the double doors into the garden you'll feel like you're entering in another world. (South of France? Narnia?) Prospect Heights is a great neighborhood. We are close to all the restaurants on Vanderbilt Ave, and within walking distance of Prospect Park, Park Slope and Fort Greene.  Feel free to call or text, and I can answer any questio

name: Big Sunny Williamsburg 14ft Ceilings w Half Bath

No personal items stored in room. Ready for you to make yourself at home. Convenient pleasant layout.  Sunlight all day. The living room is Very large with Large skylight. The apartment and rooms are kept very clean and uncluttered. House cleaner comes once per month included in rent. Many people come to Williamsburg on weekends from Manhattan.  There are public bikes / lanes, riverfront parks with views of lower manhattan; a ferry to the city for commute, or, fun.  Farmers markets in all the parks including the riverfront.  Flea markets, galleries galore.  Great river air flow, bike paths... People watching etc. A fantastic variety of things to do, places to eat and events to enjoy. It's where manhattan goes on the weekend!  The subway is convenient. The L and G lines are ea

name: Historic Brownstone Parlor & Garden

Closest subway stop is a half a block walk to the Grand station B and D trains which will take you quickly to both midtown and Brooklyn. Chinatown's out door markets are right outside. Laundromat is a block away. Bodegas are open late.  I work in the art world and have a nice collection of books and art to keep you occupied while resting. A comfortable and convenient stay awaits you.

name: STYLISH Modern  UWS One-Bedroom
space: The apartment has plenty of natural light as well as the option to block it: there are blackout blinds in the bedroom and a combination of  blinds and curtains in the living room. The bedroom is large and has a comfortable QUEEN size bed. There is an ENTIRE CLOSET, drawer space as well as a garment rack to hang clothes with plenty of  hangers. The apartment has TWO AIR CONDITIONERS ( one in every room )  and a dishwasher.  There is WIRELESS internet, cable TV, and laundry in the building.   The apartment can accommodate up to three people. The third person can sleep on the sofa in the living room.   The kitchen is fully equipped, There is an electric kettle, a coffee-maker,  a microwave, and a dishwasher in the kitchen.  The bathroom is spacious and has a bath tub. The apartment has everything you need, including towels,  hair-dryer, iron and an IPOD/IPHONE  dock. ***Also, there is plenty of towels and other supplies, and i am sorry that the guest was not able to locate them or ask me.

name: Cute Cobble Hill
space: This two bedroom is really a 1.5 but the .5 is a child's room. So itÛªs ideal for a couple with a kids. It has two rooms with doors so your children can sleep while you stay up. Only a couple of blocks from the F and G trains and a few more to the A. Perfect place if you're visiting friends or family in Carroll Gardens, Bourem Hill, Cobble Hill, Brooklyn Heights, Park Slope or Gowanus. This top floor apartment has unique private use of the stoop - a great place to hang out and enjoy the neighborhood.

name: COMFY-CUTE-N-CLEAN APT in WBURG
space: This is a great apartment in one of NYC's best neighborhoods. THE APARTMENT: The apartment is a 2 bedroom, 1.5 bath. The two bedrooms are at opposite sides of the apartment, providing a great deal of privacy. The front room is the one for rent and is the larger of the two bedrooms in the apt. It has a queen sized bed, flat screen tv and cable.  Fully renovated apartment features a kitchen with all new appliances, including dishwasher. We are both avid cooks so the kitchen and pantry is stocked with anything you might need to cook up a storm if you wish to. The common area has a very comfy couch, as well as extra seating and a small vintage dinette. There is also a large flat screen TV, full cable, WIFI, blue ray player, and bar area. The apartment is about a 5 minute walk to the Graham Avenue stop off the L train and it is half a block from Cooper Park. The area is great filled with bars, grocery stores, boutique, restaurants, cafes, thrift and vintage stores, etc....

name: East Village perch!
space: Very comfortable east village one bedroom in NYC with space, light, and three quirks :)  Living room has exposed brick, big flat screen tv, amazing sound system, and a view of the top of the empire state building. Great kitchen for cooking, and a very big bedroom. Living room couch can sleep a person as well, so it would suit one, two, or three people. Apartment has cable with HBO, wifi, a/c, and all you'll need....ok, the quirks:  1) It comes with a cat -- he's not yet two, playful, curious, funny. He'll need food and water  2) There's lots of plants. I'd ask you to water them, which should take about ten minutes/week total  3) There's a bathroom in the apartment with shower, tub, sink, but because it's an old building, the toilet -- it's private, it locks, no one else can use it -- is seven feet down the hall, a quirk of the plumbing and the case with half the apartments in the building. To be clear -- the toilet is private, no one else can use it, it has a lock, it is NOT shared....

name: Big Room in Williamsburg Loft
space: Stay at our beautiful, newly renovated 1500 sq. ft. abode. We live near the Graham L stop in Williamsburg, in this 120 year old former candle factory, ensconced within an incredibly charming and quiet old-school Italian neighborhood, but only a couple blocks from some of the best bars, restaurants, loft parties, and music venues this neighborhood has to offer. Your room will be 220 sqft, with a queen sized bed, a nightstand, and a desk. The apartment has central air and heating, so its always a comfortable retreat from the street. There is plenty of storage space for your luggage. You'll also have access to our kitchen, washer and dryer, wifi, and enormous living room with a TV (all the movie channels included). There are 2 other guys who live in the other bedrooms. On the rare occasion they are around, they make great company and eager neighborhood guides. The L train is a 2 minute walk. Grand Street bars are about a 4 minute walk. Great food starts around the corner and stretches as

Laundry facility in basement, but I've never given guests the basement key.  I've always

name: Beautiful apartment off 5th Avenue
space: Stunning one bedroom apartment in the heart of Greenwich village, 2 minutes walk to 5th avenue. 16th floor apartment with amazing views over New York. Centrally located to shops, union square, west village and all major subways. Apartment comes with gym in the basement and huge roof terrace that looks over the city. All mods cons in the apartment including wifi, and cable. This is our home and the building is a luxury building so no wild parties or young groups.

name: Spacious-Sunny NYC Apartment(2BDR)
space: Welcome to my home ! Enjoy your NYC getaway at a spacious, sunny, 2 bedroom apt in Washington Heights! (I am constantly updating my calendar about 6 months ahead, so please check back to see if more or less is open!) *** I live in a quiet, well surveilled rental building with great neighbors, so the 3 person rule is pretty firm, if you are looking to book for 2 and then bring friends along or have more people stay, this is not the place for that I am sorry! Also, I don't feel comfortable to have young children or babies in the apt because it is not child proofed. I hope you understand! Lastly, while check in and check out times are flexible, we need to coordinate this when booking so I can figure out the best way to work around your schedule! *** *2BDR* *spacious, lots of light, quiet, safe* *5th floor apt w/elevator and laundry in building* *bedroom #1 is a queen size bed with a Tempur-Pedic mattress* *bedroom #2 is a pull-out sofa equipped with an auto-inflatable/deflatable pull-out

name: A Simple Upper West Side Pad
space: This one bedroom on the Upper West Side of NYC is in the heart of the action. The place has a king size bed, kitchen, living/dining area and there is even an elevator.  You have internet access that is wireless or with a plug in, whatever you prefer.     The neighborhood is full of more restaurants, clubs, bars, and other places than you could ever see in one visit. You are in the middle of 3 train lines as well as some local buses as well.     I pride myself on giving you a great experience. So while you are here, if you need any extra help, just ask!!     This is a nice and basic place that will be relaxing and not complicated. You can do all that you want and get to anywhere in the city in under 30 minutes most times. You can even buy an unlimited metro card that allows to you to ride the train and the bus at will. Lastly, this apartment is a five minute walk to Central Park!!    There will be a $20 let in fee for guests arriving after 8 pm and $40 after 10 pm.

name: Jacuzzi Suite, Minutes to Times Sq.
space: General info and location: This cozy and bright room is located in Long Island City - Queens, an area across the river from midtown Manhattan.    We are close to the Queens MOMA PS1 museum, which also hosts outdoor dance parties on Saturdays in the summer. We are five minutes from a Vernon Ave, which has many restaurants for you to enjoy. There are also many places near the house, if you just need to pop out for a quick meal. There is a Thai restaurant, and a 24-hour diner across the street where the food is decent, and uniquely New York! The room: The room is quite big and feels like a private studio with its own private bathroom, jacuzzi tub and semi-private entrance.  It has recently been renovated and painted so everything is in great condition.  It is fully furnished with a KING size bed, and a desk for your computer with a comfortable chair to rest your laurels.  WeÛªve also set up a kitchenette complete with mini-fridge, microwave, toaster and basic dish ware. There is also a fre

name: 1-Bd Apt in PRIME Soho - NYC- July
space: One-bedroom apartment in prime Soho location (Sullivan and Prince) for short-term stay.  Be close to the action at this spacious one-bedroom Soho apartment.  Steps to some of the best  restaurants and shopping in New York City such as The Dutch, Blue Ribbon Sushi, Dos Caminos, and all the exclusive boutique/designer stores in the area.  Short walk to the West Village, Tribeca, Greenwich Village and the Hudson River.  Easily accessible by subway - very close  to the B/D/F/M, C/E, N/R, and 6 subway lines. - 1-bedroom with queen size bed - separate living space - dressing area - bathroom with shower and tub - air conditioned - Flat screen TV, DVD and wifi - kitchen with full appliances (dishwasher included) Please let me know if you're interested!

name: Luxury 1Bed with Central Park Views
space: LUXURY ONE BEDROOM WITH CENTRAL PARK-FACING VIEW (750 sq. ft) DETAILS:  Designer-decorated luxury one bedroom features queen-sized bed with premium mattress, feather-filled pillows and modern furniture and lighting. Full-sized sleeper sofa, located in the living room, sleeps two people. This quiet Upper West Side apartment is located on a high floor overlooking Central Park with floor to ceiling windows and 11' ceilings. LOCATION: The Upper West Side is an upscale, primarily residential area home to New YorK City's cultural (Metropolitan opera, Juilliard school of dance, drama & music), intellectual hub (Columbia university) and artistic workers (Lincoln center). Great atmosphere and so many great restaurants, wine bars and coffee shops. Not to mention the night life...The UWS is a hip yet mature place to be. It is really changing with the addition of all the new development condos going up, this place is a meca of ultra luxury super high end condos. UWS is also known for landmark buil

name: NYC With View-Village!
space: Welcome to New York City! I love my little apartment and know you will too!  Take a look at my home in the heart of one of the most desirable  neighborhoods in all of Manhattan - Greenwich Village. My studio apartment is in a pre-war building and it is a 4th floor walk-up (3 flights of stairs..wide staircase, makes carrying luggage easy). Platform bed with full mattress (purchased in June 2012)..kitchenette, small bathroom with shower & tub.  All the standard accommodations are included: fresh bedding and towels. There are wood floors, a wall unit AC, 40" tv on a swivel wall mount, and wi-fi. WINTER GUESTS:  The apartment has steam heating that is run by the building..the apartment is very warm when it is very cold outside.  Bedding is a down comforter with kint blanket...very warm and cozy! The apartment is southern facing which means it is drenched in natural light.  Different from most studios with just 1 window, my home has 4 big windows and has its own fire escape that you can sit

name: Huge factory loft, prime location
space: A sprawling, wide open studio is in a super artsy, well maintained, secure building in the epicenter of Williamsburg. This old factory loft has tons of character, 12 foot soaring ceilings, concrete floors, lots of light from a wall of windows with a view of the open sky (and optional black out curtains for sleeping in).  The space is divided sensibly with a dining area off an ample kitchen and a bedroom/little office overlooking living room with a couch and a day bed for additional sleeping bodies. The bathroom is also quite sizable with good guest closet space adjacent.  Overall a peaceful, well stocked and smartly designed haven for the culturally curious homebody,

name: bedroom in front  prospect park sw (private)
space: Nice bedroom in  front of prospect park (South  West)  safe and residential , close to public  transportation  in  an excellent neighborhood Subway 2 blocks away F and G train  (ft. Hamilton stop) just 5 mins walking   to  the new ice skating Fully furnished , including  utilities, with everything provided : high speed wireless internet, TV, Iron, Board, hair dryer, fresh  linen and Towels.  Room has a queen bed with a closet , dresser, mirror  and chandelier  Very sunny with two windows, hard wood floor  nearby There are  restaurants, shops, grocery stores  Fully equipped eat in kitchen laundry machine also available  You must be clean, responsible quiet non-smoker,  (gay-friendly)  bathroom and kitchen to share Im  a  fashion  designer  and    work   full time

name: Your home in new york city
space: Let us host you in our home! We have a cozy room with A/C available in our apartment in Upper Manhattan. We're 20 min. away from Times Square, connected very conveniently by lines 1, C.  We provide clean sheets, blankets and towels or you can bring you own. You can also use our iron and hair dryer.  We would be happy to help make your time in NYC as fun as possible, we can help with advice on places to visit and you will always find a magazine full of events to enjoy during the time you spend in NYC. We are located "C" tren 2 blocks from 163 St  and "1" tren 3 blocks from 157 st  subway stop, in Washington Heighs. Our neighborhood is a colorful mix, like the rest of the city,  We wait for you, come and share with us your trip to NYC! We speak Spanish and English fluently At your arrival $ 20 dollars cash for cleaning fee $ 15 dollars cash for internet ( Wi-fi ) fee if you are going to use it for the time you staying us  you will have your own keys at your arrival

name: Charming Sunny W. Village Apt.
space: Charming, sunny, West Village studio apartment. Location, Location, Location!! Great neighborhood.  Near the A,C, E, 1, 2, & 3 trains. Short walk to the High Line, Meatpacking District, and Hudson River Park. A/C. No smoking, no pets. Wireless internet access, Murphy bed, Feng Shui principles.  Deposit and references required. Please send more information about yourself and let me know ASAP if you are interested.

name: Union Square/ East Village Fabulous
space: Fabulous sunny, airy, bright alcove one bedroom with all the works. Comfy, cheerful, super clean, quiet, cozy and funky. Fully furnished. Doorman, safe, secure and spacious. Super comfy QUEEN size bed. Brand new floors, dishwasher and refrigerator. ULTRA CONVENIENT-1/2 block from the subway. Three short blocks from Union Square. Walkable to Soho_Noho_Greenwich Village_Gramercy Park_Flatiron _Chelsea_Lower East Side. Bohemian neighborhood-famous for it's downtown cafes, boutiques, art, music. Taxi's everywhere down here. CitiBike's too. Cable TV. Great Heating, Full Bathroom. Full Kitchen, Powerful Hot Shower. Excellent heating and Air-Conditioning. Amazing Views. Half a block from several bus lines. Three short blocks from Union Square and a plethora of affordable superb restaurants in walking distance. More bars per capita in this neighborhood than anywhere in the world. Full view of The Empire State Building-where you can count the flashbulbs to lull you asleep!-Absolutely Fabulous!

name: Luxury apartment-Flatiron district
space: Location:  Named for the Flatiron BuildingÛÓthe gorgeous 1902 skyscraper whose Beaux-Arts three-facade design conspicuously presides over the intersection of Fifth Avenue and Broadway. The apartment is located across from the Flatiron building, Madison Square Park, and Mario Batali's Eataly. The apartment is also very close to the Empire State building, and you have a fantastic view from the apt balcony and bedroom as well. You'll also be within walking distance of Union Square, Washington Square Park, Gramercy and the wonderful shops on 5th Avenue. Contemporary restaurants and lounges are also in abundance Nearest subway lines include the 4, 5, 6, or N, Q, R, which are within one block of the apartmentÛªs location and no subway around the city will take you more than 20 mins to arrive.  Amenities:  Bedroom:  Queen size bed , custom closet, 3 sectional window with blinds. Living room:  Free wireless internet throughout the apartment. Very comfortable and high quality leather sofa, Flat s

name: Beautiful, bright room w/priv bath
space: Top floor, large private bedroom in a brand new two bedroom 1200 sqft duplex apartment in an great section of Bushwick, Brooklyn. The windows of the bedroom look out onto a plant filled terrace. A private bathroom adjoins the bedroom. The apartment has washer/dryer, full galley kitchen, central heat and AC, wifi internet, and a 250 sqft private terrace with views of Manhattan.  It is an elevator building with small gym in the basement. The neighborhood is dynamic and colorful with a great mix of shops, restaurants and bars and 20 minute subway ride to Union Square in Manhattan. It is also a block away from green and beautiful Maria Hernandez park.

name: Convenient to Manhattan
space: This is an elevator condo building with an evening doorman.   The unit is a spacious studio with a seperate kitchen.Laundry on premises for your convenience. Steps to  transportation 25-30 min to downtown manhattan on a beautiful ferry free ferry ride.  It is located near Silver Lake Park.  and there is also a pool for use during warm months.  There is a Deli half a block away for your immediate needs.

name: NOLITA, Home Sweet Home in NYC
space: Our cozy apartment is just right for a couple or or small family (we can provide a travel crib and or aerobed upon request). -Great window light -Queen Bedroom (with air conditioning) -Full bathroom (tub and shower) -Full kitchen (equipped with stove, oven, microwave, cooking and baking ware, dinnerware, glassware, cutlery, wine glasses, teapot and moka coffee maker), -Living room (with big screen TV, access to movies, books, children's books, puzzels, toys, games, WiFi Internet, and a small writing desk) -Linens provided -Most importantly I keep a very clean home. Every guest will hopefully feel quite at home within our accommodations. You'll be greeted with a welcome gift bag, including NYC Maps, snacks and a little something special to make your stay more comfortable.  Our recommended list of all the wonderful things you could do and how to get there will be waiting for you including where the closest parking, laundromat and grocery store is and where to get your morning cup of coff

name: Small rooftop studio apartment
space: This is a cozy little studio (second floor) with private access to a rooftop gardern. It has a newly renovated bathroom, a queen-size bed ,a fridge, a microwave oven, and a coffee machine. It has air conditioning, cable TV and wifi iron and iron board. It is also located on the 3rd floor and there is no elevator.  It's one minute away from the C-line, 10 minitues away from (email hidden)ere are coffee shops, laundries and several restaurants in this lovely brownstone area. The apartment is close to several parks, the Children's museum and other popular parts of Brooklyn such as Fort Greene, Clinton Hill, etc.  Guests will have clean sheets and towels when they first check-in and lots of recommendations for places to eat, have coffee, etc. The area is filled with plenty of restaurants and cafes or you can take the subway(C Train ) which is a half a block away from studio and only minutes away from Times Square

name: Historic & Vibrant Heart of the EV
space: The apartment is located on the second floor of a beautiful, red brick, pre-war building - a rustic, casual, open-spaced flat. It's a 2-bedroom apartment, with a private bedroom for rent. East 7th street is famous for its local flair - on just our single block are restaurants like Caracas, Desnuda and Pylos; bars like the Ruffian and Lover's of Today; dessert joints like Butterlane Cupcakes and the Big Gay Ice Cream Shop; and cafes like AbraÌ¤o and Van Leeuwen's. We've tried them all and we have plenty of insider tips to make sure you get the most of your stay! And finally, you're in good hands! Count on being treated to off-the-beaten-path recommendations... like the original 1920's prohibition-era speakeasy down a hidden alleyway. The basics: - Full bed in your private room - Single shared bathroom - Comfortable living room and dining room  - Fully equipped kitchen Additionally: - A free local sim card for unlimited talk, text and data for our international guests (please no internati

name: 1-BDRM, Good Light, Fire-Escape, AC
space: The apartment is a short walk to Vanderbilt Ave and a short walk to Franklin Ave.  There are vintage shops, nice cocktail bars, the best ramen in the city, a great ice-cream shop, and overall a nice and easy, but lively vibe.   The apartment has a juicer, a french press, the kitchen is nice for cooking, and there's a radio atop the fridge for iPod listening, or NPR, or local radio.  Feel free to message me with any questions. Thanks!

name: Apt Near Central Park & Columbia!
space: UPDATE - Bedroom #1 is available October 22 to October 24 for up to (2) guests. Please inquire, look forward to hosting - cheers! The apartment has 3 bedrooms but not all bedrooms may be available, please see above for availability. Bedroom #1: Is a normal room with a full/double bed, can sleep 2 people. Bedroom #2: The largest room sleeps up to 2 people, 1 in a twin bed and if needed, 1 on a fold out bed Bedroom #3: Not available to book at this time - Parking: Free on-street parking in the neighborhood, no meters! - Top floor & elevator (quiet, no apartment above us) - Full kitchen with all the necessities  - 40inch Sony HDTV with DVD player - Wii Game System and Apple TV with access to Netflix, HuluPlus, Amazon Prime and HBO - Large free public pool 10 minute walk from apartment in heart on Central Park, open daily (June to August) 10am-7pm - NYC Tour book and subway maps to use at your disposal Please feel free to reach out if you have any further questions - thank you!

name: Beautiful 4BR/4BA Home, Staten Island, NY City.
space: "Fantastic base from which to explore Manhattan!!Û Location wise It is close to Manhattan, New Jersey and Brooklyn. Very close to the famous Jersey Gardens Outlet Mall in NJ.  This four bedroom private house is perfect for a family or several couples. You can start your vacation right away, all the beds are made and bath towels are provided for you. Large Gas BBQ grill on the outside deck. This vacation rental home has Four bedrooms, Three full baths, and One half bath. Beds: 1 King, 3 Queen, 1 tween, and 1 fold out for 2 people. Shampoo, soap..etc, spices, oil, coffee, coffee filters, tea .... all provided.

name: East Village 1 Bedroom Apartment
space: Stay in a beautifully renovated 1 Bedroom Apartment at the intersection of the East Village and the Lower East Side.  I'm a working artist who travels from time to time for work.  I'll be gone for roughly three weeks in September and would love to rent out my apartment.  The longer the stay the better, as I don't really want to turn my home into a new-day-new-guest operation.  Please inquire about a discount for a stay upwards of two weeks.  Any questions, feel free to ask - I have all sorts of things such as art books and air conditioning, coffee grinder, microwave, and probably other things you'd like, just inquire.  Thanks for you time.

name: CLEAN, zen, sunny, private studio!
space: Private, clean, safe, cozy, zen studio apartment. Newly renovated, 4th floor walk-up. Located in the heart of the East Village (really in the heart..not too far east) - convenient neighborhood within walking distance of amazing NYC restaurants, boutiques, yoga studios, nail salons and other HOT neighborhoods (SoHo, Nolita, Lower East Side, Union Square and more!). Close to several subways and buses. Easy to catch a taxi, too! LOCATION is GREAT!! Laundromat on the block.  Coffee shops everywhere! Wine Bars galore. I have subletted my apartment several times in the past and have always had great experiences. I would love to keep it that way! Please be clean and responsible :)  -Apple TV -WiFi Please note: response time may be delayed due to travel.  I am available via email throughout your entire stay! PERFECT neighborhood for visitors! Walking distance from the hottest spots in NYC!

name: Sweet Super Bowl Accomodations
space: Small but clean and cozy studio with Queen bed & separate kitchen located in the heart of the West Village on one of the cutest streets.  Conveniently located to the West Side Highway, Greenpath, HighLine, Meatpacking District, Greenwich Village and Chelsea.  Steps away from some of the most quaint restaurants, tree-lined streets and both the 1/2/3 and A/C/E subway lines.  Less than 10 minute commute to Penn Station and 25 minutes to just about every neighborhood in midtown, upper west and downtown.

name: Homey Townhouse + PRIVATE Bathroom
space: Our listing is 100% LEGAL in NYC!   Relax in your comfortable, clean, cozy guest room with exclusive access to your own private luxurious bathroom in a large 2-floor, 2-bedroom apartment that has a landscaped patio. The centrally air-conditioned guestroom is in the rear of the apartment off the garden and is very quiet, well appointed and soothingly decorated.  The room contains a Full Size bed that sleeps two, TV, DVD player, WIFI, hair dryer and a closet outfitted with drawers and shelves and lots of hanging space.  Fresh linens and towels are provided.  A washer/dryer and iron are also available.

name: Big 2BR loft in _üof Williamsburg-5min to Manhattan
space: Spacious 2 bedroom loft in prime Williamsburg location. Lots of light coming from the windows in the living room and one of the bedrooms.  Both bedrooms are fully equipped with queen sized beds, and guests will be received with clean sheets and towels. Open kitchen and dinner table, one nice and clean bathroom. There is a projection screen in the living room and a futon that can fit 2 extra guests. Cool renovated building with an old freight elevator and awesome roof with a great view of the Manhattan skyline.

name: Country Blues
space: There are spacious rooms at SANKOFA ABAN,  each one filled with original details. Queen size and Double rooms are decorated where we start with the late 1800Û_s and continue 130 years later. (see REVIEWS) Most rooms have mirrored candlelight fireplace, parquet floors wedding cake design walls and original marble wash basins for personal use.
